Reviews.Title: “standard hotel”
Reviews.Author: patricia f
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel quite standard. We stayed in a king deluxe room which didnt have an impressive a view as the hotel made out but the standard was still good. However we were a bit upset to find a toenail under our sheets. They have a sign in the rooms saying that in order to conserve energy they only wash their sheets every 3 days but I would have imagined they changed the sheets in between customers. I phoned down to explain and was offered free breakfast which was nice if it wasnt for the fact that on our arrival we were already offered free breakfasts! The staff however was lovely and helpful and the room was nice but I wouldnt have expected to have body parts in the bed, biscuits would have been much more of a room welcome. Also we had to call down for permission to open a window. The hotel is quite far from the centre but a walkable distance and easy to get to by tram. The nice thing about it being far is that you really do get a nice peace and quiet when you sleep, until about 10am when the cleaners hoover in the coridoor and feel the need to bang the hoover right up against your door. Not the worst thing to happen as we needed a wake up call but again i would expect a higher standard from the Hilton. Worth staying in if you use all the ammenities, wonderful staff, nice area and clean rooms (except for the toenail)

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, bad internet!”
Reviews.Author: FlaviaGois
Reviews.Content: We spent a lovely weekend in Amsterdam, the Hotel was perfect, personal very attentive, the room was awesome, very plush and spacious, the only bad thing was the paid internet connection, for a Hotel of this level they should offer a better service.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Funky12
Reviews.Content: Arrived early a.m. after long haul flight from Melbourne Australia. Staff 5 star plus. Given early check in with an apparent upgrade. Reception,concierge, assistant and all F & B staff excelled. Room great, location- within walking distance to almost everything. Would reccomend this hotel without any heistation. One regret, unable to extend our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Doubts
Reviews.Content: I stayed with 3 friends on a weekend birthday break and thought the Hilton was just perfect for us. It's in a quiet residential neighbourhood but an easy tram ride to the centre. Rooms were immaculate and we had nice canal views. Staff were all fantastic, in particular breakfast team who were so so friendly on both mornings (particularly the chef who was on duty on 14 and 15 April - gold star award!) the breakfast buffet was beautifully presented and fresh even at the end of service (a late night on the town meant a late breakfast!) concierge and reception were also very friendly and welcoming at all times. A great stay, I'd certainly return and I've worked in the hotel industry for over 20 years (not for Hilton so this is an honest review) Well done to everyone at the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Place to stay xx”
Reviews.Author: Sarah J
Reviews.Content: The. Staff here are so professional would only stay here well s deserved 5 star rating great staff l

Reviews.Title: “We always stay here”
Reviews.Author: kuwait08
Reviews.Content: This is where John Lennon and Yoko Ono had their famous bed-in. Situated on a canal with swans depending on the season, this is a great hotel, quiet, convenient and comfortable. The staff is always lovely to us; the bar is comfy with a fire (but the food is just so-so), the Italian restaurant on sight is phenomenal. The best place to spend New Years' Eve--there's a party on the roof in the glassed-in area, and you can see the fireworks going off all over the city--for hours. You can walk to the Ryksmuseum on nice residential streets in just 15 minutes--since that's nearly next door to the Van Gogh museum, the same applies. These are small museums with intensely amazing work on view.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Easter Stay”
Reviews.Author: Ilovefoodnottingham
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay via hotwire on Saturday 7th April and we had a fantasic couple of days. From the airport we caught a train to amsterdam central station (very easy and hassle free). We then jumped on the number 5 tram to apollolaan. I would say this entire journey took roughly 30-40minutes and was enjoyable as we got to see the sights. The hotel was perfect, beautiful lobby area, speedy check in and the room was lovely. We had a canal facing room and at night the trees were lit by fairy light which looked wonderful. Although the hotel is not right in the centre it only takes 10minutes on the tram which is right by the hotel. For anyone visiting Amsterdam for the weekend I would highly recommend this hotel as a base!

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: London_Guy99
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hilton Amsterdam over the Easter weekend. The hotel is located in an up scale residential neighborhood just outside of central Amsterdam. Overall, I would say this is a solid 3 star property (definitely not a 5 star), but is rather expensive for what is offered. Pros: 1) Located in a quite residential neighborhood on a canal. Away from the crowds of central Amsterdam provides a peaceful setting. 2) Hotel was built several decades ago, but washroom in our room appears to have been newly renovated. 3) Easy parking right out front of hotel. 4) Easy access to central Amsterdam via tram stop just a short walk away. Tram passes can be purchased at concierge desk and charged to room. 5) Friendly and welcoming staff. 6) Hotel is very clean and well maintained. 7) Comfortable bed. Neutral 1) The hotels Roberto's Italian restaurant offers decent food, with decent service. Nothing to fault, but not spectacular either. Cons 1) Location outside of central Amsterdam may not be ideal for many travellers. Taxis are extremely expensive in Amsterdam if you choose not to take the tram. 2) No restaurants or cafes in direct vicinity of hotel. However, there is a Starbucks about a 5-10 min walk away which is a good alternative for a quick breakfast rather than pay for the over priced hotel buffet (see below). 3) Food prices are extremely expensive. 27 Euros for breakfast buffet, 23 Euros for a club sandwich. 4) Limited room service menu for breakfast (same price as breakfast buffet) 5) Their cafe closes on weekends. Strange. I imagine the cafe is on site to cater to business meetings during the week. Closing on weekend forces guests to choose expensive breakfast buffet or go elsewhere. 6) Parking at hotel also extremely expensive - 34 Euros per night. However, the hotel was gracious enough to not charge us on checkout. An appreciated gesture, but should be included in room rate. 7) 27 Euros for 24hrs of internet access. This seems to be the standard in all Hiltons, but internet access these days should be included in room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton As You Expect It To Be”
Reviews.Author: Jorganmeister
Reviews.Content: No queue at check-in. Always good for me after a long journey. Having my details already printed on the registration form - good. Being asked if I need the free internet codes - good. Access to the Executive Lounge - always very nice (primarily for the free beer, I'm sorry to say). About one minute from start to finish for the whole check-in process - works every time. A nice big room on the 8th floor - everything as it should be, modern, attractive, clean. The same in the bathroom. Dinner in Roberto's restaurant - again, excellent throughout. Very polite and friendly staff, good value set menu which didn't seem to stint on quality or portion size. I opted (as I normally do, when I can) for express checkout, request the final invoice to be sent to my email address. This arrived while I was in my taxi to the office. Why then, does it take the Hilton Metropole over a week (if I'm lucky) to do the same? Overall - a flawless night's stay, which I enjoyed very much.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stalisfield28
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here over 10 times in last few years. Always dxcellent service, food, rooms etc. exec lounge on roof top is best place to have breakfast with the rising sun. I fully recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: repb9
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Amsterdam and we stumbled across this hotel via hotwire and as per we got an amazing rate for our three night stay. I most say as other people have mentioned in their reviews, the outside of this hotel does NOT do it any justice. That said, once inside you'll be amazed. The Lobby is very grand and well yeah, very nice indeed. The staff on reception were very welcoming and polite & check in was very swift. Our room was 724, a standard room but very nice. Larger than expected, it had a decent view over the city. The bed was large and comfy, the bathroom was large and had various shampoos, shower gels and an ample supply of towels & bathrobes. Other people mentioned that this hotel is out of the city. For us it wasn't a big deal and we were glad to be away from the craziness of the city. It is only a short tram ride from the city, maybe 10 mins tops. There are plenty of little restaurants in the surrounding area and the neighbourhood is peaceful, clean & safe. Overall, this hotel was perfect for what we needed. Well done Hilton Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, out of the way”
Reviews.Author: Sean F
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. I don't know if it should be a 5 star, but definitely a 4.5. The staff was very accomodating as they kept offering their help. The lobby is very nice and spacious and there is parking right out in front. It sits on one of the canals, and I think you can take canal cruises from there (I couldn't tell if they were doing them, but there were a couple docked right outside the hotel). It is very close to 3 different tram lines so it makes it easy to get to the center. The rooms are spacious and well furnished. The rooms are rich in wood decour and the shower is great. It is pretty quiet so you shouldn't have a problem getting a good night's sleep. It is also in a very safe area, a rather upscale residential area (it actually kind of sticks out from the rest of the buildings around it). Now for some of the negatives: if you are looking to walk to only thing, the only thing that is really within walking distance is Vondel Park. You have to take a tram to everything, but you do therefore save something ($) than if this was in the city center. Another negative is that a person from the housekeeping staff came in about 10 minutes after we arrived to drop off another bath robe (I had a friend who was also staying there that happened to him and she came in when he was taking a shower - maybe we just had bad luck). Our room was also very hot when we got in, and we turned down the heat all the way before we left for the evening. When we got back (relatively late) turning down the heat didn't do a lot, but was bearable. We didn't contact the front desk because it was so late. I'm guessing that this isn't standard for all rooms. Here is my recommendation: stay here if the price is right for you, you don't care if you are not in walking distance, and you are looking for a nice hotel in amsterdam. Do not stay here if you are looking for an affordable hotel close to the old area of amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “It's a Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Bazrat92
Reviews.Content: Clean and comfortable hotel, very good restaurant. The food was the highlight for me. The room was as expected at a Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly helpful and wonderful people”
Reviews.Author: JoanneHagger
Reviews.Content: A brilliant trip for my sisters birthday to truly one of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed in. It's a little bit out of the way from all of the mayhem of the city which I liked because it allowed escape after a days sightseeing. The trams were easily negotiated and several stops were around the hotel with just a short walk to the main entrance. As my husband is a Hilton honours holder we were entitled to visit to the onsite health centre and had a great morning chilling out and using the sauna and steam room. The bar area was very welcoming although â‚¬40 for 3 x Gin and Tonics was a little on the steep side!! My friend lost her purse in a cab on the way back from a restaurant (she is now banned from having pink daiquiri drinks!!) and the concierge guys located the cab driver and got her purse back untouched!!! just before we had to leave for the airport. Gio was fantastic and he got several hugs and kisses for helping us out. A absolute credit to the Hilton group and would return again

Reviews.Title: “Out Of The Way, But In A Good Way.”
Reviews.Author: LVGambler
Reviews.Content: Like I said, this hotel is on the edge of the city, BUT, is steps away from the amazing Tram system. You'll get anywhere you want to be within 5 mins. The staff are a tad pretentious and for some reason have a non-smoking weed with on grounds. Not even outside. The rooms were nice, clean and modern. With gorgeous views. I would stay here again. Plus it's away from the canal hotels where all the rats and mice are.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice for Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Lmadrid
Reviews.Content: Although this Hilton is not exactly in the turistc distric of Amsteradm,but it is an excelent option to travelers willing to stay nearby the center area, but away from the noise and traffic. With excellent services and accomodations, it is located nearby three main tram lines, which makes a breeze the access to the center area of Amsterdam. Walking distance from the main museuns ans located in a beatiful and quite neighbourhood, this Hilton property has it all. The executive club at the top floor is a must see for the view and ultracelan decor.

Reviews.Title: “True 5 Star Experience”
Reviews.Author: xpsoliver
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip to Europe, I stayed at a variety of four and five star hotels. The five star Hilton Amsterdam clearly distinguished itself from the four star hotel, and provided a truly special experience. The exterior pictures of the hotel really don't do it justice. Everything inside this Hilton is beautifully designed, modern and luxurious. The executive room upgrade from my gold status provided me one of the nicest rooms I've ever stayed in. It even rivals the executive room I had at the Millenium Hilton in Bangkok. I had a 9th floor canal view room, and the views were remarkable. I could see almost all of Amsterdam. The bed was extremely comfortable, the TV was a brand new lcd LG 40", and the bathroom 100% marble. Everything had a recently renovated, modern and luxurious feel. Concierge provided a complimentary rental of a US power adapter for my laptop. The executive lounge was one of the nicest I've ever been too. On the top 10th floor, it had panoramic views of the entire city. It was beautiful, and offered a wide array of food and drink options. From 6pm-10pm, there was not just basic beer and wine, but champagne, many varieties of wine, and six different kinds of liquor. A wealth of different kinds of food was served. The fitness center had a very relaxing Turkish steam bath and sauna, that I had all to myself. With silver, gold or platinum honors status, it is free to use, and open late. This Hilton provided me with some of the best service I've had the privilege of enjoying. Marian, of the executive lounge staff, was one of the nicest people I've ever met, and went above and beyond anything I could have expected to make sure I enjoyed my stay. The front desk manager also went the extra mile. Between the modern, luxurious accommodations, numerous amenities, wonderful views, world class executive lounge, and service that went above anything I've ever experienced, I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Hilton Amsterdam, and would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Everything and more :D”
Reviews.Author: MichaelaMoore1987
Reviews.Content: I have recently just returned from a 4 day trip to Amsterdam where we stayed in the most pleasant and helpful hotel we've stayed in! The rooms were big and clean with lovely views from the 9th floor over looking the canal to which we were able to see most of the city. We had bath robes and slippers which can in very useful on a morning :) We had access to the executive lounge, your staff up there need to be commended for their helpfulness and kindness. They were very attentive and couldn't do more for you! My friend injured herself while we were in Amsterdam the staff organised extra pillows in our room so she cold rest her ankle, along with plenty of ice. Special thanks to Marion, a great smily face when your feeling bait delicate after the night before :) wiljam ( in training ) sorry I'm not sure how to spell his name! A pleasant young man who you would think had been working for the hotel for years! And steph who was able to give knowledge of the city and there for a friendly chat on an evening :) We hired bikes from the hotel which we enjoyed throughout our whole stay! A great way to see the city, very safe, sometimes I think it's safer on the bike instead of walking! overall a great city and great hotel, would definitely recommend and would stay again Thanks for a lovely stay Amy Kent and Michaela Moore room 905 xxx

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Hiltons”
Reviews.Author: Lizi090411
Reviews.Content: We took our son and his girlfriend to Amsterdam for their join 40th birthdays weekend of 18th February. Situated in a quieter part of the City, the hotel is beautiful. The rooms were spacious and the staff probably the most helpful, attentive, well-mannered people we have every met. Breakfast at the sensible time - up to 11.00 - on Sunday was very welcome as we had sailed overnight on the Ferry Friday 17th, returning overnight on 19th so the Sunday was our only 'rest' morning. Breakfast was fantastic - and the chef asked if he could organise some extra, like Eggs Benedict and other specials.The garden at the back looked stunning (even at this time of year) and they can organise canal cruises from the jetty there. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff and should we be in Amsterdam again, that would be our preference to stay in. One drawback - no swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic stay little pricey!”
Reviews.Author: SamSamDublin
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last feburary over valentines weekend with my partner, The front off the hotel doesnt look much but inside wow! beautiful decor staff where really friendly and welcoming, extra items i had requested where in my room on arrival which was great. we had a beautiful spacious room on one off the top floors over looking the canal with amazing views over the city. The restaurant food is lovely if a little expencive. The hotel offered a turn down service each evening off our stay. The first morning valentines day we decided to have breakfast in bed which was lovely breakfast was served on a table with flowers in the room, It did cost little over 20 euro to have breakfast deliveried to the room so the next mornin we ate in the restaurant. The hotel is a bit out off the main city centre about 5 mins walk to the tram stop number 5 will bring you right into the city in 10-15mins staying in this fantastic hotel we did not mind the short travel into city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel (even if I was sharing a room with my boss!)”
Reviews.Author: beesyellow22
Reviews.Content: In December 2011, I stayed at the Hilton Amsterdam with my new company. We were there for one night and all of us had dinner in Roberto's restaurant. Overall, the stay was a very enjoyable experience (and not only because I didn't have to pay!), with a swift check-in and very well appointed rooms. Decor was very pleasant and the room was fresh and modern with a nice cosy feel to it. The bathroom was a good size and featured a powerful shower situated over the bath. The view from our room was pretty outstanding, affording quite the vista looking out over (some of) the city. I suppose that really the only negative I could give the hotel is that it is quite far away from the city sights. We walked and it took us about 45 minutes to get into the main part of Amsterdam. I would find it difficult to fault the Hilton Amsterdam in any way, and I certainly think it upholds the Hilton tradition extremely well. In the evening, my work colleagues and I ate dinner at Roberto's restaurant (in the hotel) which, as the name suggests, is an Italian affair. The food was very good, although I suspect it would have been even better had we not been eating en masse. The following morning (after an excellent night's sleep) we enjoyed a real 5-star quality breakfast, with the chef coming around to each table individually to ask for your egg-based preferences - a nice touch! And of course, for fans of The Beatles, the Hilton Amsterdam is the famous hotel in which John and Yoko staged their legendary 'bed in' back in 1969 (although I forgot to look for their room when I stayed there!). Overall: a great hotel, but not so great if you want to be close to the city highlights.

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated stay”
Reviews.Author: Cestovatel_W
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel. It's located outside the city centre and main attraction areas in a nice and quite residential area, to get to the city centre you need to take a tram (kinda expensive) and it takes 15 minutes. So if it's your first Amsterdam visit i would recommend to find smth more centrally located, otherwise a high hotel is good. Rooms are nice, cozy in dark traditional Dutch colours and well equipped. The bed was really comfortable for sleep. The breakfast was amazing and from huge windows you can see taking off and approaching Schiphol planes. All services 9restaurant, boat cruise, the internet) are unbelievable expensive, like 17 eur for 1 hour of slow wifi. Crazy.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and easy to get to from Central Train station”
Reviews.Author: gmta
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying the staff was wonderfull. The manager should get a raise because everyone was helpful and went above and beyond. We were offered sparkling wine at breakfest, dinner recommendations in the executive lounge and turndown service in the room. From the outside the hotel is nothing special, but the rooms are well done. If you are gold member or stay on the executive level, the lounge is a bit small but very well supplied. The gym is very nice and large by Hilton standards again it is free for gold + members. Yes, this property is not downtown. However you can take the 16 tram that drops you off at Emmastraat station. When you get out of Central train station - follow 'tram' sign outside. All the trams stop here. You can buy a 1hr (2.6 Euro), 24hr (7 Euro), or 48hr ticket in the office just outside of the train station get in line or buy at the ticket machine (its easy). Or you can buy a 1hr ticket from the driver, not sure if you can buy 1-2 day passes from the driver. It takes 20 minutes to get from Central Train station to Emmastraat. When you get off the tram at Emmerstraat look in the direction the tram is traveling, now look left, you can see the hotel 2 blocks away on your left had side. I would recommend using the trams instead of a hop-on-hop off bus. The Hitlon has a map the lists all the sites and tram/metro routes. Restaurant at Hilton is fine for breakfast but for dinner take a 5 minute walk to Bella Vista - good Italian. Good value and great people - always a plus when going on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Very good!!”
Reviews.Author: wenbrug
Reviews.Content: We go to this hotel each summer because you can park your boat in the little harbour behind the hotel. It isnÂ´t cheap and the rooms are not very big, but you have that with all the better hotels in Amsterdam. The room is really wel appointed with a very nice bed and a very good bathroom with everything you need. In the summer you can enjoy a drink on the terrace and in a few minutes by taxi you are in the center of Amsterdam. In the area of the hotel (Oud-Zuid) you have the PC Hooftstraat and the Museumplein. The hotel has a really good breakfast buffet with everything you can think of.

Reviews.Title: “Business”
Reviews.Author: 64robert64
Reviews.Content: I have been there for a couple of nights business in October 2011 The Hotel is nice and rooms are clean and spacious. Unfortunately is a bit far from the centre of town, there is not mauch to do in the sorroundings Tram/bus was not working at night and taxy can take ages to arrive at the hotel to pick you up. Internet in the room is very expensive

Reviews.Title: “A very nice place, but don't be late at the bar!”
Reviews.Author: Didi_Thurau
Reviews.Content: Hilton Hotels are sometimes difficult to judge: some are purely business-oriented, this is providing very high standards. The room was very good, the service also. I was there on an annual conference with a big group, and the Hotel reached its limits: Only two small elevators, but no stairs is not enough, if 200 people leave at the same time a presentation. Two aspects were strange: before the first presentation we had a hotel manager informing the group for full five minutes on fire escapes. Is this dutch law? Secondly, the bar closes at 1am. Well we arrived 10 minutes too late and couldn't persuade the stubborn bartender to hand out a last drink. As this closing hour is not dutch law, I was somewhat astonished that the Hotel couldn't be more flexible with a customer group, which easily spend â‚¬100.000 on the stay. Still, i enjoyed the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay, however quite far to city center”
Reviews.Author: roomservice99
Reviews.Content: Like: room decoration, view, concierge service Dislike: location, note that you need the tram to get anywhere. 5 min walking distance to tram stop. We came from the Airport by train. It's all straight from the train station, easy to find. However, it's like a 30 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good Hilton hotel”
Reviews.Author: riverside-london
Reviews.Content: Despite sixties office block appearance, Hilton Amsterdam is a very smart hotel inside. Positives: -Well equipped rooms - Great views over canal - Excellent restaurant - Excellent service Negatives: -Long way from city centre. Good location for business park but not good if you're a tourist - Wifi and Internet didn't work properly my first night, also very expensive per hour - Air conditioning noisey (I had to switch off at night), also didn't seem to warm up my room no matter how high I set the temperature

Reviews.Title: “What a memorble stay!”
Reviews.Author: traveller E
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hilton Amsterdam just before new year's eve. The Hotel is well located just out side the city centre but easily accessible. I have received a very warm welcome at arrival from Michael at the reception who always been extremely helpful during my stay. I have been upgraded to a deluxe room and received a lovely welcome ameity and a welcome letter. Just 2 minutes I arrived to my Hotel room I received a phone call from Michael if everything was ok with my room! What a service! I really felt like a real VIP guest! The concierge was extremely helpful giving lots of tourist information to us and happily printed out any maps we needed! The breakfast was a real delight, I have been greeted by two amazing, cheerful italian women who couldn't been more helpful. They even offered me a champagne with my breakfast! They simply made my day with their friendliness and helpfulness! The bar food and as always, the service was just perfect. All together I hardly wanted to leave, I simply loved this Hotel and would highly recommend it to anyone to stay there! The service is expectional!Thank you for my memorable stay and can not wait to be back again!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Jonathanyoud
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, full of charm and character, beautiful picture windows, spacious rooms that rather make the room feel like an apartment, lovely staff, excellent room service, helpful concierge that make you feel at home from the outset. A Fantastic stay, go there!

Reviews.Title: “One of my best stays ever”
Reviews.Author: renaldoc
Reviews.Content: Stayed over the new year holiday. Very friendly staff, eating at roberto new years day morning was great Marianne from the staff was helpful during breakfast . The location is great , calm , quiet and easily accessible . Every night there was a little surprise in the room, they were all delicious . Will return again and again

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Mtravelling
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, clean and in a great location if you want to be away from the main city centre. The service at the hotel was good, everyone is friendly and helpful. The rooms are comparable to a regular hotel room in North America EXCEPT the beds are TWIN size. So be aware when booking. We booked through Expedia and choose 8 ppl and the rooms defaulted to 2 rooms. When we arrived at the hotel they informed us that a room of that size does not exist - the max. is 3 ppl in one room and that is with two twins pushed together and a cot. The issue was resolved after a bit of a wait in the lobby. Down side: it is a LONG WALK from the city centre and they charge for internet use (e.g. 6 euros for online check in and printing of boarding pass which only took 5 mins to do). The shops and restaurants are pricey in this area (more so then city centre) Up side: If you get a room on the "back" of the hotel you face the canal and have an amazing view of the entire city. Walking distance to Tram and you could walk to Van Gogh Museum area if you like to walk.

Reviews.Title: “nice staff and service”
Reviews.Author: Brunostopazzolli
Reviews.Content: Best location and service!!! They had even a fitness club right next to the hotel and off course we rented a bike!!

Reviews.Title: “Classik but Warm”
Reviews.Author: Papayan
Reviews.Content: located in one of the nicest area of the city an Near to the site seeing areas and have a view of canals...furnitures are like classik Hiltons but staffs are good.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay during short business stop-over”
Reviews.Author: BelgianInIstanbul
Reviews.Content: I stayed here really very short time, and cannot comment on all services of the hotel. I arrived in evening after half an hour drive from airport (approx 40 EUR). Service at check-in was friendly and efficient, offering me to enroll for HH. Knowledge of Dutch was not strong, we live in an internationalised world... Room is good, decent size, and nicely decorated. I liked lay-out of bathroom and the possibility of ironing, as well as the amenities (such as soap from Crabtree&Evelyn, and shampoo / shower gel etc of Peter Thomas Roth. The airconditioning was somewhat noisy I found, so I switched it off. TV is somewaht smallish, and I think they could have a larger choice of channels, especially in multicultural and international Netherlands. Bed was very good, with pillows enough to sit up while reading. Given short night I did not take breakfast, and did not try restaurant although it should be good as I saw Gault Millau signage. Supposedly 15 minutes walking from city center and close to Vondelpark. Very quiet around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room size/service/menu especially for Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: RT1971
Reviews.Content: I live in The Netherlands so I stay at various hotels if I want a night in Amsterdam. While the location is not quite as good as some other hotels - this place has amazing rooms (although they could use an update), great food, a great bar - and unusually in Holland - great service. If you come in the Spring/Summer/Fall - the location issue is easily alleviated by the free bikes that can be borrowed from the Hotel - in 10 minutes you will be in front of the various museums and sights on a real Dutch "Fiets." Otherwise - the very convenient tram is only a five minute walk - two long blocks - away. I strongly recommend and will not return to the Pulitzer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and location”
Reviews.Author: 2Pandas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 3 nights on a sightseeing trip. The staff were all very professional and courteous. The check-in was efficient and our luggage was delivered as soon as we arrived at our room. The restaurant, Roberto's, staff were cheerful and welcoming. The concierge was efficient with our dining and transport reservations. The room and bed linen were clean and well-maintained. The bathroom was updated and comfortable. The TV in our room was small. However, the internet and hookup was up-to-date and proficiently set up. The hotel location was wonderful. It was in a tranquil area and within 10-15 minutes walk to the beautiful Vondelpark (eqv to Central Park NY & Hyde Park London). In another direction, its 10-15 minutes walk to the Van Gogh Museum and Rijksmuseum. The rooms on the canal side had a great view of the canal and stately residences. Downtown was about 20 minutes away (5 minutes walk to the tram station and 15 minutes on the tram). We were a bit concerned initially about getting to and fro the downtown district after reading some reviews here, but we found that it was a breeze with Amsterdam's efficient transportation. We found taking the tram with the locals part of the charm and experience. Besides, while it was great to enjoy the sights and sounds of downtown, living there might not be as enjoyable. Professional and courteous staff made our stay here relaxing and our commute stress free. We certainly recommend it and will return ourselves when the opportunity arises.

Reviews.Title: “Dinner cruise highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: bmah
Reviews.Content: I stayed in on business about a month ago and was pleased. The staff was friendly, rooms were nice, food was good and the beer was cold. We did the boat dinner through the canals and that was by far my favorite. It was chilly so the boat was covered. I recommend going to the back of the boat and actually take in the sites. Even more impressive than the sites was the captain's ability to navigate the canals... It was a great way to see the city since I was only there for 2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Business Stay”
Reviews.Author: mahee_37
Reviews.Content: Very Charming and good for Business Stay. Executive Club feels a little less staffed as you couldnt find help when you need. But good set up out there. Friendly staff at check in and being a Diamond HHonors, the upgrade is granted. The TV surprisingly is a small 20 inch one. English channels are very less, thats one thing Hilton needs to look at. Overall a good stay...

Reviews.Title: “Such a beautiful hotel. and the staff was extremely helpful.....”
Reviews.Author: bocaguy46
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was great ... close to the airport, and could get on the express train that does 240 mph they say... I know it is fast.... The coffee shops are fun.... the tulips at the airport you can smell miles away... The people are so friendly... in this huge airport mall is the biggest I have ever been in has a shopping mall with anything you want... The Heinekin Beer there is not what we get in the states... Aluninium Bottles, the cheeses are some of the best I have ever eaten,,,,I want to get back on the plane now and go back... I love amstredam and the air , and the friendly people,,,,

Reviews.Title: “Great quite city location”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelingPickles
Reviews.Content: This is one of the better Hiltons. It a clean, upto date and serves great food.

Reviews.Title: “As expected but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Viking-Danes-7
Reviews.Content: Compared to the price level the hotel did ot offer anything extraordinary. The location is in a quiet area near many nice cafees and shops. However, it is too far to walk to the central Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with good service”
Reviews.Author: CeeCee1982
Reviews.Content: I have stayed for a weekend at this hotel and liked it very much. The rooms are good (go for rooms with canal view!) and the employees are friendly and helpful. The hotel is located near Vondelpark and the museums, so it's a little far to walk to the center of Amsterdam. However, taxis are at EUR 10-15 (EUR 25 to the airport) and it takes 10 mins to go to Dam Square by car. Tram station is also close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service but Tiny Room and Poor Location”
Reviews.Author: Professor44
Reviews.Content: I was booked into the Hilton Amsterdam by a client because I wanted quiet. Service, both in the hotel and Roberto's, the restaurants, was excellent. But the room! A tiny closet, which of course came with the usual ironing board. A bathroom with about enough room for one person to stand (fortunately I was by myself). A small room, with a small television (I have seen larger on Singapore Airlines). A dresser with two drawers. And not particularly near anything. No restaurants close by (of course that depends on how one defines "close"). About a 12 Euro cab ride into the main part of the city. But the room was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Classic 5* in beautiful location with superb italian restaurant”
Reviews.Author: H08H
Reviews.Content: The Hilton is iconic in Amsterdam south beautifully situated with nice garden and private dock for canal cruises. The terace could be best place in Amsterdam on a sunny warm day. The lobby hall is inviting open and light with straight acces to the garden terace. The hotel bar is a good place to unwind, have a glass and small bite. Hotel restaurant Roberto's a must! Superb food with nice wine slection. Staff is professional and courtious. The executive lounch on the 10th is extremely pleasant and offers good views. The down side of this hotel must be the rooms. They are somewhat dated allthough this is subject to taste. In the airconditioning system one cannot help but see the age of the hotel. The room is warmed through old fashioned wall radiators and has a AC to cool. This can lead to radiator warming your room and AC trying to cool it at same time. Radiator cannot be switched off compleyely. Windows only open on request and are closed by the maid as soon as you leave the room. It leads to very dusty uncomfortable air inside. For people w resparitory problems a serious issue.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: plunge
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night for business. Convenient location for business in Southern central part of the city - close enough to the tourist attractions. Rooms look a bit tired and probably ripe for a refurbishment.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, well-appointed, nice location just outside of central city”
Reviews.Author: KYknowitall
Reviews.Content: Such a very nice hotel. With choice of two very nearby trams you can be in heart of Amsterdam within 15 easy minutes, older building but is very tastefully appointed to feel fresh but light. Situation on canal with a green terrace along the private small marina is wonderful. Did not try the restaurants but as HHonors Diamond was upgraded to highest floor and access to Executive Lounge which is the nicest I've experienced yet. Wonderful foods throughout the day but especially a gracious and graceful breakfast and an enjoyable evening reception. Nice views of the city from the Exec Lounge, too. The concierge staff was extremely helpful and genuinely friendly, treating my unremarkable presence with as much attention as they did to the businessmen and dignitaries. The check-in was very efficient and friendly and, as our room was not quite ready, we were sent to the Executive Lounge for coffee and fresh snacks for the hour wait. This was fine since it was raining and we'd just come from the Thalys train and needed a bit of a decompression time. Did not use the fitness facility, which is an additional charge if you are not a Gold or Diamond with HHonors, but looked around and it seemed quite comprehensive and up-to-date. The wireless internet was quick enough and reliable enough for my and my sister's needs. This, too, was free as a Diamond but would have been the usual European charge of around 20+ Euro per day. I would be reluctant to pay for a stay here but as a points redemption for a vacation I think this is the obvious choice in The Netherlands. You will not be disappointed for the bang for your points, especially if you are Diamond with Hilton HHonors.

Reviews.Title: “Better than some London Hiltons”
Reviews.Author: Dibbley
Reviews.Content: I have had the pleasure of staying here on a couple of occasions, and will be returning at the end of November! It's true the hotel is not in the centre of town, but a 15 minute tram ride ( or 25 Euro) is not to much to pay for peace and quiet, I have always found all of the staff to be friendly and helpful and the view of the canal is lovely. I have never been upgraded, but that doesn't bother me as the rooms I have been allocated have been more than acceptable. I think I caught them unawares last time and was sent water and chocolates about 10 minutes after checking in, but that's because I am currently a gold member. Nice touch, it all helps when you are away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service is an unknown concept here”
Reviews.Author: snickersau80
Reviews.Content: Desk staff unwilling to help with minor issue. I was told on 2 separate occasions by the desk clerk that he was "too busy" and come back later,( the lobby was empty with no one else in sight! He just could not be bothered! Terrible attitude!) A different desk clerk was able to help later the following day without any issues. Not sure why the original person couldn't help to begin with, as the circumstances the next day were the same, no changes. But for some reason, the next day, it was OK. The property itself was OK. A little out of the way...time spent getting into town(i.e., Dam Square), either walking or tram, could have been better spent actually being IN town. If you are going to do anything in town, just allow for the time to get there and back and be mindful of the tram schedules. The hotel does NOT have a shuttle, which would have been helpful. As a Gold Honors Member for 20years, I have never experienced such poor service, quite the opposite as the experience of travellingangie. No tarts, no Exec lounge access. Awful experience. Marriott has 2 wonderful properties there..I almost booked..next time I will, definitely!!

Reviews.Title: “4 star room, 5 star service”
Reviews.Author: VfB 1893
Reviews.Content: I spent a weekend at the Hilton Amsterdam and must rate it with a 5 overall, although some things are definitely not 5 star. The room was clean, nice pillow menu, generous towels and a comfortable bed made the room a good 4 star room. The tea/coffee maker was very convenient, but the bathrooom has a tub and a shower curtain which is simply not up to date or meets a 5 star hotel. The view towards the canal is worth the money - go for that if you can! The reason why I did rate this hotel a 5 star was the service. Extremely friendly, extremely corteus and funny breakfast staff really made our days. The breakfast selection was superb, including gluten free dietary breads and specially prepared food on request. Simply great. The location is not too far out, and actually in the surrounding of a very nice park - we walked the way downtown and cannot understand people complaining about the distance to the inner city. Would we return? Yes we would - and that says it all.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cholupo
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my wife for few days. The hotel is located in a quiet, green area, close to the business area. You can walk to the museums (15 min) or can take the streetcar three blocks from the hotel. The service is very good, rooms are comfortable, and the small cafeteria at the lobby level is very nice to have breakfast or just to spend some relaxing time drinking coffee or tea. I definitely recommend this hotel either for business or pleasure

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel...I cannot say enough good things”
Reviews.Author: travellingangie
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Amsterdam at 9am and were lucky enough that Hilton could give us an early check in. They couldn't promise it, of course, until they knew for sure, at the last minute, but it all worked out in the end and it was the start of a great visit with them. If you are flying in, you take the train from Schiphol to station Zuid. Then, from Zuid, you take the #5 tram (and trust me, just plan on taking the tram everywhere and go get a GVB pass for unlimited use) and exit on Apollolaan. I think this is the most economical route to get there as the shuttle was 15Euros per person. It is a 1/4 mile down the road on the right, past the big turtle with the guy on top statue. The room was a nice size (king bed) and the bathroom was a decent size, giant by European standards. Your room key is key there. You have to use it to get anywhere in the elevators and if you have executive lounge access, you will need it enabled for that. The first day, we checked in early, showered and left for the remainder of the afternoon. If you can swing it, ask for a canal view room. We had it and it was fantastic to look out the window every day and see the canal, which is the heart of Amsterdam. When we returned, they left us a tart on our bed, which was a fantastic surprise that we would be treated to a few more times before the visit was over. We slept great an enjoyed the free wifi that comes with being a Hilton Gold member. Everyone on staff was great from the doormen to the housekeeping staff...I cannot think of a single experience where I did not have a positive feeling in talking with or dealing with this staff. As gold members, we were also given access to the Executive Lounge and it was well worth it. Each day, they do a very nice set up there with chicken skewers, pastry puffs (savory), chips, nuts, cheese, sodas, beer, wine, and a variety of alcohols for drinks. Another absolutely awesome perk to being a gold member is the fantastic buffet breakfast they do each day. We really enjoyed the selection and service every day. They also offer this for those willing to pay for it, as well. It is a good selection of scrambled and boiled eggs, bacon, sausage, hash brown potatoes, beans, toast, croissant, muffins, suikerwafels (which are my absolute new favorite thing in the world), pancakes, fruits, yogurt, oatmeal, cold cereal and cold cuts. They also have tea, coffee, milk and juice available. Without a doubt, Hilton was a fantastic stay and well worth the points we used to do so. If I ever get back, I look forward to staying here again!! What a great time we had in Amsterdam, in part due to the care Hilton took.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: OxfordFloyd
Reviews.Content: A refined business-focused hotel, where the staff outnumbered the guests! We were well looked after but nothing is cheap and added to the location, you might need to work a little harder to find good local fare (try Cornelis Schuytstraat - excuse my Dutch - for de Joffers which is a lovely bistro to watch the world go by on bicycles and there is also a nice Sardinian restaurant there). However we didnt feel the location was such a drawback: 10-15 minutes walk to the museums and 40 to the centre via the 9 straats region. It also meant the hotel was quiet and away from the craziness of the Centrum of Amsterdam. Get a canal view room as you have a great view over Amsterdam and Dam Square funfair in the distance. The location also puts you close to Artichoc (141 Konninginneweg) where you will find mushrooms, conkers, clogs, iphones, dates, etc all made out of chocolate; then burn off the calories in the park next door.

Reviews.Title: “A great time in Amsterdam....”
Reviews.Author: Pacifica911
Reviews.Content: We spend 3 nights in the Hilton Amsterdam this month. We booked through Expedia and got a great deal especially since this is a 5 star hotel. We had a great view overlooking the canal and city. The bed was very comfortable, and we got a king bed. I was worried we may have to have 2 twins. Although it would have been nice to know the location was a bit farther away from the actual city center, it was easy to use the tram to get everywhere. And quite honestly, after spending the whole day downtown with all the stimulation, it was nice to come back to the hotel and have a quiet night. The service was also great and very accomodating. Everyone speaks english. We used the automatic minibar only to store some food and drinks we had bought from the local store, and because we moved some of the items, our bill was $42 for 4 items, but they cleared it off when I expained what happened. There is not much "included" in the hotel, as I have been to many all inclusives, this is not the case. It cost us 30euros for the taxi ride to the airport. But I guess that's the price of Amsterdam......have fun and don't be shy........

Reviews.Title: “In need of a new interior decorator!”
Reviews.Author: Charlie1001
Reviews.Content: This is an efficient, comfortable business hotel situated in the suburbs of Amsterdam. Don't go there if you are in Amsterdam to see the cultural attractions, as you risk being disappointed. But for business it's a sensible choice. The staff are friendly, the Italian restaurant is good and there is even an outside terrace to enjoy on a summer's evening. But, while the lobby is quite stylish, the rooms that I have stayed in there have all been in need of a makeover. The walls are brown, the carpets have a striped brown pattern, the Hilton regulation furniture is dark brown and, you guessed it, the curtains are brown. The result is, well, very brown and very offputting to spend time in. So please Mr Hilton go out and hire yourself a new interior decorator and cheer this place up. Oh and one more thing, please stop charging for wifi and visits to the health centre.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, outside the city, nice quiet town around it”
Reviews.Author: bordeauxbound
Reviews.Content: This is a solid professionally run hotel located 1/2 mile or so form the action of Amsterdam. It's quiet there as it's a residential street, so if that's NOT what you want, pay heed. You'll be grabbing a tram/taxi to get back and forth. On the other hand if that's what you want, then this hotel is right for you. Also, the area that is close to the hotel has a lot of nice local shops and restaurants, which give you more of a taste of what life is really like outside the city itself. Something that makes no sense to me, however, is the fact that they haven't converted the roof deck into a bar/restaurant area. It seems like a no-brainer, great view, etc., but instead they have a very small executive club on the top of the hotel, but it's enclosed and you can't go outside. Professional staff throughout

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: abt9904
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the executive rooms and it was wonderful. Great view of the city, very clean, very comfy bed, AC in the rooms and blackout curtains. The staff was extremely pleasant and all spoke English. Just be sure you are aware of where the hotel is located. It was about a 25 minute train ride to the Central train station and the surrounding area.

Reviews.Title: “Simply wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: FAY1357
Reviews.Content: We truly enjoyed staying in this great location with amazing service, gorgeous outdoor lawn( very rare in Amsterdam) and awesome restaurant. Some rooms have a balcony and the ones without balcony are just as good. The executive rooms are also great since guests can use the club room throughout the day. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Diesel77
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in August, the interior of the hotel was very nice, beautiful lobby and the room (was an exec room so can't comment on standard rooms) was lovely too, there were strawberries in our room on arrival, huge comfy bed and linen, even a pillow menu which we didn't use. Spacious, clean modern bathroom. Breakfast at the hotel was good, just like most Hiltons. Friendly, helpful staff. We didn't bring a car but you can park at the hotel which I believe is quite expensive thirty something euros per night). Location wise, it is a 7 min walk to the nearest tram and then 15 mins on the tram to the centre. Very easy to get to from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “our home in amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: worldtravellerfrance
Reviews.Content: For years we have been coming back to this modern, classy and luxurious Hilton Hotel, in the upscale neighbourhood of Amsterdam, and not without reason. Parking, helpful and loyal doormen who welcome you back, efficient check in, and a patio bar terrace, overlooking the private boated harbour, and an excellent breakfast buffet. International staff, an Italian restaurant as well as a cosy bar. Comfortable rooms, bikes available to move around and to discover all of Amsterdam. A good mix between business and tourist hotel, where free wireless internet would be appreciated by all. If ever the hotel would have a private gym, it would be perfect. Still, it is our most favourite hotel in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: Caturman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Amsterdam for a trip to the Concert Gebouw in Amsterdam wih my wife and parents. The hotel is located in a quiet and rich part of Amsterdam, called Oud - Zuid. It's actually quite close to some of the highlights of Amsterdam, the Concertgebouw, Vondepark and the Rijksmuseum are in walking distance. The main plusses of this hotel are: - very nice and helpful staff - excellent breakfast, it's not cheap but worth the money in my opinion. - the overall atmosphere of the hotel and the location - the beds and view The rooms are not very big, but quite comfortable. I can recommend staying here !

Reviews.Title: “Take That weekend”
Reviews.Author: Greeklady55555
Reviews.Content: Wow,wow,and Wow,,stayed in this hotel for one night before travelling onto Dusseldorf,,I really can't praise this hotel enough,,the room was gorgeous and so beautifully decorated, everything from a pillow menu to a soap menu,robe and slippers,mini bar,tv,,just fab,,the breakfast is out of this world,the scrambled eggs are to die for! Made to feel like someone special at all times,,the service is 1st class,,even managed to have a sneaky peek at John and Yoko's room which is now a honeymoon suite,,Thank You for that. I know where we are staying next time we visit Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “If it's Good Enough for John and Yoko...”
Reviews.Author: AjiChombo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I chose this hotel to stay in by pure luck when we booked the 'Mystery Hotel' option of a well known travel website for a fantastic rate. Wow. It did not disappoint at all. It is not in the city centre proper, but it is rather conveniently located in the outskirts between the glitz of steel and glass of the financial district and a quiet residential district; and still within touching distance of the city centre (a short bus or tram ride away). If you are a fan of more sedate surroundings, this is a very good option. The room we stayed in was very nice, large and comfortable; with all the trimmings (TV, minibar, iron, extra pillows, bathroom goodies). It had a fantastic view of the canal that runs behind the hotel. It felt extremely peaceful and serene (I can see why John and Yoko chose it for their 'peaceful protest'), even in the midst of a high flying, paparazzo filled, ultra chic fashion party which was going on one of the nights we stayed there. The breakfast was lovely and filling, with a very good variety to satisfy all tastes and palates. Friendly and helpful staff who are fully aware they are working at a Hilton's and ensure that the service provided is top class. All in all, a great place for a relaxing, pampered retreat if travelling to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a nice part of town”
Reviews.Author: Debmike
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Amsterdam Hilton from August 31 to September 4, 2011. The hotel is outside of the downtown area, easily accessable by tram or bus. The hotel is very well maintained and the staff are very attentive and helpful. As Hilton Honors Gold members we were upgraded to an executive room with executive lounge access, we were also given access to breakfast at Roberto's the upscale restaurant in the hotel. The lounge is located on the top of the hotel with nice views but is small not cozy, not really a place to hang out in like some lounges. Breakfast in Roberto's was fantastic!! The staff is very helpful. We simply asked at the front desk if we could see the John & Yoko suite and they called someone to show us the unit - we did give him a little help for his tour and taking pics. The hotel obviously caters to upscale travellers. There was an Aston Martin and Maseroti in the parking lot during our stay. Also, it seems that there was a business luncheon or dinner every day. Overall a very nice hotel in a very nice part of amsterdam. For what it is worth, to get downtown you walk about 2 blocks to catch the tram and it will take you directly through downtown. Best bet - buy a multiple day pass. Here are some pics from our trip: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kDULeGowbzs

Reviews.Title: “A decent option in Amsterdam outside downtown and closer to airport”
Reviews.Author: ghfatw
Reviews.Content: This is a reasonably good hotel by Amsterdam standards. The rooms are of reasonable size and quality. The Executive Lounge is on the roof and has particularly good views of the city and the canal. Breakfasts up there are great but don't start until 7 am. The fitness centre also does not open until 7 -- it has a lot of equipment -- including some unusual machines for abs. The fitness centre is only free for golds and diamonds in HHonors. Overall this is a decent option - nothing spectacular but a reasonable hotel in a reasonable location.

Reviews.Title: “I would happily stay again”
Reviews.Author: Tony_Forder
Reviews.Content: Located 10 minutes by tram from the centre of Amsterdam (Tram 5) the hotel is then 3 minute walk along tree lined street Hotel is clean, staff are incredible helpful and the view from our room was very impressive - Room was good size, very clean and executive bar on 10th floor is again worth a visit for the views Taxi from hotel to centrum is cheap and easy, also same to return to Hotel - only one Hilton in Amsterdam Central Gym at hotel is very good as well

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: cash1981
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel. Clean and nice service. Only thing is that it could be better location in regards to centre. But renting bike in Amsterdam is great, and only took 15min to bike.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location away from frenzy of Dam Square.”
Reviews.Author: Wolobern
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 6 nights at the Hilton. The hotel is situated in a quiet neighbourhood (near Vondelpark) little out of the busy core area, but easily reached by a very efficient tram nearby. The hotel has bikes should you be inclined. We found numerous decent restaurants in walking distance of the hotel. Although on the small size, our room was quite comfortable with a modern, clean bathroom. The view of the city (on the canal side) is quite exquisite. The pillow and soap menus were a nice touch, as well as the turn down service. The buffet breakfast was a treat. The staff was very pleasant and always helpful. On the negative side internet is rather expensive at 27Euro/day. But easily available at other locations for the price of a coffee. Overall, we would happily return and certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely spacious rooms, beautiful location, 60s style”
Reviews.Author: BootieBoot
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night whilst on a driving tour of Europe with our 1960s car. Safe parking in a good location was the main reason for choosing so we were delighted to find we'd been assigned a large, comfortable room with the most superb panoramic views of Amsterdam. The area is a pleasant 10 min stroll through an elegant neighbourhood to the busier (and slightly grottier) parts of town. Hotel staff were extremely friendly and welcoming. Good value at EU169 including delicious breakfast, however internet access was outrageously expensive so bear that in mind. Despite that we would return as the hotel is really stylish in a fabulous retro 60s way whilst being utterly contemporary and exceptionally comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great family friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: TAT
Reviews.Content: Wow! What a great hotel! We traveled with our children ages 4 and 8 this summer and the Hilton made our experience amazing! From the most friendly breakfast restaurant staff who had plenty of suggestions for childrens activities in the city to making sure our kids had "special" cups to use at breakfast. We stated 3 nights and the staff really took the time to make our family feel at home, all the way down to making sure my daughter was greeted with a Birthday treat on her Birthday. Aside from the rooms being extremely comfortable, the Hotel has in house babysitters. The kids enjoyed the sitter so much, we had her come back a second night! The Hotel is also well positioned in a quiet neighborhood, but with public transport a quick walk away. We would definitely choose this Hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “just great”
Reviews.Author: MIG21
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 3 nights during our honeymoon , this hotel is great , if u don't care bout the budget or u got a good deal , this place is a must ...& it won't fail to satisfy you . the location was out of the centre which was OK with me , also taxis are plenty in amsterdam besides the tram stops infront of the hotel so no probs the staff were great , honestly all the staff we met in europe during this trip were awesome & professional , the smile & greetings , also the will to assist makes u feel welcomed , unlike the staff in other hotels ..where they make u feel like your a heavy load on their chests we found a bottle of champagne & strawberries in our room which was a very nice touch , the view was great as our room was a deluxe canal view , request a high floor to better enjoy the view the breakfast was the best i've seen in my trip , honestly this doesn't surprise me as the hilton breakfast is famous worldwide i recommend this hotel of course & i will be back , i thank the staff for making my honeymoon trip a great one .

Reviews.Title: “We come back every year all year around”
Reviews.Author: christiane69
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms. Beautiful garden next to the canal.Great breakfast on the topfloor with a fatastic view over Amsterdam. Take the tram to Central Amsterdam (no.16)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay. Everything was excellent”
Reviews.Author: mark h
Reviews.Content: We stayed end aug 2011 for 2 nights. Dont be put off by previous comments. I am very fussy and this hotel was one of the best I have stayed in for a weekend break. We stayed in a canal view room which was very clean, modern. Bed was comfortable, pillow menu was great with no extra charge. The staff were great, very friendly. I had noted on our booking it was a special occassion and they delivered champagne and cake which made the stay even more personal.The hotel is a short walk to the tram and is located in a nice area. We only had breakfast and this again was excellent, so much choice. Food was warm and again staff couldnt do enough. It was night to sit outside and overlook the canal with a drink. Drink prices dear but thats the same everywere with the euro. Overall excellent stay and would defintly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant, beautiful view”
Reviews.Author: havesuitcase11
Reviews.Content: I arrived from the US in the early morning and did not expect to get into my room for hours. I happily was given a room immediately. It was spacious, comfortable and with great attention to detail such as asking what kind of pillow I wanted on the bed. I had a huge picture window looking over the canal below with wonderful weeping willows. This is a newer part of Amsterdam but very beautiful and quiet and close to the Museum Quarter. There is good eating and coffee shops close by. It is quiet and easy to sleep. The fine art in the hotel and the wonderful sculpture outside on temporary display was a great addition.

Reviews.Title: “Well maintained property...comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: dsbali
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night while on business in Amsterdam. While the outside looks rather clinical and lacking in style / character, the hotel itself appears to be relatively newly refurbished and is maintained well. The setting overlooking the canals is nice and it is not far from the center of town. Overall, a comfortable stay and a good hotel for a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: 195binney
Reviews.Content: A very good hotel in Amsterdam that I would return to! Good - Recently refurbished all rooms and common areas - Lovely location on a canal - Near public transport - Staff most helpful all the time - Lovely executive lounge on the top floor with lots of free food and drink - Great gym - Nice places to sit outside on the canal ad eat Bad - 35 Euros a night for parking - 20 Euros for internet (free basic access on executive floor) - 15 Euros for gym (free HH Gold and Platinum members) - Lack information in the room on hotel facilities. For example, I want to know where the gym is and cost, where I can rent bikes, how I can connect to the internet, what numbers to call for help (the phone by the bed had no key to it at all), walking times to local sites etc.

Reviews.Title: “Almost three stars”
Reviews.Author: robeth_8
Reviews.Content: As a frequent Hilton user we expect similarities from hotel to hotel so to give this hotel four stars but almost down to three was primarily down to lack of information at check in & in hotel room. To explain: check in quick efficient & pleasant; room usual tidy standard & as expected, recommend paying extra for canal view; staff pleasant but give impression of being slow/laid back; food & drink prices usual for city hotel but reasonable quantity & quality. So far not a bad review but we expect some kind of information in the hotel room, you usualy get at least a brochure detailing info on the hotel. Nothing. We knew there was a leisure area from booking info but had to search for it. Knew it had restaurant & lounges somewhere. Found them & found the bar area/s (there is also a terrace for the sunny days used for food & drinks overlooking the canal) to be up to usual standard. I know this sounds picky but when you are used to hotels being similar then you spend less time in hotel lobby & more time on holiday. Expected better, but, on a good note, hotel is in a very nice area & only 15/20 min walk from Van Gogh museum area through good neighbourhood. Concierge in the hotel fine but sometimes not there and had to search for him on a couple of occasions, but helpful. So, as I said, nice hotel but just lacking that wee something. Would still go back though.

Reviews.Title: “Nice view on the city”
Reviews.Author: supertopfit
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay in this hotel. The room was nice, clean and you have a very nice on the city center. A tram station is near the hotel and you can also rent bike to go in 5 min in downtown. The staff at the reception was helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good central location”
Reviews.Author: wcwLondon
Reviews.Content: If you are driving be prepared for a shock at the parking prices, 34 euros per night. The tram system is so good it would be worth thinking about not driving. The hotel is nice, pre book dinner before you go as the restaurant is quite dear, but well worth the money and pre booking can often give a much better price, . Very good service from all of the staff. Make sure you have breakfast great choice and really nice people in the restaurant

Reviews.Title: “park outside on a Sunday!”
Reviews.Author: Afcajax2000
Reviews.Content: Service, breakfast and location (although not really in the city centre) were good as expected from a Hilton. Only downside from my point of view was that Hilton offers on site parking for 34 euro's a day, but on a Sunday parking next to the hotel is free of charge and easily available. They could have mentioned that....

Reviews.Title: “very friendly staff and pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: OSteve1987
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with friend that worked at the Hilton. My stay was on overall very pleasant and exceeded my expectations of Hilton Amsterdam. Beds are comfortable but the rooms are a bit old fashioned. But, what can you expect; it is not a design hotel. The executive lounge is comfortable with very good service, nice for a small pre-dinner drink. Besides a small mistake in my order at Roberto's dining, the food was lovely and the staff definitely makes this Hilton worth the money. The mistake in my order was handled well, which reflects professionalism to me. The staff is very friendly and helpful, with a personal approach that I like. On overall, the Hilton Amsterdam is a good place to stay when visiting the City with friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: visitorfromFlorida70
Reviews.Content: Considering the cost of other Amsterdam 3 star & 4 star hotels this one is a bargain (of course nothing in Amsterdam is cheap). It is in a VERY quiet part of town and about a level 15 minute walk from the Museum District. Located on a canal. Back garden. Trams all very close. Within easy walking distance of several major local neighborhood shopping streets/restaurants. Hotel is a FULL service hotel. Very clean. Great staff. I would never consider staying at any others if I could afford this one.

Reviews.Title: “lovely stay on the executive floor”
Reviews.Author: businesstraveller2
Reviews.Content: I reserved a regular king room (AAA rate) at this hotel and when I arrived at 8am from my transatlantic flight, I was offered (due to my Hilton Gold status) an upgrade to the executive floor. I had a lovely room on the top floor with a view of the canal. The executive lounge is a smaller glass room on the tenth floor it is the only space on that floor. It is a relatively diminutive size, however it is an elegant and well-run space. The breakfast was excellent for an exec. lounge breakfast. You expect it not to have everything that the full Hilton breakfast has however the quality was quite high. The view is great from the lounge. My room was very comfortable and was already made up without feathers as requested. It came with two robes and slippers, a kettle with tea, a fully stocked minibar, good wifi signal, a shower with a tub. The room was elegantly decorated with teak paneling in the entry way and bathroom and gold leaf wallpaper throughout the main room. It had a large painted crown moulding at the top of the ceiling. The curtains were maroon colored with large leaf print that matched the carpet in the hallway (although it was the inverse color scheme). The room was completely quiet I had no problems at all with noise. A turn down service at 5pm stocked the room with two large bottles of water for free. It turned out that my birthday was on the three days of my travel and, without requesting it, the hotel sent me a small birthday cake. It was a single serving cake with the hotel logo in marzipan on the top and marzipan sides instead of icing. A lovely treat after a long day of work. I did not dine in the Roberto's restaurant mainly because I typically wanted a lighter meal in the evenings. Instead I ate at the bar where I could order a salad. The food was good and came with several small loaves of good fresh bread more than I could eat really. The bar is great it is next to the canal with larger comfy lounge chairs it is quiet and a good place to have a quiet meal after a day of work. The entire hotel is nonsmoking which is unusual in Europe and great if you do not smoke. My only complaint is that housekeeping missed a few things they took one robe away and did not replace it. They also forgot to clean my teakettle one night and did not change my sheets on the third day. But these were relatively minor things compared to the overall excellent service at this nice hotel. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and Expensive”
Reviews.Author: Col1959
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam is notoriously expensive at the best of times and this hotel is a very good example. The rooms are getting very tired. They have very few electrical sockets for you to use in this gadget age. The TV is one of the smallest I have ever seen. The AC is a box on the wall which makes a lot of noise but doesn't really cool the room. The rooms are cleaned superficially - lots of dust where you can't usually see it. It's geared for businessmen who don't actually pay for anything themselves. So everything is extra - health club, internet, swimming pool - basically you name it, you pay; and at astronomic prices. They make little or no effort to offer alternative schemes for the tourist on a normal person's budget. It's in a lovely part of town and the staff are really pleasant and helpful. It's a reasonable deal if you can get a heavily discounted rate on the internet. Otherwise, I wouldn't bother.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, very friendly”
Reviews.Author: ChiswickTurnhamGreen
Reviews.Content: Last stayed here 3 years ago and good to know they have maintained the standard. If you don't mind staying a short tram ride from the centre and don't mind paying a slight premium then this is the best hotel you will find in Amsterdam. We paid extra for the Executive option which means you can use the exec room on the very top of the hotel. It's a glass bubble on the top of the hotel and you get free breakfast, nibbles, evening nibbles and booze plus a great view. It's like a club and you can chat with fellow exec room users! The best things: the exec floor/room and the free booze (about 5pm through 10pm); the staff are all REALLY friendly and helpful; the rooms are lovely, if a bit small; the bar on the ground floor is a great looking bar. There are no real downsides. You are a 30/40 minute WALK into town so you are not in the thick of it, but i like that. One thing, which is more of a Hilton policy issue that specific to this hotel is the internet charging policy...... To write this review on my laptop I have just paid 22 Euro for 24 hour wireless access - at, get this, a mere, pathetic 256 kbits/sec. 22 Euros for that dismal speed! My stance on this one is clear. It stinks that chains like Hilton rip off their gusts with ridiculous internet charges in this day and age. It's a complete Hilton rip off, a totally cynical money grabbing exercise which makes guests like me feel bad about the Hilton brand. SHAME ON YOU HILTON EXEC MANAGEMENT FOR RIPPING YOUR GUESTS OFF LIKE THIS. GET A GRIP, GROW SOME AND BECOME THE FIRST BIG CHAIN TO OFFER THIS FOR FREE. Even worse, i've paid 20% extra for the exec floor and still get no wireless. Yes, there is 1 pc in the exec room for use but this is not good enough - people want to use their own laptop using wireless access. Apart from that, this place is great.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but not ideal”
Reviews.Author: Green_kermit
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel but it has a few short comings. Service is good and the hotel is clean and functional. It's in a good area but it's a high end residential and embassy area which might not be so good for tourists or business travelers. But this does mean that you get a good night's sleep! Food is good but breakfast is a bit crowded. Front of house staff (reception / doormen etc) are exceptionally good, but this hotel does lack a bit of character. Overall it's good and I'd go back, but I wouldn't regard it as great.

Reviews.Title: “one of my favorite hotels”
Reviews.Author: Lhotse21
Reviews.Content: This Amsterdam Hilton is one of our favorites and we have been there countless times. The back of the hotel is on a canal and across from some lovely homes and it is so restful to watch the activity on the canal. The jr. suites have floor to ceiling windows on the canal side. It is within walking distance of both downtown, the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh. The rooms are very comfortable and functional and the executive lounge has a beautiful view and a great spread, especially for breakfast. The people are always so nice and the food is great. It is situated in a beautiful upscale neighborhood that is very quiet and restful, which is exactly what we need. If you are looking for quiet, yet easy walking distance to the sites, this is your hotel. We have stayed at many hotels in Amsterdam and we always come back here.

Reviews.Title: “Good, especially the F&B”
Reviews.Author: Justanotherguest
Reviews.Content: have stayed here a few times before, rooms are great, service is good, internet is expensive? breakfast is great, Robertos is one of the best italian restaurants in the city, Breakfast is very good, highly recommend. Location is okay, with the tram city centre is 20 minutes away, very well located for Schipol and Amsterdam South You normally have to pay for the gym as it does not belong to hotel.

Reviews.Title: “second time to stay but not really satisfied.”
Reviews.Author: lurlpearl
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton for the second time but found that the prices for food etc had gone up considerably. the room rate was fine and was in line with our previous stay. we even upgraded slightly this time and were at the executive level which was nice. however, the food was ridiculously high. the "hilton burger" was 24 euros. all exchange rates aside, would you pay $24 for hamburger in the US? i wouldn't. A cocktail in the bar was around $18. On top of this it was 27 eruos/day for Wi-fi in the room and another charge to use the fitness facility. after a few days of this, I felt s bit like i was getting taken. I travel quite a bit and generally stay at the 4-5 star level so paying more isn't the problem. What is a problem is that this is a nice hilton but nothing extraordinary. it feels comprable to some of the nicer corporate hilton's in us. so getting hit with the "extras" doesn't feel appropriate. being oud zid is wonderful and there are many choices for great food and drink nearby. it is important to note that this is the affluent area of amsterdam and all the restaurants we went to were ALL cheaper than eating at the hilton. we won't stay here again but we will stay in the same area. it is quiet and beautiful, great shopping wonderful cafes. So if you don't care about spending lots more on food, wifi and other amenties, it's your kind of place. you can work around it by rarely eating at the hotel, check your email at a local cafe and get your fitness by walking/biking around amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay- Would definitely recommend!”
Reviews.Author: overthemountain_11
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed here for a birthday celebration and had an absolutely amazing time! The staff were all lovely, a special mention to the young guy at reception (I wish I could remember his name) who was patient, attentive and provided excellent customer service. The room was clean and modern and we were greeted with strawberries upon arrival. The breakfast was fresh with ample choice, and the ambience inside the restaurant was lovely.
