The only downside was that, as a young party I feel that we were ignored by the concierge, as although clearly waiting for a taxi (that we had prebooked) to take us to the airport, the employee completely ignored us and gave our taxi away to a mature couple! it resulted in us squeezed into a taxi that was way to small for out party! other than this, it was a delightful stay with excellent service

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for a great stay...loved it!”
Reviews.Author: SevilleHenry
Reviews.Content: Returned just over a week ago and loved this hotel. At first thought the bedroom was dated but facilities and room service excellent. Loved the bar and entrance area. The breakfast was outstanding and all staff so helpful. Do not miss an evening meal in Robertos, the food was first class and service superb.There are other good restaurants nearby but this was our favourite and excellent value.We did hope for a canal view but this did not matter as we were always out and about.Stayed in an executive room and this was of a good standard. There is plenty to do and location good. Our only disappointment was missing our first night as our BA flight was cancelled from London. Thank you for a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice property and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: mickonrun
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated out 25 wedding anniversary this past week in Amsterdam and stayed at this hotel. In my opinion, this was the perfect vacation because the Hilton Amsterdam was the perfect hotel. We rode the train from the airport (AMS) to Amsterdam Zuid Station. Then took the #5 tram to the Apollolaan stop which was a beautiful short walk to the hotel. Not only was it easy for a foreigner, it was cheap! We went to check in where the front staff was extremely nice and personable. They welcomed us as they gave us our room key and offered to answer any questions we may have had. Since we arrive very early in the morning, we opted to reserve a room for the evening before so we would be assured a room at check in. Since my husband is part of the Honors program and has quite alot of points, we were given an upgraded room but honestly, all of the rooms are very nice. We overlooked the marina which was pretty and quiet. The houses on the other side of the canal were beautiful to look at and the view below our room of the boats in the marina looked like a post card picture. The room is well equipped with all of the American amenities. It even had a scale and bath robes. The bathroom was modern and seemed to have an IKEA feel to it. The beds were perfect and you get a pillow menu to choose what you like best. For breakfast, we had the option of going to the 10th floor to the lounge for breakfast or eating in the nice restaurant which both were buffet style. Down stairs in the restaurant (Roberto's) there was a fireplace burning and it was quite cozy. The food in both locations was similar, there was just a bit more downstairs. There were lots of different kinds of cheeses and yogurts and the breads were so delicious. Eggs both scrambled and soft boiled with bacon and mini veal sausages. Perfect to have a big breakfast and then head out for a day of sightseeing. This hotel has the perfect location because we got the feel of being in a beautiful neighborhood very close to 3 tram stops to the city and yet far enough away from the hustle of the city. The ride was short into town yet it was a nice way to see more of the city than if we were staying in the city, which gets extremely crowded and loud the closer to the weekend you get. All in all, the service was outstanding by everyone at the hotel and they seemed to be very happy working here. It surely translated to the overall feel of this beautiful property!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic alternative to staying in the city centre”
Reviews.Author: Nuvigator
Reviews.Content: So accessible to the city centre without the tourist overload. I loved staying in Oud Zuid surrounded by gorgeous houses and canals and locals. We did have a bit of an awkward moment with one of the front desk staff upon check in as she was quite rude but we let that one slide and the rest of our stay was hassle free. The room was fantastic and the breakfast was so great, I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Seasoned1971
Reviews.Content: Ok so not close to town but only a 20 minute walk and you're close to Van Gogh museum. Hotel was clean and staff friendly. Bar lovely, restaurant excellent.

Reviews.Title: “The Hilton lived up to its name”
Reviews.Author: Bambi6987
Reviews.Content: My partner booked a trip to Amsterdam for my 40th and told me we was staying at the HIlton, to say I was excited was an understatement. The Hilton definitely does what it says on the tin and was perfect in every way. We stayed here for a long weekend and the staff could not have been more helpful or friendlier. From making sure that they put us in a canal view room as requested to recommending the best restaurants to eat at, they could not have done any more. The grounds in the Hilton are stunning, we went out there a couple of times to have a drink in the lovely sun and it was heavenly. I felt very privileged to be staying in this hotel. The breakfast buffet was one of the best I have encountered, there was so much food to choose from and the fresh orange juice was to die for. As we were staying in an executive room we had the choice to eat breakfast in the executive lounge. We went up there one morning but it was not really to my taste as the ambience felt rather stilted and not much conversation was going on. We much rather preferred going to the regular breakfast room in Roberto's restaurant. I was very surprised by some of the reviews I have read for this hotel as some of the reviewers seem to be complaining about every little thing. We had no complaints whatsoever, the only thing I can mention was I had to chase the maid down to get some more toilet paper! I did also mention it was my 40th hoping to get some sort of celebratory drink but to no avail. Nevertheless we did go out to a very fancy seafood restaurant which the concierge recommended to us. The location of this hotel is very very good, we loved the short stroll to the tram stop and admiring all the wonderful statues which were dotted around once you came out of the hotel. I give this hotel a big thumbs up and hopefully we will get to go back there again one day.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a very nice area.”
Reviews.Author: Wildwood_resident
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel from 8 - 10 July 2011. Had a great welcome by the staff on duty. They even oferred me free WiFi after i told them that my HHonors status was mixed up and there was an errror. Clean room with very contemprorary furnishing. Fantastic location and 2 min walk to tram line. Tram passes as well as museum tickets etc. were sold at the hotel concierge or book store. Will definitely stay there again. Only negative thing was the room rate and food/internet rate in the hotel. If you avoid that then its a very good hotel to stay.

Reviews.Title: “An overpriced plum.”
Reviews.Author: HnrchSchwl
Reviews.Content: I travel quite a bit for business around Europe and mostly stay within the Hilton group, with as resultant diamond status at the Hilton. In light of this I found that the Hilton Amsterdam is severely over priced and the front desk staff snobby compared to other establishments. The front desk staff like speaking about guests in Dutch, thinking that they don't understand (I incidentally speak very good dutch, but kept myself "dumb"). I find this quite patronising and rude (to speak another language in front of the customer) and in poor taste. Also strangely, as a diamond member, I have never ever had the benefit of a room upgrade to the executive floor (4 stays and counting). That in itself is understandable, but what is frustrating is that the standard rooms have less amenities (such as the mineral water that was only replaced after two days!), whilst at the same time the executive lounge runs out of drinks during the day (mini-mini-bar fridge). The executive lounge is also, despite the magnificent view, uninspiring, with the same fare in snacks every day, with no variation. Strange is also that the fitness club is only open from 7am in the morning (I'm heading to work then already to beat the dutch traffic, which essentially renders the fitness club useless to me) and charges a 17.50â‚¬ fee as well (for non HH gold and diamond members). In addition I find the daily fee of 34â‚¬ for parking quite steep (Hilton The Hague has VALET parking at 20â‚¬ per day in comparison). On top of that the Hilton Amsterdam offers soaps for sale in the room as well as their cusions. Maybe an interesting idea, however it feels like I am permanentaly living in a "let's-milk-this-customer-for-all-he-is-worth" supermarket when at the Hilton Amsterdam. What tops it for me is that, despite the overly focus on making the most â‚¬ out of the customer (refer the shops in the lobby as well!), the iron is chained to the ironing board, as if I will pinch the iron. This results in turning your shirt-ironing-experience into an artful dance to untangle the chain and get all sides of your shirt crease-free. Maybe am a little harsh on the Hilton Amsterdam, but I do think I am comparing apples to apples (Hilton Amsterdam to Hilton The Hague, Hilton Rotterdam Hilton Schipol, and Hilton Brussels, none of which chains the iron to the board, tries peddling their cushions or extra soaps - with the most of expensive of the comparison group being 15% CHEAPER than the Hilton Amsterdam, etc) and that the Hilton Amsterdam comes out as a definite plum.

Reviews.Title: “Happy to return”
Reviews.Author: chashk
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly and generally helpful. The rooms we clean, decent desk space for working in the room and the room had nice view towards the city. The best part of the hotel was their terrace bar overlooking the canal. A great place to end the evening. There were numerous decent restaurants in walking distance and the nearby park was great for a jog, walk or drink.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Hilton but VERY over-priced”
Reviews.Author: Bijoucache
Reviews.Content: I'm lucky my stay here was due to business; anyone traveling for pleasure can easily find an equally nice hotel for a much lower price. The regular room rate here is EUR 449 per night and only breakfast is included; you have to pay extra for use of the in-room internet access, which is EUR 27 per day for full 24-hour access. My room is ok, but it's pretty dated and not worth the rate. The TV is small with only a few channels, and they don't have HBO or anything similar. Thankfully, I was either working or out sightseeing, so I didn't need it as much. On the plus side, the hotel is located in a very quiet part of Amsterdam in the "Oud Zuid" section, which my cab driver said is up-and-coming. A pretty canal flows directly behind the hotel and if you're lucky to get a room with a view, it's pretty nice. The hotel is very close to tram stops for the 5, 16, and 24 trams, so you can easily get anywhere else in the city. Also, if you're a walker, the museum district is only about 15 minutes away. Vondelpark is closer - about a 5 minute walk three blocks from the hotel. At the hotel itself, the staff speak excellent English and are very helpful. Room service is prompt for both delivery and pick-up when you're done. Housekeeping comes through twice a day and respects the "do not disturb" sign if you don't want to be bothered. The cab fare here from the airport is steep, about EUR 35 each way, but I couldn't figure out the train system at the airport and was too tired to deal with it, so I chose to pay the fare. If you're not here on business, though, and can't expense it, the train from the airport is much cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Ehh”
Reviews.Author: DanNKath20
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel but very overpriced for the experience. Internet very costly, breakfast is an easy $80 USD...so not worth it. But a clean nice hotel. Wouldn't pay for it personally tho.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Birthday Stay”
Reviews.Author: Tuggster
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, location for ourselves was ideal being out of the centre of the town, lovely views of the canal from both our room and in the bar which was frequented a fair bit. Got a lovely little cake on my birthday from the hotel which was very appreciated and a nice touch. Would go back there with no quips.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: Arina_11
Reviews.Content: I really liked the hotel. This hotel is not in central part of the city. In the same time it is a great location: no tourists, very pretty part of the city. It took for a me just a few minutes of walk to the Van Gogh museum. You can take a tram (just couple stops) but I loved to take a walk on those beautiful streets. If you would like to stay close to Dam square and Damrack in walking distance, you might want to stay in different one. But i really enjoy my stay there! One thing I was unhappy about: no business room with computers, and they charge you I think $35 for night for internet, which is pretty sad, I think. I might be wrong on #, but I think this hotel should offer free internet, and wi-fi, as Grand Amrack, where I stayed my last days did.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel with great views”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelingPickles
Reviews.Content: I often stay at this hotel whilst on business. The rooms have great view and the executive lounge in great. The main restaurant is fantastic but the service is very slow. If you are staying have breakfast downstairs not in the Exec lounge.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel in a great area”
Reviews.Author: ColleenMaitland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our last night in Europe, and was pleasantly surprised. Our room overlooked the canal and was quite large, all amenities were excellent. We would definitely stay here again, there are several cafes and restaurants near by, shopping is quite close too . The Van Gogh museum is about 5-10 minute walk from the hotel. Internet was my only complain as you have to pay for it, and with most hotel offering free the Hilton should be too, for the price of the rooms it should be included.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, quiet location”
Reviews.Author: mehorst
Reviews.Content: The room was a very good size, particularly for Europe and the bed was very comfortable. The hotel was very clean and very well maintained, and the service was excellent. The hotel is located in a residential area and backs onto a canal, with a cocktail lounge overlooking the spacious lawn and the boats tied up. The breakfast buffet was extensive and varied. Two blocks away on a neighborhood street is an area of shops and restaurants and gallerys tucked into the residential area, and Vondel Park is only two blocks beyond. There are two convenient tram lines downtown within 5 minutes walk, and passes are available at the gift shop. The concierge sells passes to the Van Gogh and Rijksmuseum. This hotel will get repeat business from us.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect oasis in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: gmjj
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam was the last leg of our European backpacking trip, and Hilton offered the perfect backdrop for us. The elegant hotel is situated in a picturesque and quiet corner of Amsterdam; beautiful neighborhood and canals to walk around, and easy access to public transportation. The staff was professional and friendly, and gave us excellent tips and directions to explore Amsterdam on our own. Their attention to detail was remarkable. We were upgraded to a canal view room since this was our anniversary trip; they even provided complimentary champagne, fruit and an anniversary cake for us during our last day there. That's true exceptional service! Highly recommended for couples or families with children who wants to enjoy the natural beauty of Amsterdam, and yet not too far away from the "action" in the city.

Reviews.Title: “cannot stay away from here”
Reviews.Author: TheWebsters
Reviews.Content: my husband and I have stayed at this hotel for 15 years, Feb july and nov each year. the hotel is fantastic. all the staff are very professional. short tram ride into the centre of Amsterdam, the hotel is in a quiet area and not far from a big park and short walk to museumplein. nice quiet area. excellant hairdresser within hotel!!! cannot wait until July

Reviews.Title: “Very good Hotel in an amazing location”
Reviews.Author: Soly20
Reviews.Content: A step away from the craziness of Amsterdam city center, lies this quite comfortable hotel with amazing nature surroundings that automatically relaxes you as soon as you get to it. The cafe in the back overlooking the water and all the nature is just heavenly. I had a great time there and the staff was very helpful. Rented bikes and went wherever we wanted in a few minutes by bike. Wifi is very expensive. It should be offered free with the rates charged for the room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect City Break”
Reviews.Author: Baz3
Reviews.Content: I recently travelled to Amsterdam with my wife, 14mth old son, and my in-laws. We stayed in this Hilton as we managed to get a deal offering 1/2 price rooms. The Hotel is beautiful with lovely views over one of the many canals. It is slightly out of the way, about a 10/15 minute tram ride to Dam square, and the tram is a 3 minute walk from the hotel. This suited us fine as we weren't there to party :-) Our room over looked the canals (think it was a deluxe room?) and was spacious considering we had a cot in it as well. We stayed on a B&B basis and the breakfast didnâ€™t disappoint with plenty of fresh fruit, meats and cheeses (if thatâ€™s ur kinda thing), cereals, and a cooked buffet. There was plenty to choose from and all fresh from the kitchen. Our only problem was the automatically billing mini bar, as we needed to chill milk for our babyâ€™s bottle. There is NO space for extra items and ended up being charged for several drinks which we moved to make space for the milk. These were kindly taken of when we checked out without any questions. We didnâ€™t use the hotel bar or restaurant and from what we saw (reading the menu) it was expensive. All in all we had a great trip and would highly recommend a stay here, if the price is right. Staff â€“ Very friendly and helpful Accommodation â€“ Clean and fresh and the Hilton Pillow menu always amuses. Breakfast â€“ Super, plenty of choice and fresh

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: jointly
Reviews.Content: Good location, very friendly and helpful staff, very good restaurant and a wonderful terrace on the river...just perfect!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel but lacking in areas.”
Reviews.Author: Fernandos92
Reviews.Content: After arriving on the first day we were greeted well and taken to our executive room. Included in this package was access to the executive lounge located on the top floor. On the second day we went to have our breakfast to find that the tables had not been re layed where there was a dirty cup and spoon on the table that we sat down on. Breakfast was served untill 11.30 and at 11.20 we were told to eat up as they were shutting soon. Over all we spent four days there and it was generally a nice experience although a little way out from dam square and taxis seemed to charge what they like. It has a nice garden but some what over priced on bar drinks. We found at times that staff would lurk about for tips and came across some of the front desk staff very rude and ignorant. As we were checking out we wernt even asked if we enjoyed our stay and felt that the lady at the front desk just looked down her nose at us. Even when saying good bye we did not have a reply out of her which was quite dissapointing.

Reviews.Title: “NICE HOTEL BUT WAY TOO EXPENSIVE”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrsK24
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded upon arrival which was nice but the only difference seemed to be that the bed was king size not double. The room was not that clean upon arrival. The drawers and surfaces were dusty and there were hairs in the bathroom from the previous guests. We were charged for internet access when we checked in for our return flights which we found a bit surprising in a 5 star hotel. We have stayed in lower class hotels where its been included as part of the service. In our opinion the restaurant attached to the hotel, Roberto's, was extremely expensive. The food was very tasty but there was little of it. We paid 35 euros for a meal which consisted of three very small lamb chops and a few broadbeans!! The hotel bar was also extremely expensive with a bacardi and coke costing 15 euros. It was 6 euros for a small portion of chips in the bar. Needless to say we ate out after finding this out. There are loads of nice restaurants and bars at far more reasonable prices in the Leidsestraat area. The hotel was close to a tram line which was just as well as it was located just a bit too far out to want to walk when visiting the museums, restaurants and bars. However, all the staff were very friendly and helpful and spoke several languages. The breakfast was extremely good with a very large selection available every day of hot and cold items, fruit, yoghurts, bread rolls and as much tea, coffee and fruit juice as you wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Special Room”
Reviews.Author: helgamb
Reviews.Content: Booked the Yoko/Lennon Suite. Absolutely outstanding. The furniture, the details and especially the big bed. Really loved it. Large bathroom . Wished I had stayed more than one night. Breakfast and Wireless Internet was free of charge for Honors Gold Vips. The Executive Lounge is good compared to other european Hilton properties. Some nice snacks and drinks. Only negative aspect: The high price for the Yoko & John suite.

Reviews.Title: “Top Quality Hotel in Quiet Part of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: travellinman2009
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in a quiet, slightly remote part of Amsterdam. Our room seemed to be recently refurbished and was of very high quality. Nice view over the canal - probably best to pay a little extra for a canal view room. Service was very friendly and efficient. Definitely recommended if you don't need to be in the centre of the city.

Reviews.Title: “It was good enough for John & Yoko, now I understand why”
Reviews.Author: JimboBerlin
Reviews.Content: The Hilton hotel in Amsterdam is in a quiet location in a residential area just outside the central core of the city but on a few minutes walk to shops, restaurants and bars. The rooms are fine and comfortable and the location by the canal is great. I had a workout in the gym and it was the great start to a sunny day in a lovely area of Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated, disappointing and not 5-star”
Reviews.Author: Luckma
Reviews.Content: Somehow this hotels has a reputation in Holland from the old days, but nowadays it does not stand out from any other Hilton. At the most average 4-star service. The rooms and facilities are outdated and boring. The rooms are disappointing and very old fashioned. What is really frustrati ng and greedy is that they charge for internet. I was shiocked to find that out. Not only do they just charge, they charge Euro 27 per day! A rip off and to me that is like charging for water for the shower. Upon checkin I was assisted partially nicely, but before the person was finished with me he already assisted another guest and just slid the key to me without looking at me, telling me where the elevator is or wishing me a good stay. The Roberto's restaurant was also a great disappointment. The food was terrible and I tried 3 courses. Very cheap ingredients and it looked and tasted like they bought something from the supermarket and heated it up in the microwave. Service was average there. Breakfast again like a 4-star property. It feels as there is no excitement in the hotel and everyone just goes through a daily routine. They need some fresh wind through it. Please stop calling it 5-star becuase it is in no comparison to other 5-star hotels in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Service was great, nice Valentines surprise in room”
Reviews.Author: HerrOlsson
Reviews.Content: Stayed just one night. Upgraded to Executive floor which looked newly remodeled. Basked with Valentines chocolates and strawberries. The lounge is really nice with a good selection and wonderful views. I would def. stay here again and can fully recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive and away from the centre”
Reviews.Author: yt337
Reviews.Content: This hotel is away from the centre ,it is 15mins by tram .It is in a quite location but the most disapointment was how expensive it was to use the internet and other services within the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Amsterdam not for the daily tourist”
Reviews.Author: ARHF
Reviews.Content: Quite far (about 10 tram stops) from center city. Quite and vary good service. Would not recomend for tourist, more for the buissness people.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: brandywinelady
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel in a great location. There is a great view of Amsterdam from the roof top concierge floor. It is a short trolley ride into the center of the town, which can be crowded. The room was well maintained, the staff very pleasant. The hotel restaurants were very good, though, I did take advantage of Hilton Honors and spend breakfast and evening cocktails on the rooftop floor.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the stay”
Reviews.Author: AFloridaGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the hotel on the 8th floor in a king room. I thought the room was very nice, had a good sized bathroom, a nice pillow menu to choose just the right pillow and tea/coffee available. We heard some noise in the hallway from rude guests but otherwise no problem. We really enjoy the Executive Lounge at Hiltons and this one had soft drinks, coffee and fruit available all day. The breakfast was typical style with eggs and meat also available. I only eat yogurt, fruit and sometimes toast for breakfast so it was very adequate. In the evening there was many selections of alcohol available plus a few assorted snacks. The staff was fantastic. The hotel is a bit off the beaten path but the tram station is very close. We decided to walk into the centrum and back, plus walk around the city, for a total of about 4 1/2 hours of walking. The tram is 2.60 euros and good for one hour if you get off so you can get back on with the same ticket. If you walk out of the hotel, turn right, then turn right again and go over the small bridge, keep heading straight and you'll come to a couple of restaurants and an Albert Heijm grocery store (a very small one). We ate at the tapas bar on the corner and enjoyed it well enough. We had 3 tapas (calamari, lamb skewers, crepe with spinach), a bowl of soup, a glass of wine and a beer for about 35 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hilton in Amsterdam - no canal view for me”
Reviews.Author: UncleDom
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for 1 night mid January & thoroughly enjoyed my stay. Firstly I want to thank Duddoo - a few reviews down for your good directions. Arrived Saturday early afternoon and assigned room over looking the boulevard as no canal view rooms were available, the girl on reception did try.Room very big & clean, large very very comfortable bed. Bathroom very clean & large too. I was on the sixth floor I guess it must have been refurbished as it all seemed very new. Very good blackout curtains on windows to keep light out so slept very well. Breakfast was included in rate & althought it was pretty good I have had better Hilton breakfasts. Staff were all really good, conciege sold day tickets for the trams & buses at 7 euro, only gripe would be that there is no free computer to print out boarding passes as is common in some hotels now - I did not want to pay 3/5 euro to print them out using the business centre terminals otherwise great hotel & would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Night's Sleep- EVER!”
Reviews.Author: BunnyGirl007
Reviews.Content: After trying to find the entrance to the car park for what seemed like forever, we were greeted with very helpful reception staff, who informed us that the English football team had just left (which would explain the LV suitcases!) We were shown to our rooms, which had been placed right next door to each other, which we had not requested, but they had thought ahead. The rooms were beautiful, as the title explains, the best nights sleep I've ever had, so peaceful and the beds are HUUUUGE! Breakfast was amazing for a buffet, I cannot express enough how impressed I was with this hotel. Would love to return, thank you for a brilliant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nettes Hotel nur ein Bisschen aus der Lage”
Reviews.Author: SWH2010
Reviews.Content: This great hotel where once John Lennon and Joko Ono held a 'bed-in for peace' (by the way their suite is still bookable) is situated next to a canal and features a great terrace superb for breakfast and dining during the Summer months. It is situated somewhat on the outskirts of Amsterdam's center. However, to get to the Museumplein it only takes about a 7-minute walk and 10-minute walk to the PC Hooftstraat, the main shopping street. The hotel is frequented by many business travelers. Service is fast. The hotel has a very nice lounge area. The price is a little steep. Great comfortable bed and a very nice bathroom, which makes up for the price.

Reviews.Title: “perfect city & hotel”
Reviews.Author: vigra
Reviews.Content: This is definitely the best hilton hotel I've stayed!! The hotel is beaaaautiful, in front of a canal, the service is amazing ,as you enter you can see its full glory. A stunning entrance hall, and reception area, which was in the process of being transformed for christmas. very nice reception team, exuctive lounge maneger so nice,city view room, and a lovely room, huge bed, tv, desk and all the usual extras. extremely clean and roomy. ask for fresh pan cake from the kind chif ,near musums,10mn from city center, ilike it so much

Reviews.Title: “A little piece of corporate America in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: EuropeanPete
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam's hotels are all over-priced and over-full. The HIlton Amsterdam is no exception. At all times of the year the staff appear to be rushed off their feet, and as a result sometimes the staff behind the desk don't seem to know what's going on. The rooms are perfectly adequate, with the larger studio suites actually being quite nice. The executive lounge is a highlight here, a glass box on the roof of the building with free food and drinks, looked after by very attentive staff. I understand the hotel is being extended upwards though, so this will soon be just a memory. In summer, the outside area is great for drinks, and it's just a quick walk into downtown Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel with the most amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: nualaj2
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for our 9th wedding anniversary, and arrived into amsterdam airport approx 1330 friday 12th. we booked transfers to and from the hotel via tourist information costing 24.50 euros each. they also charged 2.50 euros for a map - dont bother - hotel gave us 1 for free It was a 15 minute drive to the hilton, and from the exterior, it looks nothing special, but as you enter you can see its full glory. A stunning entrance hall, and reception area, which was in the process of being transformed for christmas. We were greeted at the desk by the friendliest hilton receptionist i have met, she offered us advice onwhere to visit, enquired about our journey, our children at home etc It just put a smile on our face and set the standard for our entire stay. Our room was 519 overlooking the canal. Stunning view of the city, and a lovely room, huge bed, tv, desk and all the usual extras. extremely clean and roomy. We ordered room service, the telephone was answered again by such a friendly chap, who after we had finished our meal, checked that we enjoyed it etc. The food by the way is tasty. The only negative things i would say about the hotel is that the food/drinks are a little pricey.. with room service being shocking. 5 euros for a can of fanta, 9 for a small bottle of coke. The hotel is a good 45 minute walk to the centre, only about 10 minutes from Van gogh museum. Use the conceirge to book attraction tickets as the ques are horrendous. i loved this hotel, but would maybe consider something a little more central next time, redisson blu was ideal. 27.50 euros for 24 hours of wifi bottle of wine in the lounge 47.50 average meal 30 euros breakfast 32 euros

Reviews.Title: “BEST HILTON HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: Anipanqueca
Reviews.Content: This is definitely the best hilton hotel I've stayed!! The hotel is beaaaautiful, in front of a canal, the service is amazing, the food is great (just a little pricey...) and is well located. There's wifi in the rooms, decoration is great, had a wonderful time overthere and will be back next year! I definitely recommed!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful for a weekend break”
Reviews.Author: PrestonTraveller
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel through Priceline and got the hotel for less than Â£100 per night. You could expect to pay these prices for 3 star hotels in Amsterdam. Although the hotel is located in a residential area, itâ€™s not far from the museum tram stops. You will also be able to get a good night's sleep as you will be away from the hustle and bustle of the city centre. We took a tram to the hotel which took about 10 minutes. Once we stepped off the tram which stops mid way on a bridge, we walked over the bridge to Appollolaan and turned right. Turn left and you will eventually end up at the Wyndham hotel! There is a park area in the middle with a few statues and within about 5 minutes, as long as you have not been knocked down by passing cyclists you will come across the Bilderberg Garden Hotel, and when you cross the road, the Hilton is there. We checked in and my wife made a fuss as to how this break was a special occasion for her and that she wanted a good room. We were given the canal view rooms that I know are the ones to get. Within a few minutes of entering the hotel we were in our room. Its good sized room but you will find newer branded city hotels tend to have larger deluxe rooms. We had a big comfortable bed, loved the view of the canal and the city but the LCD tv was on the small size. The bathroom was again of a decent sized and the hotel provides you with Evelyn & Crabtree branded soap, shampoo etc. The hotel provides you with tea and coffee facilities. As we did not have breakfast included we got our croissants etc from the bakers shop the day before and ate them in the morning with our own tea or coffee and that kept us going until lunchtime. If you wish to purchase even continental breakfast from the hotel it will set you back a rather lot of Euros. The mini bar at the hotel is expensive; they charge over 5 Euros for a bottle of mineral water. If you step outside the hotel and turn right, walk towards the glass building situated next to the hotel and turn right again, you will again walk over a bridge and come to Emmastraat. There is another tram stop on your left there that will take you to the city. If you cross the road and walk a bit further up and you will find a general store where you can buy your own drinks, snacks etc and it will save you from paying the hotel prices. However bearing in mind that 5 star hotels in Amsterdam are expensive and this visit was a treat for my wife, we could not complain about the hotel with the price we paid. A large room, a bit of luxury, the hotel provided a complimentary treat for my wife and we purchased our Van Gogh Museum tickets from the concierge which enabled us to skip the long lines when we got to the museum.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: Richlandtown
Reviews.Content: The service was an unexpected pleasure! We arrived with champagne and chocolates in our room and a beautiful view of the canal. Our room was close to the elevator, which my partner despises because of the noise and we heard not a peep. Great sleeping! The concierge was extremely helpful giving us great pointers on what to see during our short stay. We had drinks in the lounge with a fireplace and view of the canal and the friendliest staff! It was hard to leave the hotel! The restaurant was also top-notch Italian food! The location is a bit of a hike from the center of Amsterdam, but the tram is very user friendly and saved us a bunch in taxi fares. It made us feel like the locals. The neighborhood was safe and very beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “superb rooms and view”
Reviews.Author: propmill
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights. The room was the usual high Hilton standard and was apacious and elegant. Fittings in the bathroom were immaculately clean. We had a canal view room which had beautiful views from the huge window. A nice touch was having a kettle and tea/coffee making facilities which not all 5 star hotels have. Service throughout the hotel was good and the concierge's recommendation of nearby restaurants was spot on. We found the location absolutely fine and enjoyed being in a quieter area. The two different tram lines servicing the area enabled us to get anywhere we wanted quickly and easily. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms”
Reviews.Author: eurotrotter12
Reviews.Content: The room was just beautiful- spacy, huge window with lovely sight on the canal. Location central enough and bikes are given for the Amsterdam feeling, which is really woth it because its anice way of sightseeing.Vondelpark is close by for jogging What could have been better was the friendliness at the reception desk. And internet access was far too expensive- not unusual in hotels of this category.

Reviews.Title: “A good solid place but not for teenagers!!”
Reviews.Author: africana
Reviews.Content: We only spent 4 days at this hotel. The weather didn't help much - grey clouds and lots of rain. But the Hilton was, as one would expect of any Hilton, of a high standard, superlative service, constant stream of smiling faces. The Italian restaurant on the ground floor (sorry can't remember the name) got booked very quickly but we managed to get a table on the final night of our stay. We also used the hotel to obtain tickets for the two main museums and dinner on one of the canal cruises (which to me, was the highlight our trip!!). The only downside is that as we went with our teenage kids, of course, they found the whole thing too boring and both seemed to come alive when we went into town, so if we were to come here again, we would not come with them or choose a hotel that is not so conservative. Overall, my husband and I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comforts of a big hotel but a bit out of the way”
Reviews.Author: adelly
Reviews.Content: Reading Amsterdam hotel reviews gave me the chills (many near the canals, even 5-star ones, seemed to have cleanliness issues!) and after much deliberation, settled on bidding blindly on Priceline. Pros: - Very reasonable rates compared to other 5 and even 4 star hotels in AMS. 5-stars in the city center will run you about $300-400/night while this place only cost about $175/night. - Not as charming as the hotels near the canals but you do get the comforts of a big hotel such as elevators (some in the canals don't and with having huge luggage, that would be an issue), larger rooms, etc. - Clean throughout though decor a bit dated - Nice, quiet neighborhood (surrounded by consulates and diplomat housing) Cons: - Quite far from the city center. You'll need a taxi or the tram to get you there. The tram is only a few blocks away so it's easy to navigate. If you're up for some walking, the Museum area is only about a 10-15 minute walk. - No wifi! Absurd daily charge. - Not very charming; again, the trade-off for getting the comforts of a big hotel

Reviews.Title: “Out of the Action but perfect for fresh off the Plane!”
Reviews.Author: Travelmonster420
Reviews.Content: I loved the Hotel! It was not in the middle of everything but Amsterdam is small and a qucik jump on a tram and your in the middle of the best shopping and food i less the 5 mins so don't worry about that. After being around tons of people all day its nice to go back to the Hilton thats very clean and quite. Around the Hilton is some of the best views in Amsterdam at sunset walking around the canals!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Inconvenient Location For Touring”
Reviews.Author: teddyrex
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from nearly three months cruising/touring European cities. Docked on 7 June in Amsterdam and Hilton had a pre-arranged (and expensive) car waiting at the pier for us. Our early check in was available and we were shown several rooms (I am Hilton HHonors Diamond) and we selected a junior suite (really just a slightly larger room) which was nice (great beds but odd and not very comfortable sitting area furniture) and had a very nice bathroom. The best thing about this Hilton is the restaurant - Roberto's. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet every morning (included) and ate dinner there on three nights. The food and service were both outstanding! This leads me to comment on the worst thing about the hotel - the location. The hotel is in a lovely residential area but it is a 15-20 minute taxi ride - about $20 US each way to Dam Square and there are really no good restaurants in the area. (We walked to the two recommended near-by restaurants which were mediocre and expensive) When you add $40 taxi fare to a dinner bill elsewhere it was easier and less expensive to eat at Roberto's and know we would be having a great dinner. In summary, the Amsterdam Hilton is very nice but not very convenient for tourists. We missed being able to walk out and enjoy the fun and atmosphere of a downtown and we spent a week "secluded" at the Hilton which is just too long a stay for this hotel. It would be great if attending business meetings at the hotel but it is not my choice for the leisure traveller. (Because we are retired as are most of our friends, I will check the "Not Recommend" box below)

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: FeatStick
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Amsterdam is located in a residential area, surrounded by luxurious houses, it is a haven of peace close to the Vondelpark which is a pleasant place to wander around. The building itself is not very nice, a big block of cement from the 80's but the rooms are spacious, the lobby modern and the bar overlooking the canal is very enjoyable. There are even places to park your boat if you are lucky enough to have one. Not the best Hilton I have seen, but still fine for a short gateaway in Amsterdam, near the museums

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: playabum
Reviews.Content: We were traveling to several cities in Europe, with Amsterdam being one of the stops. We booked online through Orbitz and received a discounted rate by prepaying. Our rate included breakfast, which we took advantage of every day of our stay. Initially we didn't know if it would be worth it, but in the end, we were glad we got the breakfast included. The food was very good and there was a good variety. The hotel is not located within the center of the city, but the #16 tram was in close proximity and we used it every day to get around. For â‚¬15,50, we obtained a 3 day pass that started at the time of your first use and was valid for 72 hours - great buy, as this allowed us to get all over the city. The hotel staff was very friendly and everyone spoke English, as was the case at most places we visited in Amsterdam. Our room was not on the canal side, but we still had a nice view. We had a king room with a very comfortable bed with plenty of pillows. The size of the room was in line with the average American hotel room size. The bathroom had all the amenities that would be expected of a Hilton, including a lighted magnification mirror and a decent hair dryer with adequate outlets in the bathroom (we found this isn't always the case in Europe). Closet and drawer space was plentiful as well. The one drawback we had with this hotel is that it cost an extra â‚¬17,50 per day to use the gym facilities because it is contracted out. This price seemed excessive and I would have thought this would be a perk thrown in for Hilton Honors members. Needless to say, we didn't use the gym. The internet fees are also expensive (as are most things in Europe), but I was able to connect to the Boingo service I subscribed to before leaving the US, so I did not need to use the hotel's service. All in all, this is a nice hotel if you don't mind staying outside the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Another amazing stay at the Hilton Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: arsenalrocks
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently returned to the Hilton Amsterdam for a two night stay. It had been 2 years since our last visit and we were in some serious need of relaxation. As our trip came closer, we were more and more excited to return to the Hilton in Amsterdam. We had such an amazing time our last visit there and were anticipating this trip to be just as good. When we arrived and exited our taxi, the doorman Nico, immediately began assisting us with our bags and remembered us from our stay 2 years previous. We couldn't believe that he remembered us! If made our trip all the more special. We were placed on the executive floor with access to the executive lounge which included free drinks and snacks. There was also a computer with internet access that we were allowed to use for free. Usually it costs 12 euro an hour or 27 euro for 24 hours to use the wireless internet in your room. Fresh cherries and flowers awaited our arrival. The room was decorated very modern and it all seemed brand new. The tub was wonderful and perfect for long baths. The hotel gives you scented bath tablets to include in your bath water. Our room had a view of the canal that looked beautiful day and night. The weather was wonderful so we were able to enjoy drinks on the back terrace that overlooks the canal. The hotel was quiet and comfortable, the staff friendly and helpful. This hotel is not located in the center of the Amsterdam craziness, but that is what we enjoy. All of that is a short walk away. After our two night stay, we left the Hilton feeling relaxed, de-stressed, and rejuvenated. I have stayed at many Hiltons around the world and this is my favorite!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: amyg123
Reviews.Content: Hotel is away from the noise and hustle and bustle of Central Amsterdam, but only a 5minute tram ride away. The hotel is situated right on one of the canals in a mostly upscale residential neighborhood with several shops and cafes within a quick walking distance. The staf was very accomodating (except for the very young concierge. He couldnt take the time nor effort to help us) You can buy tram 24 and 48 hour passes from the sundry shop, but get them early as they sell out quickly. The tram stop (#5) is just a 5 minute walk as you go out of the hotel to your left. Breakfast bufet was good and lots of variety. The chef actually spoke to all guests and asked if you wanted something particular to eat that was not on the buffet. Nice quiet location. I would definately stay here again. However for the very young and nightlife oriented, you may want to stay clser to Dam Square.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a quiet and nice area of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Falkvik
Reviews.Content: We booked a twin executive room through the January sale at Hilton.com and paid â‚¬ 159,50 per night. Included in the rate: access to the Executive Lounge, breakfast and guaranteed late check-out (18:00). With one exeption all of the staff members were very helpful and friendly. We stayed in room 805. The room was nicely decorated and we had a nice panoramic view towards the canal and Â«VondelparkÂ». All rooms are equipped with Wireless High Speed Internet, but not free of charge. The Executive Lounge, which is located on the top (10th) floor, features a beautiful panoramic view over Amsterdam. The opening hours are from 07:00 to 23:00 on weekdays. In weekends and Public holidays the opening hours are somewhat limited, from 07:30 to 12:00 and 17:00 to 22:00. Breakfast is served until 11:00. The lounge is quite small, with a max capacity of about 25-30 persons (6 tables with 3 chairs and 4 tables with 2 chairs plus two comfy sofas). In the lounge they serve alcoholic beverages (beer, wine, vodka, whiskey, gin, rum, cognac and bourbon) in the evening (until one hour before closing time). The lounge also provides international newpapers and magazines. Since we only stayed two nights we decided mostly to use public transport for transportation between the hotel and different parts of the city. We used the tram stop Â«ApollolanÂ», which is located on a bridge about 200 metres from the hotel (Â«Joh. M. Coenen straatÂ»). From this stop you can take tramline no 5 and 24. The routes are different but both tram 5 and 24 have final stops at the Central Station. We bought 48 hours tickets from the gift- and souvenirshop on the ground floor and paid â‚¬ 11,50 for one ticket. For a single ticket (valid 1 hour) you must pay â‚¬ 2.60. As for walking distances it`s about 5 minutes to the fantastic Â«VondelparkÂ», 10 minutes to the Â«MuseumspleinÂ» (Van Gogh Museum and Rijksmuseum), 15 minutes to the Â«LeidsepleinÂ» (for the best dining and night life) and 25 minutes to the main shopping area (main shopping streets: Â«KalverstraatÂ» and Â«NieuwendijkÂ»). The hotels also have bicycles thats provided free of charge. You can reserve bicycles either via the Executive Lounge Host (10th floor) or at the Consierge. The breakfast is served at Roberto`s restaurant (and in the lounge if you have access). Opening hours for breakfast is 07:00 to 11:00 every day. We really enjoyed the breakfast. From the Central Station to the hotel we paid â‚¬ 21,50 for the 10 minutes taxi ride. For transportation from the hotel to the Schiphol airport we took a taxi. We bought a voucher (â‚¬ 33) at the Consierge Desk on the ground floor. The ride took about 15 â€“ 20 minutes. Hhonors Gold & Diamond members have free access to Â«The Personal Health ClubÂ» on the 1st floor.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet but pleasant location”
Reviews.Author: kwc196
Reviews.Content: While this hotel may not be considered central, I liked its location in a quiet residential neighborhood, within a pleasant walk of museums and the Concertgebouw. There also are tram stations nearby. The rooms are quiet and comfortable, with one side facing a canal with upscale houses on the other side. The breakfast served in the restaurant is excellent, with frequent refills of tasty fresh-squeezed orange juice offered with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “The best of both worlds.. Great for someone new to the city, but not touristy.”
Reviews.Author: reclusivevixi
Reviews.Content: I took the redeye and landed at Schipol at 6am. This was my first destination in a VERY long European trip (I ended it in Eastern Europe). When I walked into the hotel around 7am, they had a my room ready. The room was beautiful with an amazing view of the canal. After unpacking I needed to find an ATM and a tram pass, the staff was more than helpful in pointing me the right direction. There is a little cute neighborhood behind the hotel. The staff bent over backwards to make me happy. As an American who lives in a clean air state, I took my jetlagged self out the back patio with a coffee. Immediately someone brought over a propane heater. I felt quite silly when I realized I could have just smoked inside the bar. The hotel is so close to the tram lines. You walk through a beautiful residential neighborhood, places where local people shop. Tourist traps and actual museums were a quick tram stop away. I did wander into the Marriot by the art museums.. it felt like a tourist hole. It was super close to the Heinekin theme restaurant. The only thing that was hard was room service or getting food at the hotel. Breakfast was wonderful, but everything else was way overpriced. Overpriced for being a higher end Hilton hotel. This is where I would stay again during my next trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely good (except perhaps for location)”
Reviews.Author: Yamazato
Reviews.Content: I have stayed four or five times in the last two years in this hotel. BEST THINGS: - Reasonably pleasant and modern decor in lobby, restaurant and bedrooms (at least in the executive bedrooms, the sole in which I have been) - Very good firm bed - Very quiet - In a posh and green residential area of Amsterdam, a few minutes walk from the beautiful Vondel Park - Professional staff - Ample parking, although at a significant cost, but this is the case almost everywhere in Amsterdam - Good breakfast - Good snacks in the executive lounge - Outstanding view towards Amsterdam, but only if you have a "Plus" room (to be selected when booking) WORST THINGS: - From the outside, the hotel is not at all attractive: it looks like a sad office block from the 60s or so - Not in a central location, i.e., you have to use the tram (around 20 minutes), taxi (very expensive in Amsterdam) or better a bicycle to go downtown

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: DrDBA
Reviews.Content: Had a free 5-night stay at the Hilton. The hotel is in a lovely part of town, easily accessible to the other parts of town via the tram system. The hotel rooms were modern, clean, cool, and quiet. Breakfast was included, which was a decent buffet. The backyard terrace overlooked the canal and was quite enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: phasmid
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel just outside the city center. Very quiet location (which we like), friendly staff, nicely appointed room (we were upgraded to an executive room). The hotel is 2 or 3 block walk to the tram and from there around 10 minutes to the city center. Be sure to buy a 24 hour tram pass at the hotel. Saves a lot to time and money. We had access to the executive lounge which was wonderful. The breakfast was exceptional. The executive lounge staff goes out of their way to make guests feel welcome. Nice patio out back of the hotel which borders on a canal. We didn't eat in the hotel restaurant (expensive) because there a many restaurants within walking distance. We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very average hotel for 5 star”
Reviews.Author: Ray Goldberg
Reviews.Content: Most staff here are very pleasant. The hotel is out of the city centre and takes transportation to get anywhere. Tram 16 is your best bet IF you are going to stay here. The rooms are extremely small- too small for a 5 star hotel. Our air conditioner did not work the first night we were there. Couple that with an extremely hard bed and we had a sleepless 1st night. This was rectified on the 2nd night by moving rooms. The TV is miniscule. Breakfast adequate. I would have given this hotel 3 stars but to charge 27 Euro a day for Internet is an insult. Hilton seems hit/miss. there is NO consistancy. You might find a good one,8/10 you do not. I'm happy at Hyatt

Reviews.Title: “Out of the way, overpriced, with rude staff”
Reviews.Author: FPodesta
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Amsterdam for business purposes would be an acceptable hotel, but it is massively out of the way from the tourist areas of the city. The room rates are comically high compared to the other hotels in the area, and the staff is rude and arrogant. The hotel charges â‚¬30/day for internet. The business center costs â‚¬0,34/minute, even for Diamond HHonors members. The parking runs â‚¬34/night, despite the fact that free parking is available on the street, not more than 20 feet away and that the hotel is located in a suburban area. Even if you have status with Hilton, expect to be treated rudely by the disorganized and lazy front desk staff. (The doormen and concierge were quite friendly.) If you are visiting Amsterdam, look for a different hotel. Those closer to the Dam area are nicer, cheaper and avoid the 20 minute commute to the action.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Hilton, hidden beautiful back garden”
Reviews.Author: LOLANetherlands
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with my partner for one night in May 2008, the front desk was efficient but not the friendliest.Nevertheless,we had a very romantic diner in the back garden next to a small canal/lake where boats were floating by.The food was very nice too.The rooms overall are a bit pricey (around 200 euros)but impecable.The location is a bit far from the center and quiet but that's what we were looking for. Close distance to museums.

Reviews.Title: “Very good; don't assume it won'tbe”
Reviews.Author: Heidbummer
Reviews.Content: Yes it's out of town. Good. This is Amsterdam: I want the choice to be awake at 3am, not have it be compulsory. The surrounding area has some excellent (and unadvertised in any guide) architecture. For a sad endorphin addict like me the jogging route round the nearby park is a convenient "I'm away but need to do something" 6K. Don't pay for the gym in the same building nowt to do with Hilton. Go run and look at the pretty buidlings. If you stay here a canal view room is de rigeur. I don't want no car park view. Breakfast: standard European Hilton. FIne. Dinner in the Italian restaurant. Very good indeed. Yes, you should be living it up in town. But hey I'd walked sodding miles and my feet hurt. And the prix fixe menu is good value and do you really want to pay â‚¬35 for a steak? Polite staff, who aren't angling for a tip all the time. I was travelling light so the walk to the tram and then the train back to Schiphol was fine. With mega luggage the â‚¬33 taxi ride might seem worth it. Overall: nice room., good staff, if you aren't a cripple the walking will do you good physically and mentally. A proper restaurant in situ. And you could pay a lot of money to stay in town and have those stag parties interrupt your beauty sleep. Am I boring old sod? Yeah, like I care.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with spacious rooms. Location is out of town in a quite area”
Reviews.Author: dayved
Reviews.Content: This was our first hotel in Europe for our honeymoon. We booked it on price-line for a good price through the "name your price" thing. The front desk was very helpful and accommodating. The room was just perfect, faced the canal with large windows. The bed was big and everything was well placed and felt fairly new. The bathroom was plenty big and the wife loved the deep bathtub. There was a nice area to work on the laptop or just sit and gaze into the skyline of Holland. The location is very nice. It is only about a 5-8 minute walk to the Metro stop which runs every 10-15 mins. It is a quick ride into town. We did not find much in walking distance but a small and VERY local grocery store call DH. It is a great little shop to pick up some necessities but be ready to speak dutch and bring your own shopping bags. You can walk to the museupliem in about 30 minutes. We did not attempt to walk all the way to the centre but it would take a few hours I would assume. But what was nice is after a long day in the city you can retreat to this wonderful hotel away from the busy street and honking cars. We are young, club goer type but really enjoyed coming home to the peacefulness of the Hilton. Another thing to note the price of anything you buy from them. Buy your Metro tickets at the train station not the hotel. It is 7 Euro for a bottle of beer and 5 for a soda so beware of the over priced refreshments. The breakfast in the morning is FABULOUS!!! Just wonderful, go every day you are there. Worth at least 25-35 Euro a person. The service is second to none. I would pay top dollar for a breakfast like that even when not on vacation. We could not believe that it was complimentary. The doormen were always helpful and took extra care to ensure we had a great time. Over all we loved it and would stay there again. It was expensive but it was worth it considering what you get compared to other same priced hotels in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and relaxed stay!!! Everything I needed...”
Reviews.Author: Stef-Vong
Reviews.Content: I had to stay in Amsterdam for a meeting in the South-Axis business area. I had very busy and stressful week and I wasn't looking forward to my trip. That changed when I checked-in. The staff was taking care of everything, doors, bags, fast check-in, drink... Just what I needed. After a short rest I went down for a drink in the bar and altought I was alone I didn't get bored. The bar overlooks their terras, a small harbour and the canal. First I wasn't happy about the location (just out side city center), but actually it was perfect. No noise and within 10 min walk in city center.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gemstone4ever
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last night and it was a good experience. I chose it because it was convenient for work. If I was a tourist, I would stay more centrally. Cheerful, attentive service. Nice room with canal view. Although May, the weather was dreary, so I couldn't enjoy the lovely canalside terrace but can well imagine it would be perfect for an evening drink and dinner in warmer months. Instead, the roaring fire in the bar was very cosy and welcome. Taxis in Amsterdam are expensive so if you stay here longer than the one night I stayed, I recommend you get to grips with public transport!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: John Leghorn
Reviews.Content: I had booked the hotel some months previously using LastMinute.com's 'secret hotels' facility and thought I had got a good bargain at just over Â£100 per night.However,I was slightly nervous when I read the more recent reviews about the overbooking problems others had experienced.We had no such problem and certainly when we arrived on a Sunday afternoon the hotel seemed very quiet --I think we may have been lucky that there werent any major conferences going on at the time. I thought the service throughout the hotel was excellent and at 19 euros the breakfast was good value.Drinks and snacks are expensive but thats the nature of that type of hotel.We found some nice cafes/restaurants in the area behind the hotel and across the canal.Its well serviced by 3 different tram lines and after we purchased a 3 day travel pass it made travelling so much easier and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but bland”
Reviews.Author: plotinus4life
Reviews.Content: It was an okay hotel, but a bit out of the city center, and did not have much of a feel of 'charm' to it. Would have preferred to stay in the city center itself. I recommend that you ask for a canal-side (even-numbered) room at check-in, however, if you don't already have one - that helps, rather than the drab southern facing (odd-numbered) rooms. The distance requires taking the trams, which happily are not that difficult if you're only out until they shut down at midnight. Ask for a 7 euro 24 hour pass.

Reviews.Title: “'Last Minute' let down”
Reviews.Author: LimavegasKate
Reviews.Content: A group of us availed of a 'Last Minute' deal to stay at his hotel. The deal included a 2 night stay in 2 x double rooms and 1 x King family room. On arriving at the hotel we were advised that the hotel was overbooked and that we were being transfered to the Holiday Inn at the Airport. The receptionist was unsympathetic and unapologetic about this change despite the fact that we had booked our room almost 3 months previous to our arrival. The receptionist tried to pursued us that the airport was close to the city centre! She seemed surprised at our refusal to be transfered to an inferior classed hotel located 20 minutes outside of the city centre! we asked to speak to the duty manager who confirmed that the hotel had been overbooked that morning by conference delegates . When I asked her if the hotel had sold our reserved rooms to the higher paying confernce delegates she did not deny this suggestion. To cut a long story short, we refused to move as they were unable to offer us rooms in a 5* hotel in the centre of Amsterdam. The hotel manager managed to 'find' us rooms in the overbooked hotel. we were further disappointed however at the accomodation provide for the King family room which we had booked for 3 people. The room consisted of 1 double bed and one roll out bed for the 3rd person. The room was cramped for 3 adults and definitely not what we expected of a 5* hotel. When we raised our concerns with the duty manager he stated that it was Hiltons policy to accomodate 3 adults staying in a family room with a roll out bed. He very arrogantly asked me 'if I would like the hotel to refurbish the room for us'? He also stated that the King Family room which we booked via Last Minute did not match the type of rooms which Hilton offered. Overall we were very disappointed by the attitude of the management staff whom we found to be arrogant, unhelpful and snooty. We left with the impression that they did not welcome guests who had reserved last minute deals. If this hotel is going to accept reservation from the Last Minute.com company, it should honour its contract!! On a slightly more positive note, I would like to compliment the breakfast staff who were by marked contrast to management staff, friendly, helpful and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Stand your ground....”
Reviews.Author: Daytripper1972
Reviews.Content: Seven of us arrived at this hotel after booking a few days holidays back in January. We were told that the hotel had - just that very morning - overbooked because of a conference which had "brought more delegates". We were to be re-located to a Holiday Inn at the Airport; oh, and the hotel would "cover the cost of our taxis". 1. We didn't book to stay at the airport 2. We didn't book to stay at a Holiday Inn 3. We don't appreciate being moved because a big-spending conference outweighs our lastminute.com booking 4. So we didn't move. Miraculously, three rooms were "found", and we got to stay. I found the staff arrogant, unhelpful, and in one case, downright rude. I didn't appreciate doormen circling when we started to kick up a fuss. And I really, really, can't understand how they thought we would move from there to the airport. By the way, they DID offer a complimentary drink while we waited in the bar for them to sort out our booking - and I am glad it was complimentary, because these have to be some of the most overpriced drinks I've ever seen. I wouldn't stay here again if Conrad Hilton himself rose from the grave and offered free rooms with his great grand-daughter for company.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, but I don't need your 'policy'”
Reviews.Author: MCMember
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night for a business meeting - I chose the Hilton because part of the meeting was held there and because they had sent me a 'Gold VIP card' (I have been gold at Priority Club and Starwood although it does not really influence my choice). At check-in, I was told that this card would have needed to be activated beforehand (so, no card benefits). Disappointing but, so far, bearable. Then the thing which in my view should never happen: a lecture on Hilton's "policy" ("Our policy is ..."). I deal with policies all the time in my job, like most of us. I can understand policies when it's about Health&Safety etc. But the last thing I want at a Hotel is a lecture on Hilton's policies. I just don't care. The front desk staff suggested that I should phone "Hilton" - I could not resist saying that "I thought I was at the Hilton already ;-)". I was not really testing her sense of humour, I could imagine she did not have any ... But whether this is poor command of English on her side or another reason the tone of her voice became rather loud and tense, and not something you would use with a customer ever, unless he was indeed guilty of something. I suggested that the start was not too good and I wished to proceed with room allocation - another front desk staff took over and gave me a canal view room. Now in fairness the Hotel itself is not bad (would not be my first choice in Amsterdam, though) the room was reasonablty spacious and had been well refurbished. Although Internet access is pure armed robbery at 22â‚¬ 'economy' and 27â‚¬ 'business'!!! But, ahem ... "policy". The killing word. I won't be back, off to the Toren, the Intercontinental or the CitizenM. Sorry guys, it's my policy. I'll shred the Gold card as well.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed many times with mostly good results.”
Reviews.Author: JimmyJ
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel maybe 8 times. I don't know if they keep up with things like that, but the desk staff seems to get nicer each time. I travel a lot for biz / leisure and usually stay at Hiltons, so I usually am put in the Executive Rooms. I believe that the executive rooms are actually different at this hotel. So if the price is right, go for it. I believe they have remodeled the exec rooms recently and you get some free snacks and such. The access to the Executive Lounge is one of the best I have been in. Excellent view, but can sometimes get a little snooty in there depending on the crowd. It's true, the hotel is old, but I believe they make a good effort at keeping it clean and somewhat up to date. The rooms are usually clean and the bathrooms are very nice, Room size is good for a Euro hotel. It is NOT near the city center in case you are there for the party scene, but it is just a few minutes away by public transport (which is easy to use) You can by a tram pass at the hotel. It is well positioned for business travelers and reasonably close to the airport. Every little extra is a bit expensive, but I usually hit a deli or grocery store and stock up on my snacks and such for a fraction of the cost. The downstairs bar is very expensive, but the service is superb and you can sit and relax forever if desired. One day maybe I'll splurge for the John and Yoko Suite......when I win the lottery!

Reviews.Title: “hilton amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: freeskier81
Reviews.Content: positives: - great service - great rooms with channel views - walkin distance to city centre - park arround the corner - lovely neighbourhood - great breakfast

Reviews.Title: “A hotel that doesn't add up.”
Reviews.Author: jpossum
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night on weekend as husband playing football. The lady on reception was very unwelcoming and should perhaps be moved to a back office job. Told our room would have canal view but turned out they had let people stay longer in it so given room with view of car park. Room was fairly plain and certainly not 'warm'. Breakfast was a highlight. There is a nice breakfast chef and he prepared some special food for our toddler who was very happy. Wouldn't stay again as in a city like Amsterdam there must be a hotel with a little more character and warmth.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Melisa44
Reviews.Content: The room was super clean and the staff was absolutely fantastic! Cant wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “Probably the Best Hilton I've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: RydeTraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on the recommendation of a local colleague. What really swayed me was the fact that this is where John and Yoko held their Bed-in they sang about it in the Ballad of John and Yoko (apologies if previous reviews tell you this - I have not had a chance to read them all): "Drove from Paris to the Amsterdam Hilton / Talking in our bed for a week / The news people said / 'Hey, what you doin' in bed?'/ I said, 'We're only tryin' to get us some peace!" Although I did not spring for their suite (I don't know if room 902 is still there) this was a great hotel compared to the usual run-of-the-mill Hilton. Room was perfect , recently decorated and spotlessly clean. We only had time to try the bar, not the restaurant, but again pleasant decor, good service, yes a bit expensive. A great buzz in the little espresso bar in reception the following morning - a surprisingly chic group of guests for a Hilton. I'm told the hotel's Italian restaurant is particularly good. I'd definitely go again on business or with my family.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced extra charges and outdated”
Reviews.Author: purtzki
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights and was very disappointed. The hotel seems quite old, the rooms have a 90's touch. The outside cold weather was getting through the windows which made sitting at the desk impossible. But most of all it was overpriced with unexpected charges on top of the hotel rate: use of the gym is not free but costs 17,50 EUR extra (ridiculous for a 4 or 5 star hotel), 24 hrs internet access is 27 EUR and a pizza at the hotel restaurant is 25 EUR !!! There is no complimentary water in the room as well and on the 2nd day shower gel and shampoo were not replaced. That is certainly not Hilton standard. On the positive side the staff was friendly and the concierge recommended a nice Italian restaurant nearby. There must be better and more vlaue-for-money hotels in AMS.

Reviews.Title: “run for the hills”
Reviews.Author: tb_prestige
Reviews.Content: in all my years of travels abroad, i've never been treated to worse customer service! as a texan, i pride myself in southern hospitality and being easy to get a long with, but these people ruffled my feathers beyond belief! i think our steer are handled in a kinder manner here... the customer service was down right lousy and the concierge desk disrespected my friend on a simple request. all i can say is a big thumbs down to these guys, definitely not american friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Service was absolutely perfect, wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rusty1975
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Amsterdam Hilton on our Honeymoon. From the second we stepped out of the cab on arrival until the moment we left we were so very impressed with the service from everyone we encountered. Thankyou for a wonderful time. The room with a canal view was spotless and had everything you would ever need. The only issue is with the 27 Euro charge to use the wi-fi for 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton = Luxury?”
Reviews.Author: StripeKazama
Reviews.Content: I am not impressed by Hilton hotels. You've heard so many good things on about how it is so luxurious, everything's perfect and everything's fine. That wasn't my experience. Rude and doingeverythingtolookbusy-staff. Had to spend at least an hour by the restaurant to be escorted to a table for breakfast. Woke up from the sound of the vaccum cleaner, i.e, the maid went into my room even though i was asleep and began cleaning. This was not a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive if a little of the beaten track”
Reviews.Author: Dustys_Mum
Reviews.Content: After reading previous reviews of the Hilton Amsterdam we were pleasantly suprised. We commented a few times that we weren't sure what other reviewers we on about... We stayed in the Executive King Plus Room which overlooked the city and canal. The room was spacious and with funky furniture, carpet and wall paper. The bed was the most comfortable we have had so far in Europe. The bathroom was great with a nice, powerful shower and red tulip curtain. We had Executive Lounge access which had a nice selection of food and drinks. The staff there couldn't have been more helpful with local knowledge and guidance. Breakfast in the Executive Lounge was OK but the resturant Roberto's offered more option so we ate there the second morning. The downsides would be the location, which is quite out of the action of downtown Amsterdam, and the temperature control in the room (always cold). That said, the tram to all the main sites of the city is a 2 minute walk away and goes every 10 minutes and a cab fare to the nightlife was about 10 euro. We really liked it here and would recommend it to anyone wanting to explore Amsterdam but not be in the madness all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, staff but lousy value for money”
Reviews.Author: NYTraveller2009
Reviews.Content: I like the hotel, the room and the staff but this hotel charges YOU for everything on top of the high price hotel room. and it really adds up! Need Internet Access: 27 Euros per day Need to use the gym or health club: Pay more Need some laundry done: that will be 5 Euros for a pair of socks You can get a lot more for your money at other hotels for a lower rate.

Reviews.Title: “Good for business stay, but for fun I would be closer to the city”
Reviews.Author: 2Jax
Reviews.Content: I stayed recently at the Amsterdam Hilton and did enjoy my stay. Next time I would stay somewhere else to enjoy Amsterdam. The good: It is a great hotel with excellent service. The concierge was very helpful. The hotel was clean and well appointed. The staff was quite helpful. It was nice to be in a hotel that had all of the modern amenities one could hope. I found the room spacious and with everything I needed. In short the Hotel was very nice. Interesting note about the hotel, if you are a Beatles fan, this is the Hotel mentioned in the song "The Ballad of John and Yoko." The song goes, "Drove from Paris to the Amsterdam Hilton, Talking in our beds for a week...." You might recall this is where John and Yoko had their first Bed-In-For-Peace. There is a plaque on the door where this took place. The Bad: Unfortunately this is a nice Hilton like any other Hilton in any U.S. city which would be fine in the States, but you are in AMSTERDAM! I would try and find a hotel that has more of a local flavor. Second, this hotel is quite a bit removed from where Amsterdam really is with the shops, clubs, cafes and restaurants. You can take a tram or a long walk. All in all, it is a nice place if you are there for business, but if I was travelling to Amsterdam as a tourist I would prefer to stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent from start to finish..........”
Reviews.Author: pma262
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a long weekend in a fairly spacious Junior Suite and from the moment we arrived the hotel was faultless. Swift and efficient check-in, HHonors Gold Upgrade, cozy Executive Lounge and very attentive but unobtrusive staff who went out of their way to ensure that our stay was excellent. We are regular Hilton guests but this was the best Hilton stay for a while. Location for us was great, being 10 mins from the centre of the tourist areas by tram but nicely placed in a leafy suburb away from the noise and bustle. If I return to Amsterdam I will definitely stay at the Hilton again.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Value Uness Yo Use Points - This is a 4 star hotel, not a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: MPS_PHL
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveler and stay in many nice hotels around the world. This Hilton is a really poor value for the money. For what they are charging (I got a decent rate with Priceline.com), this hotel should be better and not nickel dime you for everything (they charged me a room service fee for delivering a plate and knife). The rooms have been renovated in the last few years however I am not sure if it was designed for my grandmother or it is trying to be modern. The fit and fittings of the room are mediocre and the hotel looks tired in general. The neighborhood is a very nice one and it is about a 20 minute walk to the Van Goh museum. I didn't find this to be a problem and enjoyed the little shops in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but”
Reviews.Author: Laurel99
Reviews.Content: Before the review a short background.
