For many years, I have been a loyal Hilton Honors VIP because they have great hotels, excellent service and offer wonderful perks, superiors to other hotel chains. For the mentioned reasons, I decided to cash in 80K HH points for 2 nights at Amsterdam Hilton. That is a lot of points! This was the first leg of 18 days European vacation in 5 different Hilton hotels and the most expensive HH points of all other hotels. From the AMS airport we took the train and the tram #5, which was fine, although the tram was crowded and with 2 mid size suitcases was difficult to get in and out without bumping anyoneâ€™s legs. We arrived at 9 am at the hotel ready for a nap. The lady at the reception welcomed us and give us the good news: they have a room available. I email the hotel a few weeks prior, asking for a room with a view, if possible. mentioning that this was a special occasion, our 10th wedding anniversary. After the good news we got the bad news: because of my HH preferences profile, we wouldnâ€™t receive any perks; meaning not a room upgrade or executive lounge privileges. I tried to explain that I spend with Hilton approximately 150 nights per year and never heard of such rule but she kept telling me that these are the hotel rules and she canâ€™t change them for me. We needed some sleep so we left for the room, a second floor small room, supposedly with canal view. As it turned out, being on the lower floor, the room has mostly view of the hotel roof rather than the water. After a few hours of sleep, I returned to the reception asking, a different lady this time, to clarify why I wasnâ€™t able to receive access to the executive lounge. She wasnâ€™t sure but after a few minutes of confusion and asking around, she came back with the same reason. I told her that was ridiculous and I wanted to speak with a manager. She looked around, went back to her computer and after of few minutes decided that we can use the executive lounge which is really great for breakfast and refreshments. At night they have all kind of hot finger foods. I noticed many people eating there at night. We did not because we wanted to go out for some nice dinners, but someone could easily make a meal out of the food is around. There is also a computer with free Internet access available in the lounge, however, the connection is very slow and even downloading my email took long time. I never encounter any lines for food or tables as others complained in previous reports. The hotel is nice, comfortable and for the most part the staff is friendly, professional and helpful. The room we got appeared to be one of the smallest they have and for Europeans standards was ok, meaning you can walk around the bed and have 2 people standing around the room in the same time. I stayed in a few hotels in Paris and Rome where you could not do that. The hotelâ€™s location is not the best. Although is situated in a very nice upscale neighborhood, is relatively removed from most attractions and if you are planning to spend most of your time in the center of the town you might want to reconsider. The trams stop running at midnight and a taxi ride is approximately 15 Euro. We liked the hotel and the executive lounge privileges are awesome; however, because of the location and reception staff attitude, next time I will probably try a hotel more centrally located. When we left, the hotel called a taxi for the airport, about 20 Euro.

Reviews.Title: “First Rate Experience at the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Tuppence1
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a trip to Iceland, Belgium and the Netherlands. We stayed at the Hilton Amsterdam both on entry to Europe and on departure from Europe. This Hilton is one of the finest. They service was superior in all respects. There was always someone waiting to assist you discreetly, immediately withdrawing if you did not require assistance. We had Executive privideges since we are Hilton Diamond members but an upgrade to the Executive services are recommended if within your budget. The view over the city is awesome, the staff gracious and professional and the food devine. There is an open bar in the evening and the hours are from early moring until late at night. They offer a full breakfast there as well. There are other restaurants downstairs. The lounge serves food and is about as comfy as a hotel lounge will ever be--you can curl up by the fire with a good book on leather chairs. The rooms are on the small side but the beds are marvelousa nd there is a pillow menu and other amenities. Since it was my birthday, there was a chilled bottle of champagne and a one of the most marvelous cakes we have ever tasted. Enjoy "anything goes" Amsterdam. It's a great city and this Hilton, while a bit out of the way, is worth the quiet location. This Hilton also has nice-looking boats for rent and bikes for these so inclined. They offer a taxi voucher to Shciopol for 33 euros--we met someone who had paid 100 for the same distance. (As previously noted, taxi service in Amsterdam can be risky). Tuppence

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but a bit far from the sites.”
Reviews.Author: JPoChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed this hotel very much! The rooms were rather large and very new. The lobby and back grounds were amazing. The hotel is located on a canal and the views are great. There is a restaurant/bar/sitting area in the back that overlooks the canal-beautiful. The staff were amazing...we were only there for 2 days and they knew our names! Two drawbacks-the hotel is located a bit far from the sites. Before we travelled to Amsterdam it seemed that we were only going to be just slightly outside the main city area...BUT Amsterdam is set up in such a way that traveling a short distance can take a while because the roads and canals. Don't get me wrong the hotel was great...we were only there for 2 days so we would have liked to be closer to the sites. Second drawback-no free internet. Also, the hotel has bikes to borrow but we were advised to not ride them closer to the city...good idea! We saw a few close calls with taxis and bikes.

Reviews.Title: “average Hilton, some with better rooms”
Reviews.Author: londonportsmouth
Reviews.Content: Pros: Nice view if room facing the back and good service. Cons: not all rooms have been updated, slight distance from the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: jamidjc
Reviews.Content: OK... so it's a bit out of the way from town but I loved being able to travel to and from the main hub. If your a Hilton Honers Diamond club then this place is great. They have a great free breakfast and a fun early evening snacks and bar on the top floor... also if your staying here... RENT a BIKE... the best way to get around and see Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Optimal hotel, only a little far from center”
Reviews.Author: Tom_Slick_001
Reviews.Content: No problem with this beautiful hilton hotel, and even more interesting if you could book with the promotional prices that can discount (if you find the best combinations) up to 50% the price. Only a little far from centre but in 7/8min walk you are at the museum district and in 5min walk you can take the tram that brings you in 10 minutes at the heart of the city (or 15 min if you need the railway station).

Reviews.Title: “WE WERE MADE TO FEEL VERY SPECIAL- THE SERVICE WAS EXCEPTIONAL”
Reviews.Author: yvonnea
Reviews.Content: we booked our stay with expedia and got a very good rate of Â£224 for one night and second night free. on our booking request we had requested a canal view room but at check in i did not want to ask for this again, seeing that a previous review said that they were made to pay extra. we got to our room which was an executive room which was clean, spacious ,large , pillow menu, robe, slippers - everything you could wish for and it was overlooking the car park/ front of the hotel. within 5 minutes we got a telephone call from reception saying that they have just noticed on our booking that we had requested a canal view room and we could have one at no extra cost . we went out to lunch and came back and our bags were moved into the new room which was now overlooking the back of the hotel with a canal view. had breakfast included in our rate - the staff were extremely friendly courteous attentive - the chef came up to me twice two mornings running and asked if i needed anything ( the spread was unbelievable - how could you want anything more!!) . On the day of check out he even gave me some ham rolls and waffles to take on the journey and was still asking do we need anything else. checking out i didnt even have to give my name or room number , they knew ,and told me nothing extra to pay and to have a safe trip. yes the hilton was pricey but if you did your homework you would know this. the service was exceptional. the staff were efficient courteous friendly , especially the chef and reception staff. they could not do enough for you . i think if staff are happy it reflects through their work and the hilton seems to be very well run. i would definately rate this a five star and would happyly recommend this hotel. in fact im planning next years trip . the location is in a leafy area of amsterdam very near to the attactions. the museum district is 5 mins on the tram and the trams run frequently . trams 5 and 24 takes you to central station. what more could you ask for?? i

Reviews.Title: “Long ways from the heart of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: kta99
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice....an older Hilton.....but would not stay again because of its location. It 's location is not close to the heart of Amsterdam. If you want a quiet place to stay.....and don't want to venture out....this is a good place to do it. If you want to be in/out of your room throughout the day this is not the place to stay. There are many other places that are quiet and closer as we discovered once there.

Reviews.Title: “Not close enough to town”
Reviews.Author: DouggieHead
Reviews.Content: 20 mins walk to town...... apart from that, worth staying there if you get a good deal from Hilton on the room price.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but expensive”
Reviews.Author: hotelhoppers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights to celebrate our wedding anniversary. We arrived at around 10.30 after a no-hassle journey by train and tram from the airport (public transport in Amsterdam is second-to-none) and were delighted to be told that our room was ready (we had not expected to be able to check in until 2pm). Our 'deluxe queen' room was spotlessly clean and comfortable and had lovely views over the river and Hilton's tiny private marina. We were delighted to spot a heron sitting on one of the boats one evening. Although it was a fair walk to the centre of Amsterdam from the hotel (15-20 minutes), it was a pleasant walk through an up-market residential area and we were lucky with the weather, which was glorious. The hotel is near the Vondelpark and we enjoyed a picnic there on our anniversary. The hotel is very expensive for food and drinks (the mini bar prices are extortionate, as someone else has pointed out) but we had anticipated this and ate elsewhere (the Aran Irish bar serves a delicious and very reasonably-priced cooked breakfast as well as continental). This was our third trip to Amsterdam and was, undoubtedly, the best. It was worth the extra money to stay at this hotel and I would recommend it, even if you only sleep there, as we did. If you are not on such a tight budget, there is a lovely covered dining area at the water's edge and a restaurant and bar also overlooking the river. In the evening, the trees are lit up with fairy lights and it is very romantic. A lovely stay, overall and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location, very comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: Katieciz
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is not in the city-center, it is still in a great location very near the museum district. We walked from the train station to the hotel and it took about an hour (leisurely walking and snapping photos). Took the tram on the way back which was a better idea. It's a quiet location and the bed is really comfy. The bathroom was wonderful as well! I was able to take a very relaxing bath. Would absolutely stay here again (especially on honors points again!)

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: irishrover
Reviews.Content: I really liked the location of this hotel. It is a very quiet, upmarket area within walking distance of the Museumplein and the Vondelpark. There are shops and cafes nearby. You do need to get a tram into the centre of town, unless, like us, you use bikes. Cycling really is the best and most enjoyable way of getting around Amsterdam. Unlike other reviewers, I found the breakfast to be great. I had perfect poached eggs made to order and served speedily each morning.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay but not in center of town”
Reviews.Author: JLW05
Reviews.Content: Having gotten a very good rate for this hotel I decided that it was worth our while to stay 15 minutes outside the center of town. We arrived from the Airport and took the train to Amsterdam Zuid and then took Tram #5 to Apollolaan. It was a very short ride and much cheaper than taking a taxi. You can buy a 24, 48 or 72 hour transportation pass at the tourist center at the airport. You can also buy strips of tickets good for use on the trams and buses in Amsterdam at the Hilton. I don't know how much they cost but I am certain buying in strips significantly discounts the cost of transportation. We didn't recognize the Hilton as a hotel at first. We thought it was perhaps a hospital! We didn't see the modern Hilton Logo and it wasn't until we realized that this building was indeed the Hilton that we noticed the structure did indeed say "Hilton" somewhere on top of the building. The Lobby was very nicely decorated and check-in was very easy. I asked for and was given a canal view room, albeit on the first floor. The room was large for European standards. We asked for one bed but the "bed" was really two beds pushed together. The furnishings were very nice and the bed linens were of a high quality. The bathroom was large with nice toiletries. The only complaint I had about the room was the high cost of the mini-bar. Unbelievable! A Coke was 7 euros (over $10 US)!!!! Now consider that it you walk outside the main entrance to the hotel and make a right and keep going up the street (Emmastraat. my spelling may be off) for a few blocks, you will come to a supermarket on the corner where you can purchase soda (warm) for .47 Euros. That's about 75 cents U.S. There were no ice machines at the Hilton so if you want ice while staying as a guest you have to call room service. If you are planning on using the internet during your stay - beware. It costs $42 a night. In this day in age where so many hotels offer free wireless, that seemed really expensive. Although the hotel is about 15 minutes to the center of town, you can take Tram #5 or #19 into town. If you walk out of the hotel, make a right and then your first right (Emmastraat or close to that name) you will find the tram. It is a very short walk. By the #5 tram was a few blocks with restaurants and near the #19 tram were several restaurants as well. We ate at a tapas restaurant near the #19 tram and it was moderately priced and tasty. Food in Amsterdam is high by US standards. I noticed that some delis did not have indoor tables but did have benches or tables outside where you could sit and eat. These delis were of course much less expensive than full service restaurants. If you are really on a budget you can always go into an Albert's supermarket and buy sandwiches, etc. Actually, the supermarket was a great place to buy inexpensive presents for the folks back home such as Dutch caramel cookies in attractive tins, chocolate, etc. If I were to return to Amsterdam and could get a good rate at the Hilton, I would have no hesitation about returning. I

Reviews.Title: “Very Romantic, good location, clean”
Reviews.Author: IstBruxa
Reviews.Content: Very Romantic, good location, just 10 minutes from the city center with tram 5 or 16

Reviews.Title: “Not bad...”
Reviews.Author: LyndsScotland
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights while on a business trip. A family member works for The Hilton so I've stayed in so many Hiltons, I've lost count. This one was good, however if I'd been paying the full rate, I would not have been so happy. The hotel is very clean and my room was too. The reception staff were rather helpful, although the odd one was rather arrogant. Internet access is a complete rip off and the biggest disappointment was breakfast. Having stayed in lots of Hiltons, even those I've not been happy in (as there's plenty out there that are not so nice), you can always rely on a fantastic breakfast. Perhaps I caught the Amsterdam Hilton on a bad day, as the breakfast was very poor. Plenty of choice, but you could only identify the bacon by its dental records (it was cremated!). The scrambled eggs could have been bounced off the wall. Basically most of the breakfast items hadn't been cooked well or left out too long. I ate brekkie at 9.30am, so it's not like I was there for the last 10 mins. The location was ok for me, however it is a good bit away from the centre, so if you want to use this as a base for a vacation, then you won't be in the "thick of it". I've given it 5 for value but only due to the family rate, which is superb.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, lack of food in lounge”
Reviews.Author: enjoyer80
Reviews.Content: Been there last weekend. Hotel is located some minutes of drive out of centre, but transportation is very good in Amsterdam, so no worries. Taxi costed 14 â‚¬ to Dam Square; Room service is great, as they brought ice in few minutes after ordering. Was little dissapointed in TV entertainment, as there were only 5 movies available (17.5 â‚¬ each!!!). Also wireless internet is pretty expensive in rooms, I do not know why do they have to charge so much!!! Breakfast was great, snacks in executive lounge were litlle bit dissapointing - not enough for all people, we waited long for wine as well... Anyway, not the cheapest hotel, but worth the money,...

Reviews.Title: “good location, lovely breakfast”
Reviews.Author: agataa
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my partner for his birthday. Paid small money for the stay as I was a staff member from different Hilton. Service was excellent. Got a complementary bottle of sparkling wine, fruits and chocolates. Rooms were comfortable and very clean. I had the best pancakes ever for breakfast. Hotel is located in walking distant to Van Gogh museums and the city centre is only a few bus stops away.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel, lovely location, amazing views!”
Reviews.Author: fightingfit
Reviews.Content: I really can't recommend this hotel highly enough! We saw the reviews for this hotel on Trip Advisor and managed to get a good deal on lastminute.com. It was my partners 30th birthday so I emailed beforehand to see if we could get a room with a city view. Not only did we get this but we also arrived back on our first night to find champagne, strawberries and cake had been left in our room. A very nice touch I think and it really made our night. If you can get a room with a city view it is beautiful. The windows are huge so you have an amazing view out onto the canal in front of the hotel, the surrounding area and Amsterdam central in the distance. This is lovely in the evening too. The room was outstanding, it was immaculately clean and the bed was amazingly comfy. It even had a pillow menu, if you'd like a different pillow! We had tea and coffee on the garden terrace a few times. It is overpriced at 6 euros each but it's almost worth it for the surroundings, it's a great spot. The only real bad point about the hotel is the price of the mini bar (7 euros for a can of coke, hmmm!) and the price of the breakfast (27 euros for continental, 32 for an american breakfast). I rarely don't know how they can justify this price. We would have considered it as it was a special occasion if we could have had it in the rooftop executive lounge as it was supposed to have 'a jawdropping view' but we were told that this wasn't allowed as we weren't in an executive room and if we did want breakfast it would be in the standard restaurant downstairs. So there really was no way I could pay Â£25 for some special K, yoghurt, a couple of pastries and a coffee! I know most of these reviews comment on the location but I think it's made clear it's a little bit out of the centre. We loved the location, it was in a nice residential district and only 5 minutes walk to the park or to the tram stop. We walked back in the evening and felt perfectly safe so don't worry about that. The 5 tram will take you right into the centre and back until midnight. I think tram 16 will too. To get here from airport, just take the train from Schipol to 'Amsterdam Station Zuid', we got our tickets at the self service machines for about 5.20 euros for both of us. From here just follow the signs for the trams and jump on the 5 tram going to 'Centraal Station'. We bought a strippenkaart (you can then use these later on all the trams) in the AH supermarket at the airport but you can just pay on the tram. It's about 80 cents I think. You need to get off at 'Apolollaan' which is about 4 stops away. From there turn back, walk over the bridge and turn right and then right again through a residential area and its right in front of you. Someone told us it would be about 40 euros in a taxi so much cheaper! So overall a superb hotel and we would be hard pressed to stay anywhere else in Amsterdam now! It was without doubt the best hotel I've stayed in. We loved it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “We found location to be perfect!”
Reviews.Author: PKWGMichigan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton on June 27, 2009. Our room was via Hotwire...a fantastic rate for this hotel. At first arrival, I was disillusioned on the location...a 20 euro cab ride from station. However, our room had a real King size bed and was the most comfy of our entire vacation. We overlooked the canal and it was just peaceful and pretty. Once we started walking we never actually took the tram into the city centre, but rather walked...Very close to the museum / fashion district which ended up being our favorite part of town. We walked to a restaurant called PALMA which was in a little square and was absolutely fantastic...do try and look it up! We had a glass of wine on the hotel terrace (a little pricey yes, but the ambiance was fantastic for a Sunday afternoon). We found the hotel service excellent and knew ahead of time that breakfast, etc was pricey and didn't have any. Highly recommend this hotel for those travelers who are not in AMS for late night party scene as you would indeed be disappointed. However if you are the traveler who enjoys being out of the noise and mayhem of a large city and prefer a 'neighborhood' location, I think this is a great location! Note: if you walk out of hotel and head toward recommended tram stop, short distance to city centre, however if you turn Left and walk that road - and follow the maps to the "Cornelius......" district - very nice, very pretty and quaint, lots of cafe's, shops, etc...this was no more than 5 minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “Nice 5 Star Hotel, far from Center”
Reviews.Author: AnaCaro-CostaRica
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great, food and rest of amenities very, very pricey. We payed 17 Euros for an Apple Pie (including room service charge). Hotel was far from central Amsterdam, after midnight transportation was hard to find since you could only get a cab and it was pricey. Loved the hotel, but not a big fan of the location being this the 3rd time I`ve been in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: diamond63
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a little out of town but around 5 mins from a tram stop that takes you directly to and from central station, which takes around 15 - 20 mins, so not a problem.The hotel has a lovely lobby with a very efficient front desk. The room was large, nicely decorated and very clean. Breakfast room very nice,if you get to sit in the back room it has lovely view of the lake. Breakfast was good, plenty of choice, waitresses all very attentive and very polite.. Bar prices expensive as is restaurant but you would expect this in a four star hotel. All in all a good hotel, would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Amsterdam Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Insatiable Nomad
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Amsterdam Hilton for 7 nights in mid May 2009. It was a combination business/leisure trip. We arrived at the hotel and were immediately greeted with a warm "we've been expecting you" welcome. We were upgraded to a room with access to the executive lounge which was a very nice treat. The hotel was spotless, the staff and the service were impeccable. Any request was immediately attended to - including weighing our suitcases to see if they were within airline weight restrictions before embarking on the next leg of our journey. Regarding the location, the hotel is located in a quiet, upscale, residential neighborhoold. 10 minutes on the tram though, and you are right in the heart of Amsterdam so it's really the best of both worlds. It is expensive to stay here, but if you can afford it, it's well worth it. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - loved the little extra s”
Reviews.Author: Twinkle_Babyshop
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a business trip in this hotel, just for one day but I enjoyed it. I liked all those little and thoughtfull extras like a card with all kinds of pillows so you can choose a pillow you like. Nice terrace and friendy staff. As I am not a big breakfast eater, the costs for a breaksfast where quite high (29 euro). Maybe it is an Idea to have also breakfast vouches for small eaters?

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel -- John and Yoko picked it so can't be all that bad”
Reviews.Author: hawkeye478
Reviews.Content: Older hotel but well maintained, friendly staff that all spoke English better than me! Restaurant and Bars unbeliveably expensive but a couple of blocks away a number of different restuarants -- Tapas, Italian that were extremely good at reasonable prices. Hotel a little ways from centre of town but by bus 5 minutes to Van Gogh museum and water taxis. Booked through Hotwire for 129.00 US so great deal.

Reviews.Title: “No wonder John and Yoko slept in!”
Reviews.Author: TriniAussie
Reviews.Content: At the end of January 2009, my wife and I embarked on a European tour, where we visited London, Athens, Rome, Venice, Vienna, Paris, Amsterdam, Oslo, and then we popped back to London. We chose all of our hotels based on reviews that we read on this website, so it is our duty to come online and at least write a short review. Tripadvisor was a Godsend, and we swear by it now. This hotel had everything advertised, and everything you would expect from a Hilton: a safe, complimentary tea and coffee, excellent toiletries, a very large room, new furnishings, a large television, a good sized bathroom, a large desk etc etc. The service was excellent, as you would expect, and the breakfast was a proper Hilton breakfast: lots of hot foods (eggs, sausages, pancakes etc.), as well as the usual breads, cheeses, fruits etc. Fill up here, and you wonâ€™t be hungry until mid-afternoon. The standard room that we stayed in for three nights was so comfortably large and well furnished, that you can thoroughly understand why John and Yoko slept in for peace. My wife and I were tempted to do just that actually! A pro, or con (depending on what you are after), is that the hotel is not in the city centre. It will be a trek and a half to walk to the flower market, or the main train station etc, but luckily there is the reliable tram system nearby, and it takes only fifteen minutes to get to the end of the line (the main train station). But how near is near? Expect a brisk seven minute walk, in fairly desolate, residential surroundings to the tram stop (a bit scary to walk back to the hotel after dark). Restaurants are also a 10-15 minute walk away, so be prepared to walk, buy on your way back, or to pay high prices in the hotel. Overall, I would wholeheartedly recommend this hotel to any traveller that does not mind taking public transport (or a cab) to the city centre. If you are after an extremely comfortable hotel, that comes at a steal of a deal (this was one of the cheapest hotels that we stayed at in any city, and keep in mind that we stayed in a few 3-stars on our trip), then this hotel is for you. An added bonus is that every time you see a Beatles documentary, or you are chatting with your mates about Lennon and the sleep in for peace comes up, you can just mention in passing that you stayed there too. ï�Š

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: sylvia_m0
Reviews.Content: This hotel came up heavily discounted on Hotwire and it was well worth the money. Large rooms and nice public spaces. The staff couldn't have been nicer, very very professional. It is out of the city but very close to a tram stop and easy to get in and out of the city. I did not miss the noise of the city one bit - I've stayed in Amsterdam before and the partying in some areas can be quite loud.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a very quiet location.....”
Reviews.Author: AHotelier
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Amsterdam as I was attending a conference.... I was meant to stay two nights but due to heavy snow I arrived a day late. So when I checked in I was a bit 'frazzled' to say the least but I was pleasantly surprised at the warm welcome & check-in that I recieved...(I used to work for Hilton)! The room was good, slightly on the small side (Exec. rm) but when staying for one night do you need more than the bed & the shower?! The Exec Lounge was nice & quiet, on the top floor with great views & nicely stocked with soft drinks, nibbles & fruit; perfect for having meetings etc. There is a nice garden which backs on to a canal....... Very nice, it's a shame I went in the winter! The reception staff were wonderful..... Offering me a place to change after my meetings. The concierge staff were also very very helpful. Unfortunately the bar let the hotel down slightly as each time I ordered a drink thay made me sign a bill even though I did inform them that I would be having many more.... This was very annoying!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: rmcc189
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Service friendly, knowledgable and most welcoming. Room large, well presented and clean. Very comfortable with great views over Amsterdam. The hotel is located in a residential suburb of Amsterdam but public transport is excellent and there is good access to the airport by rail without interchange in the city centre. Overall highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not as expected”
Reviews.Author: Padanius
Reviews.Content: First of all the hotel is NOT in the city centre, but in residential area (OK). Expect 15 minute tram or 30 minute walk into town. Bikes are also available for free at the hotel The cheapest way from the airport is to take the train into Amsterdam central station, and just outside your can take the tram #24 that tends at the Central station and land at the Apollolaan stop, approx 20 minutes later. Taxi from the train station costs approx. 20 Euros. Tram tickets are not easy to find around town, but they told us that they available at the metro station. Once at the Hilton, the cost of internet access is simply outrageous. I paid â‚¬27 Euros per each day of my stay ($35/day). We also expected to have at least free internet (wireless) access in the executive lounge, but there was only one terminal available where we could only stand, with no chair or table. No printer either. The executive lounge is nice and cosy with a nice view of the town, but it is extremely small and crowded, especially for breakfast. Expect to be re-routed to the restaurant downstairs during busy breakfast hours. We had to change room late in the evening, because the TV in our room was not working at all. This problem could have been checked in advance. The size of the room and especially the size of TV was also rather small for the class the hotel, also given the fact that our room has been "upgraded" due to my Gold HHonour membership. We clearly seee that this hotel is quite old, but has been renovated several times. The selection of TV channels for an Int'l hotel in one of Europe's business capitals was rather poor, with and excessive number of Dutch stations, and a very poor choice of other European channels. For example, no programs in Italian or Spanish were available, and only one program in French. BBC was also not available, and the only Int'l channel in English was CNN. The main German, Austrian and Swiss channels were also missing. Last but not least, the air conditioning in the room is extremely noisy, especially at night. Both rooms we staid had the same problem. We solved this by switching it off in the middle of the night, and by opening the windows, only to be awakened several times by noise of people entering the hotel late past midnight, and at sharply at 7 AM by men and tools at work in the Hotel courtyard. Despite the high rack rate, overall satisfaction was rather poor for a Hilton hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Far from the centre, but okay”
Reviews.Author: luxurytrvalencia
Reviews.Content: Oldish Hilton. Service good. Minibar is not cheap. Nice amenties. Far away from the centre, but you can take a tram or a taxi after hours. Nice and quiet neighbourhood. Will perhaps stay closer to downtown next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service...Quiet Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: nkirsch1
Reviews.Content: Very nice Hilton. Spent 2 nights in November in what I would call Off-season. We arrived early morning and was cheerfully greeted. When I asked for a nice room, they asked if I would like a canal view. My Priceline payment of $140 USD was never questioned. When I told them, we were there for our wedding anniversary, we were told that a very nice room would be available in an hour. It actually was available before we finished checking in. The room was very comfortable, though not large, and did overlook the canal. The hotel is a few blocks away from the Museum District, very walkable. The whole city is very walkable, but make sure you look in all directions. With bicycles, trams and cars coming and going, it is smart to walk close to the buildings. This advice is coming from a New Yorker. Trams are plentiful, so unless you are touring by bike, purchase a multi-ride tram ticket from the concierge. Two lines stop a short walk away. A Hilton specialty, the first evening at the hotel, the front desk sent to our room, a bottle of Proseco, a cake, and strawberries, in honor of our anniversary. It added a special touch to very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but no free gym”
Reviews.Author: tagretchen
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton for 5 nights in November 2008. The hotel doesn't look like much from the outside, but the rooms are modern and comfortable. Room service food was good and presented very elegantly. Also the buffet breakfast offered a lot of options. The hotel is located in a sleepy part of town, and the immediate area is deserted at night. But a few blocks walk takes you to high end cafes and shopping (Chanel, Valentino etc.) There is a fitness center within the hotel building, but it is not owned by the hotel. Thus, it is 17.50 euros a day. I thought this was a pricey add on considering the cost of the hotel. One tip. You can buy taxi vouchers at the bell desk for fixed rates to certain destinations. These rates are the best cab fares you'll find.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite perfect”
Reviews.Author: ByAirMail
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a business trip. I expected trouble free, smooth 5 star experience. Unfortunately it was not spotless. Reception was good and wellcoming. Room was OK, but nothing special. Unfortunately LAN connection in room was not working, but luckily the wireless was working. I also visited the gym, which was OK, even good, but extra rate made it a bit expensive. With 250+ night rate you could expect a free gym visit, right? Breakfast was OK, nothing special (remember the 5 stars rating!). Most sad thing was problem with the room bill unclarity -those should not happen with a 5 start hotel. Some room for improvement exist!

Reviews.Title: “Best way to start our honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: tapdancer77
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for approx. $179 USD/night on hotwire. We were not disappointed. From the moment we checked in to the time we left, everyone was polite, friendly, welcoming (even when we came in at 3 a.m. after a night on the town) and the service was flawless. I truly cannot say enough nice things about this hotel. Believe the "Best Luxury Amsterdam" award given by TripAdvisor! I would gladly stay here again in a heartbeat, and so would my partner! The one drawback is that the hotel is slightly outside the main tourist attractions, but is easily accessible via either Tram 5/24 or Tram 16. The neighborhood is arguably the nicest in Amsterdam (very tony houses along a wide canal), and the location is actually very close to the airport (if you are taking an airport-hotel shuttle, you will likely be the first dropped off from the airport and the last picked up before the airport).

Reviews.Title: “Love The View”
Reviews.Author: 01ofvisadventures
Reviews.Content: Property is located out of the mainstream Red Light District in a charming tree lined neighborhood. We attempted getting there by train, but were unable to communicate well enough to make it all the way. We finally just got off and grabbed a taxi, as we had been traveling for quite a while....We MAY have had better luck just getting on the tram. If you choose this one over the airport Hilton, I would plan ahead a bit better than we did! Perhaps you could contact the hotel and find out which train or tram to take. Definitely get written directions and an address. When we got it in the taxi, our driver did not seem to know where it was. May have been a communication problem. Our room overlooked the canal and some very nice homes were across from us. We had a very large picture window and two windows on either end swung out to let a breeze in. Truly I could have sat there for hours just enjoying the view and gorgeous mahogany boats along the canal. Otherwise, the room was very comfortable. They have bicycles for you to use for no charge. The pool looks over the canal, though it was a bit chilly for us. They have a nice outdoor dining area on the canal. The Executive Lounge was acceptable, but seemed a bit less warm than others we have been in, and on the smallish side. On the rooftop; glassed in, however, you could not go outside. They did have some sushi and cocktails for Happy Hour. The sofas at the end of the room are a much more cozy place to sit than the tables scattered amongst the serving areas. We chatted with a couple of guys from Sweden and L.A. and we all made arrangements to meet later in the evening after dinner. Nice fellow travelers! The neighborhood surrounding the Hilton was very pleasant and safe feeling. There is a tram stop just down the street that is very easy to use and inexpensive. Great way to get around. At the main intersection to the right just a little ways there is a nice little shopping district for picking up souvenirs, wine, and boutique shopping. The lobby has a couple of very upscale shoppes. Front desk attendants were efficient and professional. Bedding and bath amenities were nice and above average. We enjoyed staying here because it felt like a very safe area and gave of a sense of a real neighborhood in Holland. It would be nice for families. Nothing seedy here! There are plenty of photos of the Hilton here, so I will post some of the surrounding neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Swanky Digs”
Reviews.Author: TectonicGreg
Reviews.Content: The hotel was amazing. It was in a quiet residential neighbourhood south of downtown, and you can get downtown on a tram stop a block away in 15 minutes by buying a `strippenkart' at the little store in the lobby. We stayed for a week and they called to ask what extra they could do for us, since most of the people stay just for a weekend. The staff were very helpful with the questions we had about the city. The room itself was beautiful. One hitch was we brought our laptop and they didn't have free Internet, which was a surprise since we had splurged to get into this nice hotel. We also avoided the restaurant because it was expensive for tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it all”
Reviews.Author: PhyllisG200
Reviews.Content: We loved it all, service, room, food. Used airline miles to pay. The weather was great, so walking was a pleasure. We asked the concierge where to it and thought he'd recommend the hotel. He didn't. Gave us a choice of local restaurants. We tried one and really loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: tunabear
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Hilton Amsterdam which we booked through priceline and got a good rate. The hotel is up to date - room was nice, lobby and view were nice. The staff were friendly and helpful. We did not use any of the amenities or restaurants at the hotel. The hotel is about a ten minute walk from the tram stop in a nice quiet neighborhood. Many of the city's attractions are a long walk from the Hilton but at the rate we got, we can't complain. If in Amsterdam again, the Hilton would be an option but we might consider hotels closer to town depending on the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FrequentFlyer19
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel and even though we only stayed for a night, we definitely enjoyed our stay and would have stayed longer if we had time. Staff was extremely helpful and very knowledgable of the area. They even let us check in early and prepared our room while we waited in the grand lobby which looked like something you would see in a movie with Roman or Greek theme with tall marble beams and "ceasar's castle-like" furnitures. Highly recommend!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: exprtcyprustraveller
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel around 8:30 in the evening and once we freshened up went to the restaurant. Had a very good meal. The hotel caters to everything we could desire it too. The rooms were elegant and luxurious, and extremely spacious. 230 Euros for one night would be really worth it if we had managed to get there early in the day. Cental location. A true Hilton Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pack your credit card!”
Reviews.Author: Gastropod
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Amsterdam for a long weekend in August '08. The architecture of place itself is rather dated and although well up to 5 star standards, is beginning to appear a litte scruffy at the corners. Service was courteous but formulaic. No complaints at all here but as another review says, this hotel is clearly aimed at the business community. We were on a "deal" where breakfast was not included. At 22 Euros for a croissant and a cuppa, aka a continental breakfast, we opted to step out and to take our breakfasts at nearby cafes. There are plenty of them in the surrounding streets, all within a five minute stroll. The cost of the internet was another joke! 22 Euros for 24 hours is nothing short of extortion! Once set up, this is practically all profit and I am sure that if they were to reduce prices to realistic levels, they would get far more business. We used the bar on the arrival evening but again, felt extremely uncomfortable by the prices charged although service was very good. In truth, the cost of all these ancillary services really made us feel like we were being ripped off. We do expect to pay a premium price for services in a top hotel, but these were simply eye-bulging! It is not pleasant to feel that you have to go to nearby cafes, restaurants, bars and internet cafes but this is what we decided to do rather than use the excellent facilities in the hotel itself. The location of the hotel is in a quiet suburb, a little way outside the city centre. Amsterdam is a small city and it is entirely possible to walk to the "bright lights" of whatever hue takes your fancy. Alternatively, take a tram. Amsterdam has an excellent tram system which is inexpensive and efficient. The neighbourhood is well served on several tram routes. If you are travelling for leisure, like we were, I would suggest you take a lonnnnnnng look at the alternatives. Alternatively, pack your credit card!

Reviews.Title: “very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: genemean
Reviews.Content: a really fine hotel.....the greatest mattress I have ever experienced and the linen was top of the line.....Tips....trams #5 and 24 get you to within 2 blocks but you cannot see the hotel until you walk the two blocks. Get off at Apollolaan. Plus, the tram may not stop unless you push the button ahead of time. My biggest complaint was the TV remote. It was difficult to make a channel selection. The second complaint was that a bottle of coke from the mini bar was$11.

Reviews.Title: “Diamond members treated poorly”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler089
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property for 2 nights and used hilton hhonors points. I checked in at around 1pm and was told the only room available was one with two twin beds, right next to the elevator with a view of the lovely parking lot. My profile clearly states I prefer a King bed away from the elevator. I was so tired at the time I decided to just accept the room because the clerk was unsure as to when another room would become available. When I entered the room I noticed wall paper peeling off the walls, somewhat dirty carpet and just an overall dingy feel. I was so glad that I wasn't actually paying for this crap. I decided to check out the executive lounge and on my way up I met two guests who had checked in a few hours before. They were not hilton hhonors members and they booked their room on priceline. Surprisingly they were given a junior suite facing the canal. I complained to the front desk and was given a multitude of ludicrious excuses as to why I wasn't upgraded. I suspect the gentleman who checked me in had lied about which rooms were available. At this property as a Diamond member I was offered the worst available room instead of the best available room. On to the good part. The executive lounge was truly excellent. The breakfast consisted of eggs, meats, cereals, fruits, nuts and pastries. There were always drinks and snacks available all day. At night they served sushi, egg rolls, and french pastries. The staff was very attentive, always asking if I needed anything. All and all it made up for the crappy room. One other bad part to the hotel is the location. It's very far from the city centre and even farther from the central station. Besides the restaurant in the hotel there are no places to eat in the area. There are numerous trams about a block from the hotel but if you plan on walking to the sites, it's quite a hike. On to the fitness facility. It was absolutely great for a hotel gym. Although the moment i walked into the facility I was asked to remove my shoes. They do not permit outside shoes in the fitness area. What's especially perplexing about this is that the staff is so concerned about dirt on the floor but in the area around the equipment there was no anti-bacterial spray . In other words they don't care if someone sweats all over the equipment but they are terrified if by chance a speck of dirt is found on one of the treadmills or on the floor. Next time I return to Amsterdam for a day or two I'll just stay at the airport hilton property.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay at the Amsterdam Hilton”
Reviews.Author: TravlFam
Reviews.Content: We got a great rate through Priceline. Stayed for 2 nights and then moved to the Marriott for two nights. The Hilton is in a very nice part of Amsterdam - quieter than the center of town. We enjoyed exploring this area and seeing how people lived in this upscale area. Getting into Amsterdam was a breeze with the tram or by taxi. Hotel services were quite expensive as is most of Europe due to Euro. We opted to get coffee and breakfast outside of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous breakfast and toiletries, tea!”
Reviews.Author: NixKitz
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 2 nights over Easter 2008. We booked direct with the hotel. In hindsight perhaps we could have got a cheaper rate, although perhaps Easter is a premium time. Got a bit lost trying to find the hotel as we got off at the wrong tram stop. Once you are there though the hotel is a close walk (maybe 5 mins max) to two different tram lines which makes getting into the main area easy, and in the day time we mostly walked anyway (took about 30 mins to Ann Frank's). The area around the hotel is mostly residential. It is a bit quiet at night, although I felt safe walking back with my husband, and the fact that it is residential means that there are several 'local' bars and cafes nearby which were nice to spend time in. The reception is very airy and pleasant. As it was Easter there was loads of yummy mini easter eggs which were lovely! We were checked into our room efficiently. The corridors are a little bland. Our room was a twin so we telephoned reception and were upgraded to a junior suite as there were no other doubles left. The original room was clean but quite small and bland. The suite was larger with a lovely long couch. Both rooms overlooked one of the city's canals. Positives about the room: Extremely clean. The room was cleaned twice daily with toiletries replenished in the evening too when a token nightime chocolate was left on the bed. Bed was huge and very comfortable. The room was quite dark but there was a few lamps scattered about for 'ambience'. The toiletries were lush! All Crabtree & Evelyne La Source products. Two dressing gowns and slippers were provided. Shower was powerful and the bath a decent size. As I mentioned already, it was spotlessly clean which is important to me. We weren't sure if there was complimentary mineral water provided - some seemed to be chargeable so we left that alone. The mini bar was the usual pricey drinks/snacks. The hotel had fantastic tea! Rituals teabags - they come in silk pouches of different flavours and are the best! Have since bought a couple of packs back in London! The only negatives I can think of to mention about the room is the fact that it is a bit chain hotel bland, and the tv was in an odd position. You could watch it in bed, but it was facing away from the couch which rendered it a bit pointless....although Amsterdam is a great city with far better things to do than watch tv! The other negative about the hotel is the extortionate charge to use a gym adjacent to the building. Not worth it! My credit card did not swipe properly on check in so the hotel left a note in our room to ask to have this re-swiped. This was not a problem. The best thing, however, about the hotel was the fantastic buffet breakfast! It was by far the best range and quality of buffet food that we have had at a city hotel. The staff were lovely - think not many people order porridge as it seemed quite a surprise to them both days, but I would recommend! There was LOADS of fresh juices to help yourself to (kiwi juice anyone?!) and champagne on the sunday although we did not indulge. There was a large table full of fruit, cold meats, cheeses. An area full of breads and pastries. Lots of hot food: pancakes, sausages, eggs etc. A great omelette station where staff cooked infront of you. Suffice to say we were full for most of the day! Would defnitely stay here again in Amsterdam. We knew beforehand that it wasn't that central, which is its only downfall, but if we enjoyed it during a freezing weekend of snow, then I think it's fine the rest of the year!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: McElian
Reviews.Content: For the price of this hotel, I expected more. There's nothing terribly wrong with it, it's just a little faded and stuffy. Prices for food and amenities are fairly outrageous as it primarily caters to business travelers. For example 28 Euros for a club sandwich from room service is pretty steep. If you want a quiet neighborhood in Amsterdam though, this is the place. It's a bit of a walk even to the Museumplein/Van Gogh museum (about 15 minutes) but its a nice place to explore Amsterdam from as its well away from the ridiculous tourist stuff, the coffee shops/red light district. There is not too much around the hotel in terms of cafes or bars, so if you don't want to pay the hotel prices for food you have to plan well. From my standpoint though the quiet location is the hotel's primary advantage. The grounds are beautiful and the staff was courteous but overall, the hotel just didn't feel welcoming. One other note, their ventilation system was really poor. We were on the non-smoking 5th floor but a smoking floor was directly under us. As a result we had a lot of smoke in our room every night.

Reviews.Title: “chris hutnan review”
Reviews.Author: Hutnan
Reviews.Content: I thought the hotel was excellent. Myself (Chris Hutnan) and several of my friends attended. The hotel was a little outside the main part of town, but was a nice escape in the morning and evening.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, a little bit out of center”
Reviews.Author: Joe_78
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Hilton. It is in a quiet residential area away from the center. This makes for pleasant walks around the canals in the evening and through the nearby Vondelpark in the day. If you are coming to this hotel for tourism, understand that you will be riding a tram to the attractions most days. However, it is well worth it. Rooms are spacious and have huge windows with great views. Lots of style: hotel has a little marina and a cozy garden terrace overlooking the canal. The thing I liked most about it, however, was competent, no-nonsense service. Welcome, Sir, we have a nice room waiting for you. How does the parking work - this is how it works. How do I get to the airport - this is how you get to the airport. (It's actually quite convenient to the Ring, so you won't be fighting central traffic.) There is a small business center where you can quickly check your email for free. Once I appeared to be looking for something and the same second somebody was trying to be of help. We asked the concierge to help us choose a river cruise and we were booked in 10 minutes. This kind of service is becoming harder to find and Hilton totally won us over.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, very good experience”
Reviews.Author: 4kitties
Reviews.Content: I booked through hotwire and got such a deal I couldn't believe it. I believe we paid just over 100 $ night, and got very nice accomodations although just a bit of a tram ride out of downtown. We were able to check in very early, and got a room with a king bed as requested. The room was spacious enough and the bathroom had plenty of room. The only complaint I had was that the opening of the safe was a bit awkward for us to reach and remember to close- We are both under 5'5- short even by US standards. There is a small closet that was very hand for storing extra suitcases and a slide out luggage stand. Plenty of room for storing clothes for two people for 6 days in the drawers. Bed comfortable for us. The first night we were greated with small dessert in our room. The first day we were starving at arrival. We walked around the neighborhood hoping to find affordable food, but found nothing. After a red eye trip we weren't ready to negotiate the trams. Finally we headed back to the hotel and the bar on the main floor opened. We ordered a small selection of dutch appetizers which gave us a nice flavor of dutch cuisine. They were very well prepared and almost worth the 20+ USD we paid for them. It was enough to stave off the hunger. Other than that, we did not dine at the hotel. We took the tram to central station and stopped at the tourist center. I discovered that the best deal for hotels etc is the HOLLAND PASS. You get admission to several attractions and discounts to many more for one price and you go at your own pace. We also picked up day passes for the trams. The staff was very polite, helpful and professional. The internet cafe was tricky to find but very nice with your first 30 minutes free and free printing. I would reccomend this hotel if you don't mind taking public transportation and walking about 3-5 minutes to the tram station.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: scmk3000
Reviews.Content: Hitlon Amsterdam is a nice hotel and staff did seem genuinely very friendly. Most staff smiled at us and were happy to help when we wanted to know the direction to town. We had a room overlooking the canal and could see the city centre afar. The room is clean and comfortable but I wouldn't say it oozed characters. Beds were very comfortable and the bathroom was clean and nice free toileteries refilled everyday(Crabtree & Evelyn available also to buy - at ridiculously high prices). The room is big for European city hotel standard, probably due to the location. It's true that it's quite far from the heart of things and certainly not a lot around the hotel - especially at night. No problem though, taxi (aplenty in the centre at night) was only about 15 euros so not too bad if you intend to stay out late. Did walk into town one day via the Musemsplein. There is a grill like restaurant (next to a hotel?) by the slopey museum building and they have some of the best club sandwiches ever! Enjoyed the slow relaxing walk so didn't keep the time. Most of the time we took the bus. The bus stop is a few mins walk. Just turn left coming out of the hotel and turn left again crossing the canal nearby. Turn yet another left on to the main road and continue for few mins and you will see the stop - bus 16 (quite frequent. The route for bus 24 is under construction so only 16 is available. The journey is about 10-15 mins as other said. I don't think the hotel has a pool but according to the broshures in the room, it has a jucuzzi in the health centre. Didn't use it so can't tell if it's good or not. Prices of the snacks and drinks were outrages, and the room service wasn't cheap either. Overall it's a nice 'event' hotel. Wouldn't say it's a true 5* - for american standard it's a 4*, for Far East standard it's a 3-4*ish. For leisure it's great for relaxing (my weekend break was kinda one) as it's in a quiet area but if you do enjoy your late night out then I would find a hotel in the centre - just for the convenience. Also great for museum visting as it's only 10 mins or so away from them.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to enjoy Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: nuheart
Reviews.Content: Had a terrific stay at the Hilton Amsterdam in April for two nights. Booked via priceline and received a wonderful rate --less than half their normal rack rate. So if you ever use priceline be sure to do so in Amsterdam. You won;t be disappointed. The hotel is rather modern in style which is sort of out of place and the location is a bit off the city center but the interior is beautiful and the rooms are wonderful. We were upgraded (at no extra charge) to a junior suite and it was spectacular. Very large with comfortable king bed, separate sitting area, and two walls of floor to ceiling glass windows, a whole wall of built in closets and shelving, a large modern and comfortable bathroom, plus a walk out balcony. It was simply superb! (also complimentary in room coffee and tea) We walked about two blocks or so to catch the tram for an easy trip to the city center. You can also walk to the Van Gogh museum and the Rijksmuseum The hotel food prices are outrageous so I recommend eating down the block at some nice places , unless you are on an expense account. A simple sandwich is at least 21 euros. However their outside terrace area is an outstanding place to gather and sip a drink overlooking the canal and wonderful landscaping. You can't go wrong here -- and especially if you use priceline to secure your rate. Enjoy. And watch out for the Amsterdam "coffee Houses" ! HA ha)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but a little bit out of the centre...”
Reviews.Author: toddy0011
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel through priceline.co.uk and managed to get the hotel for Â£76 per night. The check in staff were very friendly and first impressions were good. The room was very clean and had all the facilities we expected. Although, a little bit out of town, the trams are frequent and close by. The beautiful VondelPark is also only a short walk away. The only real downside is the prices: i) mini bar prices are ridiculous... Â£4 for a Mars Bar! ii) Drinks on the terraced area...Â£10 for a G&T

Reviews.Title: “Perfect end to 'Gold VIP' privileges”
Reviews.Author: dannymac84
Reviews.Content: It was easy for the Hilton to earn an 'Excellent' rating; redeemed the room (6 nights) using HiltonHHonors points, so it was essentially free; have been to Amsterdam 7 times, and this was the 1st accomodation with an elevator (which should give you an idea of types of places we usually stay); my 'Gold VIP' status within the HiltonHHonors system expired the day we checked out, that's the VIP level that got us the Executive level room and Executive Lounge access. Although I had read they were being difficult giving room upgrades for HHonors stays, we were pleasently surprised when they put us on the 9th floor, with Executive Lounge access. We had a canal side room facing the Museumplein, which is exactly what I had hoped for. Seems to be a policy to let guests peak at the John & Yoko honeymoon suite, and we were no exception. A maid gave us access, while in the executive lounge, I overheard staff directing guests to the front desk to gain access. I suppose the Amsterdam Hilton has a lock on aging hippies with a little extra spending money. note: you'll find conflicting info on the internet as to the actual room number - for the facts, see my pic. The room was what one would expect from a Hilton, actually on the level of the Dublin Conrad we stayed at a year earlier. Breakfast, and afternoon munchies in the Exec. Lounge were good, and the staff was friendly and helpful. Some complain of the distance from the center, but we had no problem. Tram connections were close, and we even made the walk all the way to Centraal Station without arriving exhausted.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stanly
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights, 2nd - 5th May. We used Trams 5, 16 and 24 which all have stops within 250 yards of the hotel. The trams are frequent and really easy to use and all start from and arrive back at Central Station. I would recommend that you buy a 24, 48, 72 or 96 hour ticket which covers all trams, buses and the Metro and all zones. It is quite difficult to know when you are crossing zones so an All Zone ticket is much easier. If you are planning to visit the museums then the 24, 48 or 72 hour IAMSTERDAM card (which includes a transport ticket) is by far the best value. Tram to the museum district takes less than10 minutes and 15-20 minutes (depending on the time of day) to central station. The hotel was great but bar prices in the hotel were high, 5 Euros for a small beer and 13.5 Euros for a gin and tonic but having drinks sitting in the sun in the Garden Terrace was an experience not to be missed. There are a huge number of restaurants in Amsterdam but if you wanted to stay near the hotel turn left out of the entrance and turn right after about 200 yards down the first main street. There are about 5 or 6 restaurants. The first one you will come to is the small Italian restaurant called Barone which others have previously mentioned in their reviews. It was excellent and very reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Happy at the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: arsenalrocks
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I loved our stay at the Hilton Amsterdam!! We were there for 4 nights and enjoyed every minute. The staff is super friendly, the beds were amazing, our room was great, and our view was excellent! The hotel is a bit of a walk from the city centrum, but we knew that ahead of time and enjoyed walking through the Vondel Park and quaint neighborhoods.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, definitely recommend it”
Reviews.Author: ChocoholicTimeTrvler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton for 3 nights, and it was great. We bid on Priceline so didn't know what we'd end up, but were very happy. Location was nice--a 15 minutes walk to the museums, and we found good restaurants in that area. It is a quieter neighborhood than the heart of the old city--but that was nice, and it is right on a lovely canal--which our room overlooked. The room was great--clean, nice decor (modern and streamline), and large. The bathroom was also great--newly renovated I'd say, very modern, great shower and tub. Nice toiletries. The staff we are very friendly and, like everywhere in Amsterdam, spoke excellent English. My only dislike is that the parking was really expensive--34 Euros a night--but it was darn convenient, and I never noticed any other parking lots in that neighborhood we could have used instead. If you can include Amsterdam in a trip w/out a car, do it, b/c from what I read parking is an issue everywhere in the historic core.

Reviews.Title: “HIlton Amsterdam as a Hilton shoul be!”
Reviews.Author: MaximillianAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: After staying in almost every 5-starhotel in Amsterdam multiple times I've never been to the Hilton. Maybe because of the fact that it's not to centrally located....... This time I decided to give the Hilton a change; and they did well! The rooms in the Hotel are standard size rooms and offer very nice different views ( city or canal ). The beds are soft and a pillowmenu is provided; ideal for the ones having difficulties getting to sleep! The bathroom ( speaking of standardrooms ) is just average; but very clean. I personally hate taking a shower in a small batthub especially when there's a small showercurtain.... I must say guestitems such as shampoo etc are provided in multiple amounts! The staff is very friendly en well informed about planeschedules etc. One point I didn't liked so much is the high pricing for items from the minibar; I understand that this is one of the easy cashcows but asking â‚¬ 7.50 for a dietcoke from your minibar is absurd...... Unfortunately this becomes a common thing in almost every hotel in Europe. Overall; Good place to stay; nice rooms and friendly staff. If your a first time visitor to Amsterdam you might consider staying in the Marriott, The Grand etc because of the simple fact that they are much more centrally located and they provide a better " tasting " of Amsterdam :).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Hotel_traveller32
Reviews.Content: Hi Travellers, We got this hotel from Priceline and it was an absolute steel at Â£75 for a night. Excellent welcome to the hotel by reception. Felt at ease straight away, good spacious room, no expense spared on trimmings for the room. Gorgeous bathroom and view from hotel room. easy to access to amsterdam centre via tram and night bus. cant comment on facilities as we arrived at midnight and left at 10am. expensive mini-bar and water for 7 euros a bottle. I hope u enjoy the Amsterdam Hilton. Preston & Carl

Reviews.Title: “Great extras”
Reviews.Author: JSweetman
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights over Easter. Got a deal from London Heathrow to Amsterdam including flights and accommodation for Â£770 for 2 of us. Hotel is 15 mins tram ride from the train station (Which you go to from the airport if you want to use public transport). It overlooks the canal and our executive room had fantastic views of this and Amsterdam city. Although the rooms are basic and moderately sized, I think for UK standards they are fine. You get lovely Crabtree and Evylon toileteries replaced 2x a day, chocs on pillows, free bottle of still and sparkling water, gourmet 'silk pouch' tea range. We stayed in the executive lounge so got access to the lounge which was great for lounge standards- beautiful range of fresh canapes, "free" wine/beer/cappuccino etc. The hotel breakfast buffet is lovely and fresh too. The Italian restaurant serves great, authentic food although I wouldn't recommend the Seafood Bonanza as the cold seafood antipasti flavours weren't fantastic and you have to pay extra for the main dish which is the best part (On top of Â£37.50 for the antipasti, pasta, dessert buffet). The coffee shop open until 3 on weekdays serves fair Illy coffee and tasty fresh snacks/ small meals. It is Â£11.50 pp to get a hotel transfer or approx Â£6 for public transport. The only thing missing at the hotel is an indoor pool/spa and the room plasma tvs are a bit small but we survived! The staff were especially friendly, kind and helpful. Overall as far as European hotel standards go, for the price I think the Hilton is good value. We would stay there again and were generally impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Good view of River, quiet location”
Reviews.Author: alchemy100
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton after staying at the Movenpick for 2 nights. Movenpick was great, good location, however the Hilton is out of the way, decided to walk to it from Central Amsterdam, and probably about 45 mins walk at least. The Hotel is fairly unattractive, however luckily had a room facing the rear of the hotel, with a lovely view over the river. Rooms were nice, location wasn't ideal, and after having stayed at the Movenpick the night before, this was a bit of a let down (in terms of location and decor) however nice place to stay for a quiet break

Reviews.Title: “well trained staff”
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel on a quick overnight trip to Amsterdam. Hotel is not located in the centre but is easily accessible from Central Station with Tram 5/24 to Appolaan ( about 15 minutes ) which appears to be an upscale residential area. Hotel is not a pretty looking building but the lobby interior is pleasant looking towards the canal. This location is very handy if you are planning to spend a lot of time visiting the musuems which are quite close. The hotel backs on to the Canal and has a nice garden that you can sit in and enjoy the view. My stay was generally pleasant although the AC in my room did not work properly so I found it difficult to sleep. Bed was very comfortable. TV in the room was too small.Channel selection was good. Robes and slippes provided also. Had Room Service which arrived on time and was pleasantly presented there is a â‚¬5.00 service charge.Food and beverage is generally pricey in the hotel. Internet is available in the room both wired and wireless at a charge that was not displayed. Overall I found every member of staff that I met to be genuinely freindly and helpful- can recommend for this alone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: UglyRumor
Reviews.Content: We arrived about 7:00 am and without previously arranged an early check in, were given a room with no hesitation or problems. Great room, nicely updated and huge bathroom. Hotel staff very friendly and helpful with directions to and from attractions. Executive lounge was great. Overall great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: dolle2
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two night, should have stayed longer. Really comfy bed (something I cherish). friendly staff. Only a short walk to Amsterdam's attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great long weekend break - perfect for museum visits”
Reviews.Author: TimPink
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my mother (62) and my daughter (14). We had booked an executive room with an additional roll-away bed through the Hilton telephone booking service in the UK, using Tesco Deals vouchers. Luckily I checked with the hotel by email before we left - and found that they had not included the additional bed in my booking. All was sorted out before we arrived and we had a great stay. Travel to and from the airport was simple and inexpensive: train to Amsterdam Centraal (3.20 euros each way) and the tram (16) from outside the Centraal Station and then about 15-20 minutes to the hotel. (Get off on De Lairessestraat at the Emmastraat stop). The hotel was warm, clean, comfortable - with friendly and attentive staff. The beds, duvets and pillows (we ordered more via the pillow menu) were hard to leave in the mornings but the lure of the fabulous breakfasts won in the end. The cafe latte is worth ordering. The hotel is a short walk from the museum district - and an easy walk into the centre. We ate near the hotel on our first night and after a fairly extensive wander around the local streets found Fidelios on Beethovenstraat. We had a great meal, we couldn't fault the food, the atmosphere, or the bill (about 24 euros each for two courses and drinks). We'll definitely return - if and when we can save enough Tesco deals.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: minkyminki
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our family 3 nights in the Hilton. The children were greeted very warm and welcoming, got extra backpacks, children champagne and sweets on their room! They were thrilled and the parents, of course, too. The Hilton is lying i a more quiet area, with a big garden directly at a gracht. The city centre is easy and fast accessable by public transport. The rooms were relatively big, clean actually what you are used from a decent business hotel. Staff was extraordinary friendly!

Reviews.Title: “best hilton we have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: jmh180304
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed here March 2007 for our wedding anniversary, out off the way abit but service, food and room where second to non in the hilton chain including the cavilleri in Rome. All in all..... Exceptional!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and quiet in an upscale neighbourhood but leave your pet at home :-)”
Reviews.Author: Wereldreizigster
Reviews.Content: We had called the hotel before to ask about their pet policy and they said pets were welcome but unlike many other hotels where we took the cat with we had to sign a document with all kinds of rules such as that we had to put a special "pet in the room" sign on the door.. There was NO such sign, so I called the reception where they should have given us such a sign if that was not standard in the room but then it appeared they had no such signs. We were charged 30 euros and unlike for example the W Hotel in Seoul they had nothing for the cat of course we had brought everything with us but if you are charged such a high amount you expect maybe a turn down gift for the pet or something..or charge a lower amount. We had some problems with the internet... The rooms are fine nothing special though. Nice but small bathroom.. The restaurant Roberto's we can really recommend for a nice Italian meal, my hubby enjoyed the pasta with tomato and parmesan flambÃ© which they prepare at the table. Breakfast in the room was nice too, everything you would wish for was on the tray table..I am dutch so I was happy to see the sprinklings:-) People complain about the location but it is in a real nice neighbourhood with a canal so you can even take a boat into the city, or have drinks on the terrace of the hotel overlooking the water and the pretty houses. It is only not really in the center but a little walk will take you there.. Taxis are expensive in the Netherlands so most people walk here dutch as we are :-)

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing with lovely service”
Reviews.Author: wild1wild
Reviews.Content: We really liked it here. It is near the museums and not too far from the centre of things. We liked that it was a bit removed from all the crowds and noise and great for going for a run in the morning. The service and friendlyness of the staff is fantastic. We would definitely go back. Highly recommended for couples on a romantic/city break long weekend etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, nice rooms and excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: OJB
Reviews.Content: We were 112 people that stayed at this hotel and we got excellent service. The rooms have a nice standard. This is not a cheap hotel, but if you like to travel high-class - you should go to Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the room!”
Reviews.Author: RobbertS
Reviews.Content: *We were upgraded to a junior suite upon arrival and this one was really huge! The view was also great! *The breakfast in the executive lounge was also on the 10th floor. *Although the 2nd time I stayed in this hotel, after I arrived at 3 am, they wanted to bump me out of the room at 12pm, which is of course not done. *The location is a bit far from the city centre, but with a taxi/public transport it takes just minutes. *Staff was on the first occasion more than helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Really like this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: westsidecougar1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel (located on Apollo Laan Street) several times for business travel. The good... 1. Excellent service 2. Clean/comfortable rooms 3. Very comfortable bed and high quality bedding 4. Wireless internet in guest rooms (you have to pay extra though) 5. Friendly staff 6. Quiet 7. Nice location (right next to one of the canals) 8. Nice "executive lounge" on the top of the hotel. Nice view and good food/drinks! The not-so-good... 1. Bathroom is fairly small, with no walk-in shower (just a bath tub where one can shower) 2. Other than that minor thing, I can't think of anything! I highly recommend this hotel. I left some clothes on one of my stays and called them after a week to see if they had it. Sure enough, they found the clothing in my room and kept it in "lost and found" until my next visit (about six weeks later).

Reviews.Title: “So So For a 5 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SDWanderlust
Reviews.Content: Location: A bit far off from most attractions and the city center. It is about 25-30 minute walk to the center. This should not be a problem if you are fit or like to walk. Under extreme situations, such as extreme weather conditions or expectant moms, it would be too far of a walk. I usually like to walk but I found it was a bit too far for me especially that I had only three days in Amsterdam and the weather was disagreeable. Alternatively, you can use public transportation to get to the center. The Room: It is a 5-star establishment. I think it should be more like 3+/4 star than 5. The carpet looked very dated. The sheets were white but off white look. Therefore, it looked old. Compared to the Hilton I stayed in NYC, the sheets look old. I would have preferred that the sheets be real white. Most of the furniture was in good condition. I did not like to â€œblondâ€� color of the furniture, just a personal preference. The bed and pillows were comfortable and. Pillow â€œmenuâ€� also was also available; therefore, one will be able to find to oneâ€™s liking and needs. Crab Tree and Evelyn toiletries were very nice. There was one bathrobe and slippers. Did not use the mini bar or other facilities therefore cannot comment. There was no morning newspaper. Bathroom was large and looked modern. No issues with the bathroom. Service: Inconsistent service. Checking in was a breeze. It took about 5 five minutes. The front desk person was very nice, friendly, and gracious.
