She asked if we would need a map or if we want her to escort us to our room. She also said if we need any other assistance, we should not hesitate to ask her. She really went out of her way. Checking out was another story, the gentleman who did the checkout for us was very abrupt, spoke very fast (in English) and allowed to be interrupted various times by his co-workers. This should not be a big deal if it was elsewhere. For a five star hotel, there was no refinement there. Downturn service offered upon request. Recommendation: Not recommended unless you are certain about the poor location and the inconsistent service. If you expect a true five star, then this place is not the one

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel but to far away from the action”
Reviews.Author: ANWAS
Reviews.Content: stayed two nights for our first ever trip to Amsterdam booked through expedia who told us it was the best hotel. Arrived 25 euros from Schiphol airport to this quite modern clean hotel only to be told that we are another 25 euro taxi trip away from the main attractions in amsterdam itself! the room was excellent make sure you order a canal facing room< I have since stayed at the Krasnapolsky on Dam Square which is supposed to be a 5 star which it is definatley NOT this hotel the Hilton is ten times better the only problem is the location as it is far away from what tourists want to see. As an executive room we had breakfast on the rooftop restaurant which was excellent with great views well recommended. If only this hotel was near the centre then it would be no contest. The bed was very large and comfortable , staff great and efficient. If you want a quiet leisurely stay in Amsterdam then this is the hotel to stay at or you are on business and want to avoid the cannabis/beer and sex tourists then again well worth a stay but if you want to be near the action then prepare for a expensive taxi ride.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!!”
Reviews.Author: FranceXIV
Reviews.Content: On November 30th 2007, I called and booked the John and Yoko Suite (2000 USD p.night) for new year's eve. The suite appeared to be available, they took my reservation and my AMEX details. The following day the front office supervisor sent me an e-mail stating that "he would send my confirmation soonest, early next week" Almost one week later, on Thursday 6, the same supervisor sends me an e-mail saying that -in order for my reservation to go through- I needed to book 3 nights in a row. I live almost next door to the Hilton hotel: this was supposed to be a nice surprise present for a friend from Las Vegas, it turned out to be a scam Hilton style.

Reviews.Title: “Would've been great - except location”
Reviews.Author: chihuahua_star
Reviews.Content: I have been to Amsterdam a few times, and the Hilton was very nice - much larger rooms than any European hotel at the same price. BUT, the location did not make up for it. Pros: - Large rooms - Great bathroom and tub! - Cozy bar with fireplace - maid service was great Cons: - Location, location, location! - To use a phone card would coast you 1,60 euro/minute still! - 24 hours of internet is euro 27. The area around the hotel really didn't have much going for it. We did find an amazing italian place only a 5 minute walk away, but that's it. Usually I am not one to complain at all, but compared to staying within the city center (which we did last year), this is just TOO far away! We always like to go to the room in the afternoon, just to drop off any packages and recoup for 20 mins. With the Hilton, it was impossible and didn't happen. Once you leave in the morning, it's too much of a pain to return before nighttime when you are ready for bed. It's a 20-25 minute tram ride just to Dam Square! So if you plan on staying out after midnight, you will need to pay about 25 euro for a cab at least - as opposed to walking to most central hotels. If room size is more important than location, this is a great place. The staff was very nice, and the rooms were wonderful. If only the location was better, it would be perfect. To me, it's just too far away. I think most people would be better off staying at one of the MANY affordable and nice hotels more central. Last year we stayed at Hotel New Amsterdam, we only used the tram 1 time, and it was in the perfect location. Quiet street and everything. I think you can do a bit better location for the price! Have a great time in Amsterdam, and consider a day trip to Haarlem - it was gorgeous!

Reviews.Title: “Quality Amsterdam hotel”
Reviews.Author: Panda2Monkey
Reviews.Content: High quality hotel with history (John Lennon sleep in location). Great service and very good facilities. Enjoyed all aspects of the stay from the top quality room to the excellent guest facilities eg bar.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel for leisure or business”
Reviews.Author: mfhstid
Reviews.Content: I can't recommend this place strongly enough. Unusually for a chain hotel, it manages to be both intimate and characterful. The rooms are tastefully furnished, and manage to avoid feeling overly formulaic or inappropriately showy. The bar, and especially the outdoor terrace overlooking the canal, are appealing places to spend some time (although the prices, predictably, are prohibitively high). The care and attentivenesses of the staff (which I normally only notice if it's really good or bad) went way beyond what could reasonably be expected (in contrast to much of the rest of the city, where service is not uncommonly lamentable). My only real concern about this hotel before staying there was the location. As it turned out, it's easily accessible via a number of tram routes (or, if you're feeling fit, walking from Amsterdam's compact centre). Indeed, its location on the fringe of the centre, in a very salubrious, quiet neighbourhood, added to the charm of the place. Assuming you can get a reasonable rate (I paid about $150 per night all inclusive through Priceline), this is an excellent choice of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The nicest hotel staff I have ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: sharonalyse
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights using my Hilton points. Because it was a reward stay, I expected the worst...but it was quite the opposite. When I arrived late in the evening, I was greeted by name as I was the last guest they were expecting that day that hadn't checked in. I was upgraded to a suite with a canal room on the executive level (which includes admittance to the lounge with breakfast and cocktails all day). Not bad for a "free room." The receptionist spent about 20 minutes with me explaining the area, what to do, how to use public transportation, etc. She even offered me a free drink in the bar because the lounge was closed for the night. Because I had been traveling for business for about a week when I arrived, she made sure to tell housekeeping not to wake me in the morning. The room was very clean, the linens were quite comfortable. The view of the canal spectacular. I liked the location of the hotel as well. It was in a quiet residential neighborhood. I felt it gave me a nice view into Dutch culture. It was a very quick walk to the Van Gogh museum and to the city center.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel,beautiful rooms,but a little out of the way for us!!”
Reviews.Author: klmcm80
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel at the end of august with my partner.we were there on a romantic getaway.I myself had been to amsterdam a couple of times before,and this was my partners first time.First impression of the hotel from the outside was a little drab,considering how much we paid for the room.I was kind of expecting that as friends had stayed before.We were greeted with a lovely door man who took our bags and even spotted my good camera lying in the bck seat of the taxi(if it was not for him,no photos of the dam).Anyways arrived into the hotel and it was beautiful.staff were very friendly and helpful.The room we ordered was a exective queen deluxe,and for the price i would say it was very small,but most hotel rooms in amsterdam r like this!. The bed was comfy,and everything was just right.Only thing bad was the price of food at hotel.It was so dear.It is the hilton!. My only concern was it was a little out of our way and we spent most of the time getting taxis in and out of the center. Great hotel it was just not for us,we will get something right in the center next time.caus im going bck in feb,and cant wait. I am going to call amsterdam my secound home.I love this place so much. hope this helps you.x

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Not Bad Location”
Reviews.Author: andrewjackson1981
Reviews.Content: 6 of us stayed in this hotel for a long weekend using 3 rooms. We found the price pretty good for the Hilton. Very nice and clean hotel and friendly staff. Rooms were a pretty good size. Location was on the edge of amsterdam with the tram service a couple of minutes walk away. From here we could travel anywhere in the city. The first night we walked into town which took about 20-30 mins but not recommended for small groups. We usually got a taxi back which never cost a great deal between the size of us, may be slightly on expensive side for two. Overall would rate this and would stay here again, very quite outside the hotel as its in the rich part of amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better...”
Reviews.Author: colmirl
Reviews.Content: I'd decided to book a few well deserved few days of rest in Amsterdam (one of my favourite cities) and wanted what seemed to be impossible - a nice hotel, that wouldn't break the bank. I managed to score a great deal for this hotel on Priceline and accepted it. Of course, being a Priceline deal I thought that I was going to be stuck in one of the hotels worst rooms (which can often happen), but either way was willing to accept whatever happened for the price I had paid. I arrived, warm and sweaty after the trip from Schiphol via Centraal Station and the 16 tram and was greated by really friendly door staff and reception, who (unlike in other hotels) engaged in conversation and were very clear about what the hotel offered and the range of services. At no time was I treated any differently than a full rate paying guest and, in fact, I was treated better than I have been in many 5* hotels. I was asked if I would prefer a room with a view (obviously I would, but again its nice to be ask - not just assigned). I was given a room (with a gorgeous view over the canal/marina) on the 4th floor which was prefect. The decor was modern, the bed comfortable and the bathroom spotless and well stocked with towels and toiletries. The only complaint I could muster was that the desk chair wasn't great for sitting on for prolonged periods. Staff were always attentive, yet discreet. You would get greeted or asked how your day/afternoon/evening went, yet never felt like it was forced or heavy handed. Reception staff also functioned in the same professional and slick manner. Transport to/from the city was a breeze with the frequent tram service and nightbuses which operate just a short walk away from the hotel. An airport shuttle can aslo be booked to/from the hotel should you not feel like facing the public transport system. It may be a Hilton (which, as a chain, can sometimes can be a little lacklustre) but the Hilton Amsterdam just seemed to have a sense professionalism and class within the staff I encountered that makes me want to return again. It may not be slap in the centre of the city - but I, for one, was glad of that. The quieter suburban area was much more tranquil and relaxing. I personally can't find much to criticise them about (chair, as discussed above, and expensive Swisscom wi-fi is about it). For me, it was one of the best hotels I've stayed in for quite some time.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful Hilton”
Reviews.Author: LanaBLondon
Reviews.Content: At the last minute I booked an Amsterdam getaway through expedia (Â£250 pp flights with KLM and 2 nights at Hilton in exec queen suite with brekky incl) and it was great! I was a tad concerned at how far out of the centre the Hilton seemed at first, but living in the thick of it in London every day meant the peace and quiet the location of the Hilton offered was definitely appreciated, especially once we had the opportunity to explore around the area to Vondel Park which is stunning and only 5 mins on foot! Being able to wander down and perch by the canal directly out the front of the hotel of a morning in the sunshine was a perfect way to start the day as was the amazing stepped tce for a drink in the evening. An idyllic location indeed. The Hilton was exactly what you might expect from a prestige worldclass hotel chain. The service was friendly (though don't assume you can get the free bikes they claim - the hotel only has 4 available!) and the room was large with a supremely comfy bed. We were impressed with the pillow menu allowing you to order your favourite type as was the case with the soap menu - a nice touch! The breakfast was amazing - the full works from pastries and crepes to fresh fruit, eggs as you like them, other hot goodies and fresh juices galore. I also liked the fact that it was on from 7am-11am meant that spending a little extra time in those comfy beds was achievable. Overall a great stay. They were fab in accomodating our late check out and high standards of cleanliness and attention to detail throughout the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Skippy07Norfolk
Reviews.Content: My daughter-in-law and myself have just returned from a 4 day stay at the Hilton to celebrate my 60th birthday. It was our first trip to Amsterdam and we used the local transport as recommended on TripAdviser Reviews - it was great fun!! Train from airport and Tram 16 - easy. We arrived at 1am due to our flight being delayed and had booked directly on the hotel website making use of their 'special offers' but were upgraded to an Executive Suite on arrival at no extra cost. The room was very clean, comfy beds, bathroom marvellous and a magnificent view of Amsterdam from the 8th Floor. We made use of the Espresso Bar in the mornings, the terrace for sundowners after long days in the City and ate at Roberto's (restaurant inside hotel) for my celebration birthday meal. What a night we had in Roberto's - we were made welcome immediately, the food was delicious and the ambience marvellous - the Staff were exceptional - what fun we had! Highly recommended. We enjoyed coming back to the Hilton in the suburbs after the hustle, bustle and noise in the City - peace. Thank you Hilton for a marvellous birthday weekend and ALL your Staff are polite, knowledgable and very friendly.....will certainly visit you again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Picturesque: A Great Starting Point for Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Goblu
Reviews.Content: The Amsterdam Hilton is in a picturesque canal setting, a short walk to Vondelpark and the Museumplein. The hotel itself has a subdued atmosphere that is a welcome counterpoint to a day of sightseeing in the often frenetic streets of Amsterdam. The hotel interior is tastefully elegant and updated. The central feature of the lobby is the inviting panoramic window wall opposite the front entrance that invites you for a cocktail on the canal-side terrace, overlooking the Hilton Marina (exhorbitant prices notwithstanding). The terrace is worth the "price of admission" if just to relax as the afternoon winds down. The rooms were nicely furnished, of reasonable size. The beds, really comfortable, and the pillow and soap menus, a nice touch. We had two rooms, a canal view and a "boulevard" view...get the canal view if you can. It's a wonderful treat that gets you in the mood for sightseeing in the city. I've read many negative views of the exterior architecture. Yes, the building looks a bit anachronistic and a little out-of-place in its early-60's design, but if you really look at it, it is a very clean design that hearkens back to an era full of potential and possibility. The building's architect, Hugh Aart Maaskant, is actually of some renown, and staying in the hotel a few days will allow you to appreciate its functionality and beauty. We were upgraded to an executive room, as Diamond members. Their top-floor lounge is really a glass-walled penthouse that affords fabulous views on three sides of Amsterdam. Both the breakfast and the cocktail hour food selections were well-stocked. The evening bar was stocked with all standard liquors, mixers and beers. The wine selection included free-flowing, very tasty, italian sparkling wine (very dry, which I like). My 19 year-old son developed a taste for champagne while there! The only down-side of the lounge is it is closed in the afternoons. Also, the attendants, though very accommodating and responsive, are not the concieriege, so you can't rely on them for ticket purchases or a wealth of local recommendations; however the concierge downstairs was very helpful on that score. (Get museum tickets from them to avoid lines). The health club is connected and privately owned. Gold/Diamond members get free access, though. Good equipment, unisex spa facilities. As for location, yes the hotel is not at city center, or, really even a comfortable walking distance, but the tram service is so good, who cares? And I actually enjoy using public transportation like that, as it puts you in closer touch with the local community. Three tram lines are close-by and get you to essential parts of the city: 16, 2 and 5. Beethovenstraat--a shopping area--is just a short walk away from the hotel. I'd suggest a walk down this street to get a glimpse of a less-touristy side of Amsterdam. There's a cafe--Fidelieo--2 or 3 blocks south of Apollolaan, on Bethovenstraat, that serves excellent food, has an outdoor cafe, and is open late (the only eating place neaby--includng the hotel--that I found open past 11 pm). Some local recommendations: --Van Gogh Museum is excellent, but get tickets in advance. --Ann Frank House is a must. I went 30 minutes before opening and there were maybe 40 people in front of me...got in within 5 minutes of opening. Later in day, lines are crazy. --The Holland Casino is fun if you want to try a bit of gambling. Look fo local "tourist" magazines or brochures for free admittance coupons...otherwise you'll pay 3.50 euros to enter. Bring your passport too (drivers license does not work!). --Go to a pancake house and get pancakes and/or waffels. We tried De Carrousel across the canal from the Heineken Brewery, and were very pleased. --Enjoy the street performances on the Leidseplein and other areas (don't forget to tip), and then for shopping/souvineirs, walk from Leidseplein to Klaverstraat to Dam Square. You can make a detour to the Red Light District, if that's on your to-do list. --See Boom Chicago comedy club. Its very much reminiscent off Second City in Chicago, and--I though--the comedy was actually a little better. From the airport you can take the train to Centraal Station, then 16 Tram to (nearby) the hotel. Taxi is about $40 euros to hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again!!”
Reviews.Author: tomtoo
Reviews.Content: We have returned from our month in Europe and had stayed 3-nights in the Hilton Amsterdam. We took two rooms which we booked thru priceline ($150 US per night, per room). The hotel was as expected for a high 4-star, low 5-star hotel. Since we booked thru priceline we could not get the breakfast added afterwards - that was a bummer since we then had to get going elsewhere, the breakfast we found expensive at 25 euros per person. The accommodation was terrific for the price and better than a standard hilton, but not quite the 5-star of a Four Season or Fairmount. When we had initially arrived in Amsterdam, I was expecting to take a taxi to the hotel from the train station but was pleasantly surprised that travelling with our luggage in tow on the tram system was fine. The location was only slightly out of the way since it was our first time in Amsterdam and all the sights were central. We always started our day with a nice brisk scenic walk (about a large block) to the tram. Our only put-off was when we asked about bike rentals and was told by the staff it was not available for discounted rooms, even though I was willing to play for the rental and the bikes were sitting outside. I was told that they have limited numbers and were not for the discounted rooms! They did give us a brochure for a local bike rental company away from the hotel that was not convenient for us at the time. Overall we would have not problems staying there again at the right price!

Reviews.Title: “Short Celebration break”
Reviews.Author: Honeykins
Reviews.Content: Had a 2 night stay at The Amsterdam Hilton for our wedding anniversary & my birthday. Was particularly interested in staying there as hubby is a John Lennon / Beatles fan. Found the hotel to be a quite dated looking building , more like a large office block than a hotel ( although given the era it was built, not suprising ) . Arrived to check in with pleasant staff & no probs, given a canal view room. Very clean accommodation with a nice big comfy bed + pillow menu if required. Quite bland & ordinarily furnished although sufficient for our needs , if not a little business like. Had a nice touch from the hotel as they sent up a bottle of bubbly and a birthday cake on the afternoon we checked in. Nice, quiet surburban area on a leafy lined street. Only takes about 10 mins walk to the tram. Easy to get into Amsterdam central - it only takes about 15 mins on regular good tram service. We mainly used the hotel as a base, which is what I would recommend , as i would rate it as being more suitable for business travellers - certainly not worthy of a 5 star rating , more of a 4 star, however, as I said, we could'nt complain about the service or staff. The only grumble was the extortionate bar prices. We had a late nightcap cocktail (ordered without checking out the prices ) 2 mojito's cost 19 euro's each, hold on, we thought, is'nt that about thirteen quid each ? Crikey, we have'nt even paid that in any of our fave SoBe Miami top hotels !! However, all in all a pleasant stay, but come on Hilton, maybe you should re-think your drinks prices , this is after all a suburban Amsterdam hotel , and methinks , not a 5 star it boasts? P.S By the way, if you want to splash out, the John & Yoko Suite is a mere 3000 euro's a night !

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cassissoda
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Hilton Amsterdam. All the renovations that I read about were apparently finished, as the hotel looked gorgeous inside every place we looked. All of the decor was so tasteful, and everything (including the carpet) looked immaculately clean. I really appreciated the location of the hotel. As others have said, the hotel is not near the center of the city, but it was only a 15 minute tram ride to the center. It was so nice to get away from the crowds and pollution of the city center and come home to this quiet, peaceful area. In the opposite direction from the tram stop, there is a street called Beethovenstraat (or was it Beethovenlaan?). This was a charming tree-lined street of nice stores and shops. It really felt like being on Manhattan's Upper West Side, a kind of oasis of a residential area, detached from the hustle and bustle, yet not very far removed geographically. If you don't make a visit to the cheese market or to Gouda, definitely head to Beethoven Street and hit the two cheese shops. Oh, one more thing: the bathrooms! They were absolutely gorgeous! We brought some Japanese bath milk (like bath salts) and really enjoyed the facilities. Tram 16 to Emmastraat, as others have mentioned. There is a fantastic Italian restaurant whose name I can't remember, which was on the tram route on the way to the hotel. It's on a corner next to a canal, right before the Museumplein area. They have people dining outside, and almost all of the pasta and pizza dishes are only 5 Euros (!!). I don't know how they pull off this price with such good food. Definitely a good meal for those of you on a budget. (I know, I know, we shouldn't be staying at the Hilton if we are on a budget...but really, the food was great.)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Amsterdam Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_traveller
Reviews.Content: This is a top notch Hilton property. The only thing I could find fault with is that it isn't in the heart of things as far as entertainment/restaurants/shopping but I found getting around Amsterdam was so easy to do with trams and bicycles that I was only ever 15 mins away from anything. Our room wasn't ready when we arrived and they treated us to complimentray drinks in the bar while we waited. The staff and the service we recieved was excellent. The rooms were very well appointed and the beds very comfortable with lovely big feather down quilts on the beds. The pillow menu was a very nice touch though I had never stayed in a hotel that offered a soap menu as well! Overall would recommend a stay at this hotel as long as your ok with the location.

Reviews.Title: “smart service”
Reviews.Author: brumpodge
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights from july 29th, All that everyone else writes is true, the rooms are tidy and clean, the staff service levels are excellent, nothing is too much trouble, located out of town a short distance. The trams into town are caught either just along Emmastraat (no 16) or at the far end of Emmastraat (no2), next to an entrance to Vondelpark. along the way are a couple of restaurants and a minimarket. a fantastic way to spend a 'sundowner' on a warm summers evening is on the canalside terrace, the sun is 'just right'. There is a kettle in the room but only coffe is supplied, take your own tea bags! there is room in the in room fridge minibar for a small carton of milk. The John Lennon suite is on the 7th floor at the front left hand end of the hotel. I would go back there in an instant.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Hiltons but pricey”
Reviews.Author: Friendlytips1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week recently while on business and cannot fault it...except again if I was paying this myself, I would think this was too pricey. Very comfortable rooms, on the canal and a fantastic place when the weather is nice, just to sit out on the terrace and watch the barges go up and down the canal. I even found it too comfortable to leave rather than get out and explore more. But i have heard of some nice restaurants within walking distance (note this is not in the centre of the city). Staff are more than friendly...even if a bit slow sometimes but I have found that with the service in the Netherlands in general. Or maybe they want people to not rush so much.. Anyhow, internet is â‚¬27 per night - this is cheeky I think, expect to pay â‚¬21 for a burger and â‚¬9 for a glass of wine. There is no gym but you can go to one nearby at an additional cost. If you miss breakfast, there is also a small cafe at the front of the hotel, which is great if you want to take lunch away with you. Overall, I do like this hotel but it really is very pricey for food and drinks especially and therefore I really do wonder if it is worth it...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Property”
Reviews.Author: smcptravels
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as we were using Hilton Points and we read the reviews. We found the location perfect. Just outside the busy center city but only a short Tram ride to where we needed to be. We had a king room and it was more than ample for our 5 day stay. Like others we thought the hotel restaurant's food was pricey so we ate at other locations throughout the city. My only beef with the hotel was that we pre-arranged an early arrival and room request (Canal view) but neither happened. We received a street view (most likely because we asked for a room pretty early, 9am). Overall we loved the neighborhood, the location and the overall cleanliness of this Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Small Room”
Reviews.Author: SwissLe
Reviews.Content: As always I booked on the official website for the best price and also cashback! I have stayed in many Hilton Hotels over the years and always find they have a good minimum standard. This one is no exception. We took the train from the airport and took a taxi from Dam Square. This is not a hotel for someone looking to be central to Dam Square or the red light. It is, however, pefect for those looking to take in one of the many galleries and museums. The large 70's style building is located in a quiet area overlooking a canal. The taxi from Dam Square cost around 20euro. On arrival at the hotel we were greeted by well mannered, beautifully spoken (english) porters who directed us to reception and took our bags to the room. Reception was swift and well mannered. The whole hotel is very well kept and really clean, a refreshing change to the rest of the city. We were given a room on a high floor with twin beds. As with many hotels twin rooms are two single beds in close proximity. They do however push apart and offer a good level of comfort with beautiful white duvets. There was a pillow menu and extra pillows already in the closet. For all you tea and coffee drinkers there is a kettle but sadly for me no biscuits. The bathroom was small, clean and functional. No sign of the Hilton 'mist-free' mirrors here though. The shower held its temperature well and the pressure was perfect. There was a soap menu but as in most hotels this was an extra charge. A typical Hilton selection of La Source shower gel, shampoo, body cream and shoe shine were provided. All great quality. The minibar prices were a little higher than in most Hiltons but the room service menu was varied and reasonably priced. Yet another excellent stay in a Hilton. Would certainly recommend The Hilton Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Cheerful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Credimus
Reviews.Content: Stayed for five days, it rained everyday so we were grateful that the Gold Card so upgraded us to the executive floor and allowed us to use the lounge for some damp free recreation. Excellent hotel with attentive and friendly staff. We had a drink in the hotel bar which was very nice. Comfortable chairs where you can sit a look out over the canal. However,one a glass of wine and one a beer cost 17 euros. It's a bit out of the way, a fifteen minute tram ride for Dam Square, but it was nice to get away from the madness of the city centre and chill out in a very tranquil setting.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dave007London
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 3 nights at this hotel and were very very pleased. It is located approx 2km from dam square and tram 16 is the best to get you to the centre. The rooms and public areas are spotlessly clean and very comfortable, there is a lovely garden and marina and the bathrooms have fantastic power showers. The staff are also fantastic. There are some lovely touches with cotton linen and marble floors. We would stay here again and would recommend it. I have only given it a 4 however because of the cost of the mini bar and food in the hotel. Which quite frankly is ridiculous. 9 euros for a bottle of water from the fridge in your room i think is very poor. But for a touch of luxury this hotel is fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Longwood Traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here using frequent stay program points, so admittedly the room was free. I was also upgraded to the Executive Level because of my hotel program status so we did get a great deal. The room was well appointed with chocolates and lots of information about the area. It was admittedly compact for an executive room but most rooms in Amsterdam are compact and it had everything we needed. The bed was extremely comfortable, we had a beautiful view of the canal below and the room was quiet. Breakfast was served in the Executive Lounge and the service there was excellent. It wasn't a tremendous spread but it was more than enough to suit our needs. There was also an Internet kiosk available to access the web on that level and that came in handy since we had decided to leave the laptop at home. This hotel is not in town but was a relatively easy walk to the Museumplein and to the tram if you want to go to other places. I find the trams in Amsterdam to be an excellent form of transportation and very reliable. We used the Executive Lounge at the end of the day for a light sweet and a drink. Wine, beer and other beverages were available. Again the service was excellent. We didn't eat at the restaurant in the hotel but in different places around Amsterdam. I would definitely go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Very Kid Friendly”
Reviews.Author: gmjordan
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Hilton Hotel in Amsterdam. We would definitely recommend this hotel to all of our friends. The first time we went to Amsterdam we went as a couple and wanted to be as near Central Station as possible. This time, we were with our 3 year old daughter. The Hilton is located about 5 minutes or so by foot to the art museums. The location is more in the middle of a neighborhood where people actually live, which makes it quieter and more filled with trees and greenery. The little shopping area about 5 minutes away is filled with trendy shops that appear to be frequented by people that actually live in Amsterdam, not tourists. We were delighted with the location and did not mind the tram or walk to the more touristy areas. However, if you are looking to be five minutes away from the cafes and the red light district, this is definitely not the right location. The hotel itself was great. Although the outside is a bit dated, the inside is beautiful. What really made it special, however, was the staff. Everyone was extremely friendly and worked to make our stay enjoyable. Usually there is at least one person at the hotel that is not on their game and not pleasant â€“ not here â€“ everyone went overboard to make sure your stay was enjoyable. They also had special children amenities which my daughter loved. Thank you Stephanie (the German person with the Australian accent)! The rooms were nice â€“ like any other nice Hilton in the U.S. â€“ but definitely on the bigger side for European rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hilton Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Waiting4NextTrip
Reviews.Content: Located in a mostly residential area of the city - the Hilton Amsterdam is very quiet. Doormen/concierge very friendly and helpful. Room was quiet, clean, great view of canal and city. Housekeeping staff top notch. Club/lounge was on the top floor with nearly 360 degree views. Breakfast in the lobby was expensive (we heard) - but lots of choices. We used HHonors points to stay - and had a great time. The hotel is located about a 20 minute walk to the Museum areas (but frequent tram/metro stops can eliminate the walk if you like). Many quaint cafes near the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Nicely Kept Oasis not far from the City Center”
Reviews.Author: PAPatraveler
Reviews.Content: I thorougly enjoyed my stay at the Amsterdam Hilton. The hotel is approximately 2 miles from the city center, but I enjoy walking and so I felt that it was not very far from the action of the city center. Amsterdam is also a very easy city to bike across, and the hotel offers free bike rentals. Unless, you are unwilling to bike or walk more than a few blocks, I do not think that the hotel is too far from the center of Amsterdam. There are upscale shops and restaurants immediately nearby and also a few blocks away in the trendy De Pijp neighborhood. Additionally, the hotel is located right near Vondel Park, which is an amazing place for enjoying nature and relaxing with locals. This was the best part of the hotel for me. Vondel Park has many small ponds and open areas where people come with blankets, beer, and snacks to soak up the sun with their friends. If you have children, the park may be an excellent resource for you. I saw scores of strollers in the park, and there is a small playground and sports complex for the little ones. As a related note, on Queen's Day, the park is reserved exclusively for children to sell their wares and perform dances and songs for spare euros. It is also one of the few places that is appropriate for children during that holiday (as the rest of city was filled with drunk revelers). Near Vondel Park is the film museum and an excellent coffee shop named Tweedy's. The hotel itself is clean and nicely kept. It is located right on a canal, so you can arrange for a boat ride to pick you up at the hotel. The concierge was very helpful and can provide a number of different maps of the city, depending on your interests. The only drawback of the hotel was the prices for food and internet service. They charge a fortune for the amenities, but they also tend to cater to business people with expense accounts. A carefully guarded wallet can help avoid unnecessary expenses. I got a great deal on this hotel from a bidding web site, so I recommend shopping around before commiting to the list price.

Reviews.Title: “Far away from the city centre!”
Reviews.Author: poederlee
Reviews.Content: Awkward location far away from anything else to do. Rooms are very small. Service is irregular.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch location”
Reviews.Author: TandemWorld
Reviews.Content: The location of the Hilton in Amsterdam more than makes up for its shortcomings. If you're eyeing it as a potential place to stay, you'd be wise to move forward with booking because, let's face it, any sane person does not want to be too close to all of the action in Amsterdam. Right? The placement of the hotel is like a dream. You're just a few minutes away from the incredible Vondelpark, where we went running several times. Moreover, the neighborhood in general offers the ideal serenity that one needs in order to recharge in Amsterdam. Nice restaurants, a grocery store, canal view. Ahhhh... Despite some gaps in service, the location (along with the comfortable beds) make this a hotel worth considering.

Reviews.Title: “Wow Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jodygraf
Reviews.Content: WOW Corner rooms amazing. Suite was super.

Reviews.Title: “No construction in sight”
Reviews.Author: mbbLondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed last week at the Hiton Amsterdam and had read the comment posted on the 7th April. Thinking to see major construction works going on.... this is however not at all the case the lobby looked fine. I even checked with the reception and they said that they were replacing windows and sprinkler system but all the major works are done. The garden is a bit of a mess but i was told that this will be ready soon... still too cold to sit outside on the terrace in any case. Had a great stay and loved the beds!!

Reviews.Title: “Construction works finished!”
Reviews.Author: sjodelvaux
Reviews.Content: When I stayed at the Hilton Amsterdam all construction works were finished and I have to say we loved the entire stay from checking inn until the moment we left again. The staff throughout the hotel made our stay into one never to forget! Thank you Hilton Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Beware- Major Construction Underway”
Reviews.Author: Kiltboys
Reviews.Content: A disappointing stay at this property mainly due to the major construction work underway in the lobby and on the canal side of the hotel. Guests walk over rubble in the lobby, large scaffolds are erected inside. Outside, a complete building site exisits along the canal, with ensuing noise from tractors and other equipment. I spoke with the Duty Manager while checking in and suggested that major construction should be disclosed on the Hilton website. My room was booked on Priceline, and I suggested that they should also be informed. He had no answer, but did say that if guests call the hotel in advance and ask, Hilton staff will disclose the construction work going on. I didnt think to call in advance to ask, and anyway the room was non-refundable. On a funny note, the Duty Manager offered to buy me a coffee while I waited for my room. When I decided to wait in the lobby he said that it was too unpleasant to wait there, and really suggested strongly that I retire to the bar. A great vote of confidence! This is a business hotel, and for a meeting it's probably fine.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a nice location”
Reviews.Author: corwin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend, three nights, with my wife in March. The pros: Although some reviewers have said the location is bad, we actually liked the location; its very near the museums and away from the busy inner center. The room and hotel in general was very clean and neat. The staff were helpful when contacted. The cons: I don't see how this property can be rated 5*, I would consider it at the upper end of 4* at best. The restaurant is grossly overpriced, don't bother if it's not included in your rate. The bad weather, but well what can you say... Tips: You can get to the hotel from the airport by taking the train to Amsterdam south (a couple euros, only one stop) then either about a 10 minute walk or a few stops on the #5 tram. To the very center of Amsterdam its only about a 10 minute tram ride as well. The restaurants close to the hotel (by the #5 tram stop) are very good and reasonably priced. I would recommend these over the hotel restaurant. All in all, I would definately choose this hotel again when returning to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “my kids loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Dana F
Reviews.Content: I took my 2 children (ages 18 and 14) there for a week during school vacation. I actually was supposed to stay somewhere else I booked on priceline and last minute decided I wanted something "safer" since I was travelling alone with kids. It was a perfect choice. My kids loved it. It felt like we were coming "home" every day after sightseeing. As others say it is a bit farther out than near Central Station but the trams are super. We used 2-3 stops near the hotel and always got to where we wanted to go easily and quickly. We liked the location, near Leisdsplein (the kids referred to this as "our square") which is a neat area. Of course we loved all the museams right in the area which you can walk to. We stayed in one of the executive suites so did enjoy the included breakfast on the top floor and the snacks and drinks every night starting at 5:00 PM. The view is so beautiful overlooking the lovely canal. We also had a favorite italian resteraunt right in the local neighborhood, expensive but fabulous and so friendly. The staff was very nice and professional, though I felt the concierge staff could have been more helpful. Everyone spoke superb english. There were some nice surprises which we really liked. The lobby of the hotel is really not so nice looking. I am not sure why, it has so much potential but it is very cold looking. They seem to be doing some renovating so maybe this is in flux. The hotel bar/lounge/restaurant is okay, nice ambience but food is okay and extremely expensive. So is room service. All in all, we loved the location, safety factor, executive lounge for breakfast and happy hour, and our room was very nice. Most important to me, my children loved it! And as I said, very safe.

Reviews.Title: “Great canal views, lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: ainmunich
Reviews.Content: Apologies for the late review. We booked into an executive room so we could get a better view and for executive lounge access.The view did not disappoint. I would agree with a previous review that mentioned the furniture was "blah". However, the bathroom was spacious and well-equipped (still laughing about the 17 euro soap bars on offer though). The executive lounge is lovely, but extremely small. We actually were turned away from the brunch there one morning, because there is simply just not enough seating capacity (2 tables for 4, and 6 tables for 2). What we discovered was the brunch downstairs was much more extensive then what you received in executive. But the view from executive cannot be beat! Was extremely pleased with the reception, executive lounge, and housekeeping staff. All were polite, professional, and very competent.

Reviews.Title: “Bar stewards”
Reviews.Author: Travelodatime
Reviews.Content: It was terrible. Don't get me wrong but when you walk through the doors of a hotel that you will spend a lot of money at you don't expect to be treated like crap. The staff here were so snobbish and patronising that we left. After 1 hour we left and felt very good about it.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied customers”
Reviews.Author: M_Coxell
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. We had a Queen executive twin room which has fantastic views over Amsterdam and was very comfortable. The exec lounge on the top floor was great, the breakfast buffet was first class also. The staff were always most helpful and willing to please. They all spoke first class English. The hotel is located a little further out from the centre than most others. But there are excellent tram links and a taxi is only about 8 euros. And walking to the Leidesplein is only 10 or so minutes. Overall, a definite recommendation from us

Reviews.Title: “Standard Chain Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ljanie
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just spent 3 nights at this hotel. Let me preface this with saying we normally stay in smaller, boutique hotels with a bit of character. This was our 3rd trip to Amsterdam and since my boyfriend was attending a conference at the hotel, it made sense to stay there. The rooms were very large, large windows in the room, a nice size bathroom and bathtub. A choice of pillows and soaps was even made available. The area was quiet - there were not a lot of restaurants or bars in the immediate vicinity. So if your looking for a happening night life, this is not the place to stay. The tram is a 5 minute walk away which was convenient. The hotel restaurant did not have the greatest selection of food and I wasn't impressed. I think what we found lacking was the lack of character in the rooms. They were "blah". We got a great deal on the room - 200 Euro a night so it was ok. However, I would not spend 400 Euro (published price) to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Operation”
Reviews.Author: Princess-Gadabout
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed in a Hotel with such a caring, friendly staff. Every employee -- from the maids to the wait staff to the desk clerks -- was genuinely happy and it showed. My husband and I were on our 20th Anniversity trip and used our Hilton Honors points to stay in this hotel. From the onset, we were treated like royalty, even though it was essentially a "free" stay. We had a suite, free breakfast buffet in the mornings and free drinks and snacks before dinner each night - on the 10th Floor. Even free room service for our breakfast on the last day there, as our flight left too early for the free breakfast buffet. Honestly, I did not want to leave. It was the most relaxing and enjoyable stay of our lives. Thank you to the staff and management of this hotel. It deserves 5 stars and if I had the vocabulary, I'd continue raving about this hotel. The stay has created some wonderful memories for us. I have even written the Hilton Corporate Office to express our delight in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Brussels-Chris
Reviews.Content: This is such a wonderfull hotel. I stayed there ont the 1st October. The rooms are splendid with a wonderfull garden view and sight on the canals. The breakfast buffet is splendid with everything you want and you need. This is a real five star hotel. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved the Amsterdam Hilton!”
Reviews.Author: VegasCanuck
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Amsterdam Hilton for three nights in August, 2006. The hotel is located 15-20 minutes (by tram) from the city center. I was concerned about the out-of-the-way location, but my worries were unnecessary. The neighborhood is delightful, definitely an upscale residential area with some pretty shops and restaurants nearby. It felt very peaceful and safe (and we are overly cautious when we travel). We found that the area surrounding the hotel was a nice respite after spending the day walking around the crowded and hectic (but fabulous) city center. Getting into the city center was a breeze. We took the #16 tram that stops about a block from the hotel. It takes about 15 minutes to get to the city center, passing a large museum campus on the way. I prefer taxis when traveling in cities that Iâ€˜m not familiar with but the tram was a delightful experience. We used it about 6 times and it was always easy and trouble free. The conductor/driver makes change on boardâ€¦it couldnâ€™t be more convenient! Thanks to the ease and convenience of the tram, we only used taxis to get to and from the airport. The hotel is quite modern, located on a quiet canal. The corner rooms have balconies. Our room was very comfortable, modern and clean with large windows that open. Very comfortable king bed, complimentary electronic safe, fluffy robe...great. High speed internet is very expensive at $34.85 USD per day! It is supplied by an outside company so the Hilton does not have direct control over it. Shocking priceâ€¦but not uncommon in some European hotels Iâ€™ve stayed at. As a Hilton Diamond member, we were given access to the Executive Lounge on the top floor. The evening hâ€™ors dâ€™ouvres were very nice as was the open bar. Breakfast was also offered in the lounge but because our room rate included the full buffet breakfast in the hotelâ€™s excellent restaurant, we chose to eat there. The breakfast buffet was superbâ€¦one of the best ever! If you have the option of booking a room that includes breakfast, I would highly recommend it. The hotel staff that we came in contact with were all so nice, especially the man and woman that were the breakfast hosts in the restaurant. Room service dinner from the Italian restaurant was excellent. It was truly fine Italian cuisine with a wonderful presentation. This hotel is located about 15 minutes from the airport. Basically in between the airport and the city center. Due to some major road construction, they have to detour quite a bit. The hotel lets guests know that these detours are legitimate and not due to unscrupulous cab drivers. This was our first time in Amsterdam and we loved it. Would I stay at the Amsterdam Hilton again? Yes!

Reviews.Title: “Really friendly, Great Neighborhood, Best Executive Lounge”
Reviews.Author: AndBeyond
Reviews.Content: While location and room quality usually rank highest in my hotel choices, I could not write this review without mentioning the extreme friendliness of this hotel and how this made our stay so wonderful. The people are really, really nice and made a terrific first impression! The hotel is quite comfortable, but not "luxurious" compared to other 5 star European hotels. However, the friendliness and superb executive lounge make this a great hotel choice. This beautiful tree-lined neighborhood is great - soothing and serene! My nicest canal photo was right behind the hotel and walks to the tram stop were so peaceful! The rooms are OK - orange & red is a strange color for hotel decor, but the beds are comfortable with crisp white down duvets and great views (even on the non-canal side). The executive lounge is fantastic - including hot breakfast entrees, a killer 360 degree view and a great staff. The evening canapes and desserts were great and access to the lounge made a huge difference in the quality of our stay. As per previous reviews, the trams will easily get you where you need to be and the hotel is ideal for those who will spend a few days at the nearby museums. The canal boat tour starts right behind the Rijks museum so this also got us around Amsterdam in addition to the trams. I usually prefer to stay close to city center, but loved the area of this hotel - Roberto's (hotel restaurant) is good and the hotel next door had a fantastic innovative restaurant with lots of well-heeled locals and it was easy to catch a tram to Leidesplein for dinner. Amsterdam is a young, hip city, but for those who prefer a less hectic atmosphere will appreciate the Hilton's location.

Reviews.Title: “nice, but not centrally located in the dam”
Reviews.Author: pkahle
Reviews.Content: used points for a weekend and this hotel exceeded expections. canal view is a must if you're going to stay this far from the city center. the tram helps getting anywhere easy/cheap, however realize you're in more of a upscale, inner neighborhood than a big city.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hilton I've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: JONBAX
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and for the first time ever came away with Not One problem. The staff were excellent, food great and location although approximately 20 minutes from the town centre by tram, suited us. The area is very relaxing witrh nice shops and restaurants. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cpmgrp
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam Hilton-Wonderful hotel Wonderful hotel with attentive staff, big rooms (and big prices to match). I was there on points and was kindly upgraded to executive level. The hotel is in a semi-suburban area just inside the outer ring. It has a lovely small marina in back and is directly on a canal. Be sure to ask for a canal-view room - it's a huge difference. Generally efficient and friendly staff. Nils has a good start on a successful career in the hospitality business. I got the impression that most of the staff was likewise from doorman to chambermaid. NOTE: If you are renting a car in The Netherlands, unless you are fluent in Dutch and know the city, leave it in the hotel car-park and take the tram when exploring Amsterdam, especially at night (do not ignore this advice). An observation about TripAdvisor (if youâ€™ve seen this in other of my posts, feel free to skip): I used it extensively when planning a last-minute 3-week trip to Europe, was very happy to have the service and felt I should pay back with my comments. I think you have to read between the lines and determine the type of traveler writing the review compared to your own type. Iâ€™ve stayed in places that were highly recommended and turned out to be terrible; and the reverse. Try to judge whether the contributor is complaining about a one-time, bad experience as a result of an inattentive employee as opposed to a basic fault with the property itself. If a restaurant manager was rude, so what. If the place floods, and smells -- thatâ€™s a different story.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: CenterMtraveler
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5 night stay at the Amsterdam Hilton. I guess I should say that I am not generally a Hilton sort of traveler, I prefer a small and intimate hotel, with some character of the area where I am staying. That's NOT the Hilton. But we were attending a family wedding in that neighborhood of Amsterdam, so that's where all the guests stayed. We paid a lot of money for a very ordinary hotel room. Lots of amenities, but do you need a pillow menu? Or a soap menu? ( The soap is then available for purchase at 17 euros, about $20 a bar!) Our buffet breakfast was included, and it was just fantastic, a wide selection of food, or they will cook to order what you want. But again, it's quite expensive, and if you just want a coffee and coissant type of breakfast, you are out of luck, especially on the weekend when their cafe is closed. The Hilton is in a quiet, safe, residential neighborhood, so not many restaurant choices nearby for breakfast or dinner. It's a bit of a hike to downtown tourist attractions. Public transportation is available, take the 24 or 16 tram. Canal-side view is gorgeous, and there are windows that actually open, so you can hear the churchbells ringing! No clock in the room, so bring your own alarm clock. Actually, there is a tiny alarm clock in the TV, ours went off at 6AM, and we couldn't figure out how to shut it off, needed to contact the tech person at the hotel! This Hilton seems ideal for business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Super location & Staff”
Reviews.Author: Emil48
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is in a great location and the staff was superior at trying to make our visit a really personnel affair,Making sure we were having a good time and providing information and instructions to make sure it was.

Reviews.Title: “Warm staff - except for people at the reception”
Reviews.Author: Chidda
Reviews.Content: I was there with my sister and her baby. They placed us in a Junior Suite. We have informed waaaay earlier that we would be checking in early (we arrived Schiphol at 6.35 am and was at the hotel at 9.30 am) Everyone was restless. The receptionists announced that they do not have a room prepared for us. How could that be? We had to call the person who had arranged our stay and liaised with their customer relation exec, and it goes on until noon! Above that, we were forced to take in an extra bed although we refused because the sofa is comfy enough for sleep and with the extra bed.. it'll only make the small room even smaller! I cant agree more, the hotel is most suitable for people on business trips. Our breakfast was at the Executive Lounge and there isnt much choice. Once, it was full and they transferred us to Roberto's. That's when we see real food! The fresh cuts,and salmons, and fried crispy potatoes, nyummy! Now, that's what I call a healthy breakfast. However, the room service ladies who comes in twice (once in the morning and another at night) were nice and friendly. They had to clean up the mess the baby did and they didnt put on a sour face. Always offering bottles of mineral waters and chocolates, I guess they know what makes the baby happy....

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, and way out of town!!”
Reviews.Author: g&z
Reviews.Content: We've never stayed at a Hilton before, but we managed to get a great rate by using a 'name your price' website... So we were looking forward to some major luxury at knock-down prices. Well, the hotel was nice, but it didn't live up to the Hilton 'hype' for me. It was just a typical business hotel. And the prices of absolutely everything (apart from the room!) were prohibitive. They obviously make their money on the extras... For example, it was the equivalent of GBP 6.50 for a small bottle of Coke and about GBP 9.50 for a bottle of beer!! Needless to say, we didn't eat or drink much at the hotel... The hotel is a bit too far out of town for you to be able to walk into town. We did walk it a couple of times, but it's better to just take the tram which stops very close to the hotel. Amsterdam was fantastic, and we had a blast!! Just a pity the Hilton was so far away from the centre of town, and that they're so obviously taking advantage of their guests by over-charging for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Top of the line but outside of town”
Reviews.Author: MaggieKatz
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay (May 2006) at the Hilton Amsterdam. The hotel itself comes with all the amenities of an American Hotel (large room, English TV, tub, nice sheets, etc) plus the extras (a pillow menu and soap menu). The doorman was the most friendly and helpful staff member to us. The rest of the staff was courteous but in a very professional, non-personal manner. There was a large convention at the hotel when we were there so the terrace as packed in the evening and the lobby and elevators were a madhouse the next day as everyone tried to check out. Be warned that the hotel is not very close to town. There are some cafes and shops that you can walk to and the Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh museum are walking distance but you need to take the tram to get further into the city. There were not many inexpensive options for breakfast, especially on the weekend when the hotel cafe was closed. If you go into this hotel knowing that you are trading off the luxury of the hotel for location then you will fully enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: dinos_chert
Reviews.Content: In my opinion Hilton Amsterdam is a nice hotel , which needs a little refurbishment (e.g office chair , table carpet etc was a little bit worn out- in my room of course and seems like 4- star in this aspect ). Otherwise the room was very clean very quiet and quite cosy. With respect to the personnel behaviour they were always available and ready to help. Breakfast was very nice and plentiful. The area as far as I am concerned was perfect, friendly people - very safe and very near to museumplein which I was interested in. Tram 16 does a very good job (as you walk outside the hotel you turn right and right again in the ACCENTURE building which is next to Robertos Restaurant - Tram Stop at the end of this 100m road). The metro is available in about 1000m distance ( in front of the hotel if you look straight you can see you will see a very tall building the WTC building which is the metro station). The metro station sells as well the 72 hours tram - metro - bus card which is most useful. In the hotel room there are available some nice magazines which gives the names of a few nice restaurants (since Dutch cuisine is not something to mention). If you like some ethnic cuisine you could visit the overtoom street (number 300 or 309) in which we ate ethiopian food - very nice and full of locals. Overall a very nice stay. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: sam364
Reviews.Content: My husband is a HHonors Gold member, and we used hotel rewards to stay here for 3 nights. We were not able to be upgraded since the hotel was full (a Gold perk), but they gave us complimentary breakfast for our stay instead. (That actually worked out well since the breakfast buffet cost â‚¬30!) I was unhappy with our room at first since we had specifically requested a room away from the elevator, and our room was right by it, but it was not noisy as I had expected. The room was very nice, roomy, and updated; it actually reminded us of the Hilton Tokyo Bay, where we stayed last year. We had a canal view, which was also very nice. The bathroom was a good size and included amenities like bath salts. There was also a menu for pillow selection, which, unfortunately, we didn't take advantage of, as well as nightly turn-down service. This was like heaven after the room we stayed in in Rome! The location was approx. 2 miles from the center of Amsterdam, and the hotel is situated in a quiet and an obviously wealthy neighborhood. The location was a little inconvenient at times, but the tram stop was a 5-minute walk from the hotel and took you to Museumplein, the Rijksmusem, Dam Square, and Centraal Station. However, it took time to get to the main area with all of the tram stops. Service was impeccable, just as it had been in Tokyo (American Hiltons could use a lesson from international ones). The staff was welcoming and accommodating; one of the bell hops was very helpful in getting us acquainted with the city and armed us with more maps and info than we actually used! This was one of the best Hiltons we've ever stayed in - an experience made sweeter by the fact that we used rewards. We would definitely stay here again, even if we had to pay next time!

Reviews.Title: “Management does not understand the ethos of customer service”
Reviews.Author: incyLondon
Reviews.Content: As a Diamond card and platinum Hilton credit card holder I spent 8 months there. The quality of the accommodation and furnishings is very good but unfortunately the service is not. One day I experienced a number of problems in a row and although in themselves they were not large, the attitude of Management and response was appalling. In essence, they felt they had not caused any of the problems and where they felt they fell down (very late room service) they believed that if they provide a meal free of charge, this resolves the situation. Most service people recognise that the solution is not a free meal but steps to ensure this does not happen again. In any case, a free meal is of no use to a traveller who wishes to eat before 9.30pm and go to sleep after a long day that started at 5am but was served after that time. In addition, re. the non-functioning TV, I was first accused of not knowing how to switch it on (after 8 months of stay) and then of causing the problem in the first place. Suffice to say, great hotel if you don't mind being insulted or offended. Even after my last mail where I made the comment that this confirms that customers are never right and that the hotel believes they lie, I did not receive a reaction to this.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hilton Experience”
Reviews.Author: whereyagoing
Reviews.Content: This was the best Hilton we have ever stayed at. Honestly, we had enough points for 6 free nights, but we were treated like royalty. The room was spacious with a great view of a canal. The HHonors suite was fantastic - with a generous assortment of appetizers nightly. Sometimes, that was our dinner! The hot breakfast was great as well. True, its location is a bit out of the way, but walking one long block to the bus was no problem. It lent itself to a bit of peace and quiet. Service was terrific. It rained and our umbrella broke - they gave us a Hilton oversized umbrella to use. Though it did not have a shuttle to and from the airport, the multi-hotel shuttle stopped right there. It is more a business hotel than tourist hotel but we preferred it to the B&B's we have stayed in close to the "action."

Reviews.Title: “Hard to Fault”
Reviews.Author: dicanio10
Reviews.Content: Just stayed for 3 nights at the Hilton and it is very hard to pick faults with the place. The one and only fault, if you can call it that, is that the hotel is around 3 kilometres from the action. For me, being set in a quiet, upmarket suburb was a bonus and although you have to look for them, there are a few nice restaurants nearby. The staff were impeccably friendly and efficient and gave the impression that they actually were concerned that you had a pleasant stay. As a Hilton Honors member, I was disappointed that I didn't get an upgrade but I was promised one for next month when I return for a conference plus free breakfast which wasn't cheap. As in most 5 star hotels the food is beyond most people's budgets so I would recommend going out of the hotel, turn left then left again over the bridge and keep walking for about 5 minutes and you will find a few very reasonable eating places. This is also the walking route to the Rijksmuseum and Museumplein and the Concertgebouw. Although the hotel is a long way out of town, it is around 20 minutes in the rush hour to the Centraal Station on the tram. Come out of the hotel and turn left then second left at the major junction to the bridge and you will find the stop for the numbers 5 and 24 trams. Both of them go to the town centre although the number 5 is the nicer route. The fare is EUR 1,60 each way and is much better than getting a taxi. From the airport, there is a hotel shuttle service costing EUR 12,00 each way which will drop you at the hotel you are staying at. This is to be found on Schipol Plaza and is very convenient. The alternative is taking the train to Centraal Station and taking the tram. Depends how tired you are. As for Amsterdam itself, I have travelled all around western and eastern Europe and Amsterdam is probably my least favourite European city. It looks tacky and grubby and is probably best summed up by the red light district which is like peeking in at an old people's home. The whole place is there just for the tourist Pound/Dollar/Euro/Yen. In summary, hotel was top notch, area was quiet and suburban, staff were great but city left something to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KristaInLondon
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a one night stay at the Hilton in Amsterdam. It was a 25 euro ride from the Airport--only took about 10 or 15 minutes. The hotel is definitely swish. Very business-y. Beautiful lobby. I was a bit peeved because I booked a non-smoking room on Expedia and when I checked in at 8 p.m., I was informed that they only has smoking rooms available. Luckily, besides for a faint whiff of stale smoke from the pillows, you couldn't really tell. The hotel has wireless Internet, but it cost something like 25 euros for 24 hours. I think this is amusing because there are lesser hotels offering free wireless. And there's always the option of me wandering the streets with my laptop, looking for an unsecured spot. The room was really nice and modern and clean. The bed linens were very crisp, with none of those gross hotel bedspreads they put on the beds in the US. The bed was very comfortable and did not feel like it had been slept in by 20 million people before me. I ordered the green thai curry from room service--there are not many restaurants in the area in walking distance--and it was actually really good. Only set me back 31 euros. :( No wine in the minibar. Just beer, cokes, and liquor. Bathroom was spotless with all the usual amenities. I'm not a huge fan of the shampoo in a tube stuff though; I wish they'd upgrade. You know they just refill those. I then took a taxi over to the office park that's close to the football stadium and ING. I think this cost me about 20 euro. All in all, very comfy, clean, modern, normal. Not aching with character, but there are worse things. I definitely would vote for this as a business hotel as opposed to a tourist hotel because I don't think it's very central.

Reviews.Title: “To Far Out”
Reviews.Author: twinkles
Reviews.Content: I booked at the Amsterdam Hilton after reading all the reviews here and deciding that it wasn't going to be a problem. My girlfriend an I stayed 5 nights here. She made the best of it saying "it makes us walk and get exercise." The Hilton is a nice hotel. Very nice for a Hilton with very large rooms for Europe, but you better be ready to walk a lot. We rode the tram the first day, but decided that waiting for it was more trouble than just walking. My guess is that over the course of the five day stay, we ended up walking 50 miles in total. (I am a regular hiker, so I am pretty familar with my walking speed. We were doing right about 3 miles an hour and walked three to five hours each day.)

Reviews.Title: “Best Hilton I've stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: Alun4475
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights at this hotel with my wife and it was easily the best that I've encountered from this chain. The hotel is in a really good location, just 10 minutes or so by taxi from the airport. It is in a nice area and we felt safe walking around. The hotel is only about 10-15 minutes level walk from the Van Gogh and Rijjksmuseum, and the nice shops. It is by no means in the centre, but I wouldn't say it was remote either. Our room had a city view and was well equipped despite not being a deluxe or anything like that. It was clean, modern and airy. This is also the only hotel which I've been to abroad which had BBC1 on the TV rather than just BBC World. Not that important I know, but at least we didn't miss Bleak House! The staff - and in fact all the locals we encountered - were all extremely friendly and we didn't get any of the forced "have a nice day" stuff of some other places we've been. The restaurant - Roberto's - was fantastic and there was a really good selection at both breakfast and dinner. As mentioned by a previous reviewer, room service was also excellent in both selection and quality. All in all, a brilliant short break and I would recommend it to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Lady-Wales
Reviews.Content: After an 8 hour delay leaving Cardiff because of snow we were late arriving to Amsterdam. We booked the Airport Hotel Shuttle bus at the Tourist Information desk at Arrivals in Schiphol (also we bought our 3day bus/tram ticket),The shuttle bus had us at the Hilton in about 10 minutes.The check in was fast and the staff everywhere in the hotel are amazingly friendly and helpful. We had dinner in Robertos.On Friday nights they have Fish Night which is fantastic, There is a cold buffet spread, then fish soup,then you choose your fish for main course which is cooked to your liking.There must have been at least a dozen different fish and the young Canadian chef was very helpful with choosing and advice. Plus as much wine as you liked to drink ! The next morning we went for breakast (included) I have never seen such a spread, absolutely everything you can imagine even champagne ! The pancakes are to die for, any type of egg cooked for you. Anything you want, nothing is too much trouble , the staff are incredible.We had trouble eating again even at 8pm! Ask anything at the Concierge they are amazing with maps and knowledge esp Dwight and also Gio who helped us to internet check in our return flight and also booked our return shuttle to the airport. The room was small but perfectly formed !Inc tea and coffee making facilities, it had almost everything and was spotless. Only slippers and dressing gowns were missing. The only disappointment for us was that as HHonour members we were not upgraded to the Executive floor ,although we were given a small cake for our Anniversary celebrations. Yes the hotel is a little out of the centre but the tram is close, frequent and fast even on Sundays. We would happily stay again.

HotelInfo.Name: Hilton Amsterdam
HotelInfo.Address: Apollolaan 138, Amsterdam 1077 BG, The Netherlands
